story:
Cody Westphal was diagnosed with a rare form of cancer called Rhabdomyosarcoma at a few weeks of age. After multiple failed attempts to treat the cancer in Rochester, Cody and his family traveled to NYC for treatment.

The physicians in NYC were eventually able to find a chemotherapy that was successful in shrinking Cody's tumor and he was able to have surgery to remove him tumor. Unfortunatley, Cody did lose his bladder and prostate in the surgery. If you know Cody, you know that this has not stopped him.

After his initial sugery Cody under went months of chemotherapy and radiation. The long term effects of chemo and radition in a child so small were unknown, but Cody did not have a choice.

Cody will be turning 5 this summer. If you don't know him, he is the cuttie on the left in the picture above. He is cancer free, and this summer after scans he will be considered cured.

Cody has been struggling with the effects of his treatment. Lately he has been experiencing alot of abdominal pain. It was discovered , while at a bowel managment program in Ohio, that Cody has damage to his colon from the radiation he received in treatment. He will need to have a series of surgeries to correct this damage and repair his colon. He also will have to have a bladder created since he is outgrowing his current correction for this.

Cody has to make multiple trips to Ohio and will need to stay for a month after his second surgery. As you can imagine, the multiple trips and stays in Ohio will be costly for Cody and his family.

Let's help Cody and his family!

www.caringbridge.org/visit/codywestphal

story:
Our Goal

Your donations will help subsidize 200 wheelchairs for kids who cannot afford them! Find out more at http://www.arsobo.org.

The Project

To give the gift of mobility to children and young adults with birth defects or permanent injuries who need a special wheelchair to do the things others can do.

Non-mobile children are too often stuck at home unable to get to school or to play with their friends. No child deserves to be confined to their home. A wheelchair for a child who is unable to walk allows for an escape and an entrance to a child’s world.

Non-mobile young adults are trapped in an unnatural life at home with little chance to get out. They want to find work and to become a part of society and contribute.

However a conventional wheelchair is not the answer when the walkways are rough, the sidewalks uneven and filled with holes

Enter the RoughRider, a specially designed all-terrain wheelchair. Rough surfaces, grates in the road, roots and rocks in the ‘off road’, sandy or wet soil are no match for the RoughRider. It goes where no other wheelchair goes. The All-Terrain Wheelchair Shop (Sillas de Ruedas Todo Terreno) in Nogales, Sonora, Mexico is a not-for-profit shop that employs wheelchair users to build wheelchairs from scratch. Some chairs are a standard model and others are customized to fit the specific needs of each special rider.

We are asking for donations to subsidize the materials and labor to construct these chairs for children and adults in need. Even though the chairs are sold at cost and the price is low, many families cannot afford the full price but each family will be asked to pay something to establish pride of ownership

Our goal is $50,000 by December 31, 2012.

  • All donated money goes directly to subsidize the purchase of the chair and enables families to obtain a chair for the person in their lives who is in great need and wants to become more active and engaged.
  • The money will subsidize 200 customized chairs!

The Wheelchair Shop

Started in 2011, The All-Terrain Wheelchair Shop in Nogales, Sonora builds standard and customized RoughRider™ Wheelchairs.  The all-terrain wheelchair was designed by Ralph Hotchkiss at Whirlwind Wheelchair International at San Francisco State University in the United States.  Despite its low cost (approximately one-quarter of what high quality conventional wheelchairs cost), it is still out of the financial reach of many families whose loved one needs this chair.

View the recent Arizona Public Media story on the fundraising effort for the All Terrain Wheelchair shop.

Who are We?

ARSOBO (Arizona-Sonora Border) is a not-for-profit, non-governmental, Mexican organization focused on alleviating the physical, psychological, and economical barriers faced by individuals with disabilities by providing high-tech, low-cost medical devices that minimize their disability. Please visit our website to find out more about our efforts.

Our Philosophy

  1. A not-for-profit 'social business’ (the bottom line is for social good not for financial gain)

  2. Hire those with limitations to construct the medical device they use or need

  3. Charge an amount for the medical device to insure ownership and maintain a sense of dignity but charge only what the family can afford (subsidies from good people like you will pay the rest)

Other Ways You Can Help

Please get the word out about our campaign. Use the Indiegogo sharing tools to link to your social media accounts. You know the typical, Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr or surprise us.

The children thank you, those in need thank you, their families thank you, and we thank you for your help.

story: Short SummaryJames is my boyfriend of 8  years, in 2010 he had pain in his side, went to the ER, where they discovered a 6cm tumor on his left kidney, he also had a lump in the center of his chest, they did a biopsy, came back he had stage 4 lymphoma, the did the normal routine of chemo for 6 months, while getting chemo, the tumor continued to grow, after chemo was finished, they removed his kidney and a 10cm cancer tumor..so James at 43 yrs old had 2 cancers, a month after removing the kidney and tumor, james went for another scan, this time showed tumors on his hip...Scared YES....his oncologist said his renal cell carcinoma has spread, NO CURE...i was not buying that..he's a fighter, we will fight, we went to Shands, met with so many different doctors, they did a bone biopsy, which hurt him bad, biopsy came back the lymphoma was back and aggressive, only choice now was to get radiation to shrink  the tumors, and then go for a bone marrow transplant...James was let go of his job as he was unable to work, lost his insurance, we got on emergency medicaid to get these treatments, his medicines alone each month are over 400.00...in Feb 2012 James was admitted into  Shands BMT unit, for the transplant...he had the transplant done in March 2012, lots of ups & downs with the chemo treatments, transfusions, low blood counts, you name it James went thru it...now since he is on disablitly the state of Florida has taken away his medical insurance, noone will insure him as he has cancer, he can't get his medicines that he needs in order to live ...he can't get his scans, blood work or anymore treatments as he cant afford it...he still is very sick and has to be very careful but without his medicines and treatment, he's never going to get better...since James was first diagnosed with not one but TWO cancers, he's lost his car, his job, his insurance, his will to live, his apartment, YET the government will help other people but not one who is sick with cancer....we've gone to numerous cancer sites and asked for help and we were told because he's not on a kidney transplant list, they can't help..I just want him to get better and end this terrible nightmare....he is trying each day to fight the pain and being so tired, and will always say he's ok, but in reality he's not...for the next year he has to continue with treatments and medicine, but as of right now, he can't, he hasn't taken his medicine and a little sniffle will kill him....so this is his story....feel free to talk to James anytime on his facebook account....God Bless

story:
The Story

Ted "Tetris" Morgan has been in the entertainment industry for nearly 15 years, touring the country with multiple large acts and taking the world on by storm.  He has a passion to work in the entertainment industry rivaled by few and loves every moment.  He has spent his years traveling and not only working behind the scenes but also giving to the people he works with.  Many people that know Ted will do anything he can for anyone that has a need.  Now he needs your help!

  On October 15th, Ted was diagnosed with Stage 2 Non-Hodgekins Burkitt's Lymphoma as a result from a trip to the hospital for what he thought was his Crohns disease flare-up.  Shortly thereafter in a follow-up visit, he was advanced to Stage 3 and given less than 6 months to beat this.  Being a freelance guy, Ted of course doesn't have health insurance, and as result has limited treatment options.  Florida Hospital and Johnson & Johnson have taken on his initial case, but are only able to offer the basic treatments in the program.  With these treatments, Ted will have a little time left to bring his sarcastic and asshole self to the world.

The Need & Goal

 There is hope though, Pfizer has offered Ted a program with one of their drugs that has a proven track record and an 80% remission rate for patients with Lymphoma.  Unfortunately to get in the program, Phizer needs a down payment of $5000.  After Ted is in the program, they will work on the continued payments.  This campaign is to raise the money to get Ted into the program as well as help cover his living expenses during his treatment schedule.  We are hoping that we will exceed our goal which will only cover his medical expenses so that Ted has the money to live in Orlando where his treatments are.  We are hoping to reach out to the people Ted has worked with and impacted over the years and ask for your help to keep Teds smiling face around.  Your contribution, be it even a dollar, will help go to getting Ted the treatment he needs and the support you show will help him take on this treatment. 

The Schedule

 Ted has already begun his chemo treatment, by both oral and infusion treatments.  He has insisted on doing a one last hoorah tour with the band Epica this month but beginning the first week of December, his life will change.  He will begin infusions 3 times a week in order to keep the cancer under control.  Depending on this campaign, Ted is hoping to be able to start the next set of treatments beginning mid-December.  During the treatments, Ted will be unable to travel but has insisted on trying to be independant and will continue to try and freelance depending on his ability.  According to the doctors, he will be very tired all the time and have limited mobility.  He will need not only the financial support, but emotional as well.  Please feel free to contact him via Facebook and even if you can't give anything, a positive note to him will mean a lot!

With your help, lets help get Ted the treatment it needs and help relieve the stress of finances and working while he undergoes treatment.  With your contribution, either financially or emotionally, we can help Ted beat this thing that the doctors have given him grim outlook on!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are in a band or have access to a band, we are looking for small merch items (such as CD's or T-shirts) or larger items (such as autographed items) that you would be willing to donate, we are using the items as "Perks" for people as Ted refused to take any financial help unless he was able to give something back to the people.  Please email BmooreFL@gmail.com

story:
No matter the diagnosis there is ALWAYS hope ! Campaign.

My name is Tanessa Tilsley, I am 21 years old. My Dad, Rodney Tilsley was born April 6 1964.

My dad had been having stomach issues for quite awhile, he thought it was just simply due too stress, but he went into the doctors regularly to find out what was going on, they kept telling him he just had stomach ulcers, and to take these new medications and he would be fine in about two weeks. well the medicine never worked and he always went back, and they kept changing his meds hoping something would work.

Eventually a doctor suggested a blood test just too check and make sure everything was ok. Shortly after on June 14th (three days after my 20th birthday) my dad got the call that he had stage four pancreatic cancer, and the chances of him living more than a year were about 5%. My dad stayed extreamly optomistic and kept staying strong. He had just fallen in love with this women named Andrea who changed his life completly and couldnt imagine leaving her, as well as I just had my second baby, so there was alot going on for him too be quite happy about.

August he married the love of his life, in his back yard, it was beautiful, and his wish of making Andrea a Tilsley was acomplished. 

In September, he was hospitalized for ten days due too catching pnemonea in Victoria on their honeymoon. The doctors didn't think there was any chances of improvment so they sent him home. 

October 5th 2011 the home nurse came too the house where he was now being taken care of, and said she didnt think he was going to live more than a few hours. October 7th 2011 I headed down too Victoria to get married, we had planned it so he could be there, because to both me and my dad the most important thing to either of us was for him too be there, sadly he couldnt be but i know he was in spirit. October 8th i came home, went to his house sat beside his bed and told him about the wedding. he smiled which he hadnt been responsive since wednesday, and then his body started too shut down. My dad waited for me too come home too say goodbye. 

My dad was 47 years old when he passed away. October 8th was the day i lost my best friend. and would never get another chance to hug him and hear him say i love you. It's been extreamly hard to deal with. 

But through pain comes hope, and comes strength. the things he taught me i had too hold onto so tightly. and with that, since he passed away just through my community i have been raising money through collecting bottles and was donating to "relay for life" i had raised $500+ along side my friend Janelle Vananrooy and step mom Andrea. My goal as you can see is too raise at least $1000 and donate it too pancreatic cancer canada. 

My campaign is too raise money for hope. To raise money so one day a little girl doesnt have to say goodbye to her best friend like i had too. It's too raise money for a cause which hasnt had any improvments in funding in the last forty years. 

If you donate you will be helping so that doctors might be able too find at least early symptoms of the disease. anything. Also all money thats donated a portion goes towards people in the comox valley and around canada who drive cancer patients and a loved one too the nearest hospital, for us, we live in courtenay and the closest one is a three hour drive too victoria, so thats 100 in gas just for my dad any time he had an appointment. 

What We Need

What we need is any donations towards www.pancreaticcancercanada.ca 

Also, if you dont want too donate here, but would like to donate, try having a purple party, invite people by donations and donate all the money too the sites donation page, or collect bottles in your town, or even just bring in your own bottles and send whatever money you can afford to do towards this site. 

Those are the three ways i try and make a difference.

story:
What is [rgp]?

[rgp] stands for Reporting on Ghana's Presidency. The purpose of the news blog site will be to inform, educate and inspire all Africans on the top leadership job in Ghana.

How will it be different from other blogs and news sites?

Reporting on Ghana's Presidency news site is going to take a multi-media/multi-platform approach where we feature recorded speech snippets and analytical, easy-to-comprehend articles that report the weekly activities of the President with professional pictures and weekly video updates. We will include informal elements by interviewing and featuring students and young professionals on each weekly update to share a role or responsibility or request for the office of the presidency. On a monthly basis, we will inquire lifestyle preferences from the The Castle, Osu like the literary and musical influences of whoever the sitting President is.


We are confident that by soliciting ideas from citizens and sharing some of the roles and responsibilities of the office, a by-product will be that many students will aspire to be the next President with a better understandiong of the leadership traits and characteristics required to do so. The launch date for the [rgp] website www.reportingghanapresidency.com coinicides with the first round of presidential elections on December 7th, 2012.

How will your support help [rgp]?

First off, a majority of what you raise will go towards the main news site, creating a modern, easy to use blogsite that works on different computer operating systems and mobile devices. The countdown for the site launch has begun and we're expecting to go live on December 7th, 2012. www.reportingghanapresidency.com
 
Equipment costs: A huge chunk of the money will go towards equipment upgrades. Quality video equipment is costly and we look to document interviews with students and professionals alike to maintain the interactive feel and intent of the site.
 
Travel & staff costs: We will run a lean operation. As the lead, Emmanuel A. Gamor will bring his photojournalism & reporting expertise to the table but along the way we'll need help with video recording, editing and assistance covering important events the President hosts or attends across the country.
 

The Impact

In the midst of all the devisive political rhetoric, [rgp] will seek to highlight the leadership qualities that make a successful president in sub-Saharan Africa in a non-partisan unbiased way; and encourage students to identify and develop these characteristics. Reporting on Ghana's Presidency will be a refreshing take on Ghanaian & African politics.

Other Ways You Can Help

For those who may not be able to contribute to the fundraiser we would greatly appreciate you sharing the link with people who may be interested in positive journalism that explores African politics.

Once the website is launched, we'd appreciate feedback, comments, questions & concerns.

About Emmanuel A. Gamor:

Managing Editor for The New Ghanaian Newspaper. Dreamer & Mentor on the [y] network. Photographer at itake photos est. 1985. Radio host (alias Komla) on Sunlight Radio. Big brother & summer project collaborator. Lead hero at Iota 300. Reporter | blogger at [rgp].

What you get when you donate:

Our Black Star ($500+) contributors get all the perks we're offering plus limited edition t-shirts by FOOLIES.

On a monthly basis, we will inquire lifestyle preferences from the The Castle, Osu like the literary and musical influences of whoever the sitting President is.
 We are confident that by soliciting ideas from citizens and sharing some of the roles and responsibilities of the office, a by-product will be that many students will aspire to be the next President with a better understandiong of the leadership traits and characteristics required to do so. The launch date for the [rgp] website www.reportingghanapresidency.com coinicides with the first round of presidential elections on December 7th, 2012.
How will your support help [rgp]?
First off, a majority of what you raise will go towards the main news site, creating a modern, easy to use blogsite that works on different computer operating systems and mobile devices. The countdown for the site launch has begun and we're expecting to go live on December 7th, 2012. www.reportingghanapresidency.com

 

Equipment costs: A huge chunk of the money will go towards equipment upgrades. Quality video equipment is costly and we look to document interviews with students and professionals alike to maintain the interactive feel and intent of the site.
 

Travel & staff costs: We will run a lean operation. As the lead, Emmanuel A. Gamor will bring his photojournalism & reporting expertise to the table but along the way we'll need help with video recording, editing and assistance covering important events the President hosts or attends across the country.
 

The Impact
In the midst of all the devisive political rhetoric, [rgp] will seek to highlight the leadership qualities that make a successful president in sub-Saharan Africa in a non-partisan unbiased way; and encourage students to identify and develop these characteristics. Reporting on Ghana's Presidency will be a refreshing take on Ghanaian & African politics.

Other Ways You Can Help
For those who may not be able to contribute to the fundraiser we would greatly appreciate you sharing the link with people who may be interested in positive journalism that explores African politics.
Once the website is launched, we'd appreciate feedback, comments, questions & concerns.

About Emmanuel A. Gamor:
Managing Editor for The New Ghanaian Newspaper. Dreamer & Mentor on the [y] network. Photographer at itake photos est. 1985. Radio host (alias Komla) on Sunlight Radio. Big brother & summer project collaborator. Lead hero at Iota 300. Reporter | blogger at [rgp].
What you get when you donate:
Our Black Star ($500+) contributors get all the perks we're offering plus limited edition t-shirts by FOOLIES.

story:
Are you slouching over your computer all day?

Do you feel like your posture is deteriorating and you have no solution? 

This is your solution and it is instant and easy to use. 

The Perfectore Posture Transformer has been developed specifically to assist you in sitting and standing up straight.  It is a tool that makes proper spinal alignment and achieving optimum core strength effortless. The Posture Transformer uses the natural law of opposing forces to shift your body into proper posture, relieving up to 70 lbs of excess pressure from the neck, shoulders and back. You feel weightless and function better.  

No longer do you have to struggle to hold your body up throughout the day.  

You breathe more deeply, your vital organs have more room to function, your performance is improved, your productivity is increased and you look and feel better instantly.

Develop posture strength in only 1 hour a day

Finally your solution to STOP SLOUCHING and achieve posture strength for life!

Perfectore's "Wearable Strength Anti-Gravity Gear”  

This product line is specifically designed to enhance performance and improve lives by changing the way humans relate to gravity. 

The Posture Transformer instantly lifts your body into optimum alignment ensuring improved mental and physical performance while sitting, standing or moving & The Antigravity Back Pack, an attachable accessory perfect for improving your posture while walking, jogging or recreational activities.

A solution for:

  • Slouching

  • Neck Strain

  • Back Strain

  • Shoulder Pain or Injury

  • Compressed Organs

  • Compressed vertabra

  • Poor Digestion

  • Shallow Breathing

  • Spinal Degeneration

  • Cervical Stress Disorder

  

BASED ON A COMBINATION OF PROVEN SCIENCES

 

Instant Bio-Chemical Results

Instant Improvement Spine Alignment

Instantly Improves Balance

 

Doctor Approved

 

 Instant Results for Everybody! 

Advanced posture support instantly lifts the body into proper alignment reducing strain & excess pressure on your spine, improving performance for every user.

 

A wearable exercise based on the proven rehabilitative methods of elastic resistance training.

Flex and stretch throughout your day to increase circulation and flexibility

The Perfectore Team

Collon Brown, Founder & Designer

Marina Prospero, Founder & Posture Specialist

Greetings fellow Earthlings,

We have applied thousands of suggestions from our customers to the design and function of these products and are 100% confident that they will provide you with an awesome experience. We have already sold 7500 Posture Transformers and finally answered everyone's request to create a custom backpack.  Now we are ready to go Global and kickoff the brand.  Help us support you in strong posture for life with awesome gear.  The Posture Transformer and Antigravity BackPack are just the tip of the iceburg!!

Change your posture change your life! 

 

Start your collection today... 

We deliver in October 2013 just in time for the holidays. 

 

 The REWARDS

story:
Let's Help Diane Get Her Life Back On Track

As most of us know, and for those of you who do not, Diane has been hit with mini series of bad situations.  Soon she has to be out of the house she has been living in due to unforeseen circumstances which is weighing heavy on her soul.  To top that off, she is now out of work due to a terrible fall she took during a skiing accident and shattered her right upper arm which has made it impossible for her to work as one of the most amazing hairstylists you'll ever know.

Diane has the heart and soul of the best friend, sister, daughter and mother you could ever know.  She is the kind of person who does so much for everyone else always out of the goodness of her heart.  Now she needs our help!  Since she will be out of work for at least a couple of months and soon to be homeless for herself and her 2 sons, we need to try to raise as much money as we can to help her pay medical bills, pay rent for her workplace and hopefully find new living accomodations. 

Diane is the most loving, giving person I know and anything we can do to help give back would be a blessing.  Let's all help Diane get back the life she loves and deserves!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please pass on this campaign information to anyone you think can help by using the Indiegogo share tools.

Thank you very much for you kind consideration!

Sincerely yours,

Tammy Phelps-Gainer, Jackie Dollerhyde, Kristina Frost and Kim Tutor

story:
Short Summary

Destiny's story starts centuries ago and thousands of miles away:

As the Arctic ice cap has melted, the planet's coldest, purest water has plunged to the bottom of the ocean and traveled around the globe as a suboceanic aquifer. Moving through the Pacific, this current of cold, pure water it is drawn by the warmer, volcano-heated waters toward the Hawaiian island chain, where it passes close enough to civilization that man can harvest it.

Destiny has obtained harvest rights to this water, developed a patented purification and desalination process that removes the salty taste while leaving in the naturally occurring 90 vital trace minerals, and is now bottling the world's purest and most nutrient rich water.

  • People around the world have sampled Destiny Deep Sea Water. They love it as much as we do! In fact, our friends in Asia are telling us they need millions of bottles a month to quench their thirst for hard-to-find drinking water.

To meet the demand, we need to expand our small, state-of-the-art water processing plant on the Kona Coast of the Big Island of Hawai'i. Then, we can take orders for millions of bottles from our thirsty friends on the Asian continent, and you!

The story doesn't end there. We want Destiny Water to nourish a thirsty world. That's why we pour a portion of our proceeds into humanitarian work that's teaching villagers in Ethiopia to build sustainable lives for themselves, their families, and their communities.

This is not a charity! This is a modern-day business model, making amazing things happen in one of the world's most impoverished places.

Destiny, through the "Deep Frontier" project, is creating jobs for villagers who've never had a way to earn an income. Those villagers are learning modern agriculture and animal husbandry. They're growing and harvesting crops never before possible in that region of the world. They're working in co-ops to build adequate housing, community meeting places, a soccer field, and most importantly for them, schools.

In two years, our work will be complete in the Ethiopian village where we're working now. Then, depending on how successful we are at growing Destiny Deep Sea Water, we'll flow the love around the world!

What We Need & What You Get

  • Water is becoming more valuable than oil on many continents that simply do not have the same access that we have in North America.  Even worse, the water they have is not nutritious, and lacks many qualities that we take for granted.
  • Our process is unique in the water industry.  We de-salinate while retaining the original minerals.  To get our unique water to the people who desperately need it in Asia and Africa we must upgrade the process which will also drive down our costs which better allows us to push this product to these continents that so badly need it.
  • For your investment we have a several gifts that will be provided our investors.  At the highest level our investors will join us either in Hawaii or Ethiopia depending on the contribution

The Impact

  • Your contribution will allow us to get our improve our state-of-the-art de-salination process, and also drive down the cost which will enable our water to be sold in the undernourished continents of Asia and Africa.
  • My partner and I have built 6 water plants that were very successful providing water to the troops in Iraq.  We have brought in water processing equipment from around the world to accomplish our objectives.
  • Proceeds from our efforts into Asia will be invested into the Arise project in Ethiopia.  This is a project that has proven to lift an entire village as we focus on building families.

Other Ways You Can Help

This water is being touted by Health and Wellness enthusiasts around the world. Additionally, Athletes and Doctors are joining the throng - The single largest expense is Marketing - which simply put means that we need to get the word out.

Please look into our web-site and social media sites, and help us spread the word of this incredible water that is being used to not only hydrate those looking for a better water, but also lift the undernourished continents to a place where they  can be self-sufficient.

Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Cryxon® is the first complex device that combines the beneficial effects of crystal, colour and light therapy which have been known because of their positive, healing effects for thousands of years. The human organs are vibrating at different frequencies. In case of tiredness or illness, this frequency drops. With our device we can increase the level of the sick body part’s frequency back to normal and with the help of crystals, colours and lights it supports the sick body towards self-healing process.

Its specialities are the fully digital control, the seven selectable colour therapies and the five different interchangeable crystal heads. Cryxon® is suitable for maintaining health as well as for using it as a complementary device to conventional medical treatments.

WHY IS CRYXON® CRYSTAL LIGHT THERAPY A REVOLUTIONARY DEVICE?

Our development team has realized that the beneficial effects of crystal, colour and light therapy can be increased, as a result of a synergy effect, when their strengths are added together. 

The crystals of the device can be exchanged with a few simple actions, so its user can choose the most appropriate crystal head to his treatment. Thanks to the light-mixing technology, the device can produce all the chakra colours, therefore it further increases the efficiency of the device.


CRYXON®: INNOVATIVE TECHNOLOGY,
EASY USE

Excellent neuropaths and skilled engineers worked together on developing our revolutionary device so that three years later the Cryxon® could be born as a result. Our device has a TÜV certificate of conformity. We are proud that our product has been 100% designed, developed and produced in the EU.

PREMIUM QUALITY, SOPHISTICATED DESIGN

The product has been 100% designed, developed and produced in the EU. The crystal lamp can be used with five different crystal heads. For the different variations experts have developed an easy to open and reclose, but yet safe packaging with a flip top construction. The smaller folding carton is in harmony with graphic design and with surface treatment of the main folding carton made from corrugated board.

 

THOSE WHO HAVE EVER TRIED CRYXON® CRYSTAL LAMP

INTERNATIONAL RECOGNITION

The Cryxon® crystal lamp was launched at three different exhibitions at the end 2013.   

IENA Nuremberg 2013                                                                                                      

INFA Hannover 2013

Gesund & Wellness Wien 2013


WHY DO WE NEED INDIEGOGO AND YOU?

With three years of hard development behind us, our work was not in vain, since the birth of Cryxon®. Many people have tried the prototype and we have received very positive feedback.

Now it is the time to let the beneficial effects of crystal, colour and light therapy more widely known across the world with Cryxon®’s help.

Although it was a long road so far, it does not end here yet. In order to really reach a lot of people, further clinical tests are needed, and then we will be able to prove the crystal lamp’s impact on maintaining health. Unfortunately, these are not cheap.

We also need financial support to begin mass production of Cryxon®, and to do this we do not have currently sufficient financial means.

We thank you for your faith in us and for supporting our Cryxon® project.

If you would need any news or further information about Cryxon®, please do not hesitate to contact us. 

Email: andrea@cryxon.com

Web: www.cryxon.com

story:
We Need Your Help

EVERY VOICE MATTERS!

My journey to increase awareness of pelvic organ prolapse (POP) began with my diagnosis in December 2007. Like most women, I'd had never heard of pelvic organ prolapse, and had no idea that: 

  •  1/3 to 1/2 the female population suffers in silence with POP symptoms. 
  • Childbirth and menopause are common POP causes, and aggressive athletic activities, constipation, chronic coughing, genetics, hysterectomy, neuromuscular diseases, and heavy lifting are POP causes as well. 
  • Women of ALL ages experience POP. 

         The Most Common POP Symptoms:

Women need to know signs and symptoms of pelvic organ prolapse, ALL women. While marketing my book Pelvic Organ Prolapse: The Silent Epidemic to share what I'd learned on my journey, I recognized something more needed to be done to generate awareness and provide guidance and support for women navigating POP. Association for Pelvic Organ Prolapse Support (APOPS), a US based 501(c)(3) with international arms, was born in 2010.

POP has been on medical record for over 4000 years and is still not talked about out loud because stigma keeps embarrassing symptoms hidden behind closed doors. We must continue to talk out loud and share POP information until it becomes common knowledge for all women.

                  Who Should Join STIGMA*STRIDE                                        EVERY VOICE MATTERS!

  • Women with pelvic organ prolapse. 
  • Advocacy providing support and guidance for women's pelvic health. 
  • Healthcare practitioners treating POP.
  • Industry evolving tools and treatments. 
  • Research exploring the POP frontier.
  • Academia educating practitioners.
  • Media providing exposure. 
We must all come together to generate the next big shift in women's health awareness. The time for change is NOW. As we all start talking about POP out loud, women will recognize POP symptoms, healthcare will start routinely screening for POP,  education, research, and media exposure will increase, and every sector engaged in the POP arena will evolve. 

                       What is STIGMA*STRIDE                                                   EVERY VOICE MATTERS!

 STIGMA*STRIDE   will bridge the world with an international Walkathon/Giving Day to break down the shroud of stigma that has kept pelvic organ prolapse and incontinence hidden behind closed doors. APOPS will host the mother walkathon in the Milwaukee, WI. The vision is to springboard at least 20 walkathons in the US, 5 walkathons in other countries, and a multitude of individual online giving days and other fundraising events during June 2015, POP Awareness Month, to generate awareness, inspire dialogue, and provide funding to evolve projects and programs in APOPS pipeline. Our budget to host our first STIGMA*STRIDE is $17,950. Funds generated in excess of event expenses will go toward tooling for our International POP Awareness Campaign.

Your generous contributions will fund STIGMA*STRIDE event expenses including:

  • Facility costs.
  • Publicity and marketing.
  • Fees/licenses/insurance.
  • Print materials.
  • Sound system/media exposure.
  • Detailed project proposal and budget available for download.

                           Why STIGMA*STRIDE                                                       EVERY VOICE MATTERS! 

As we generate awareness and talk out loud about pelvic organ prolapse and embarrassing symptoms such as incontinence, the stigma will soften  and women will recognize POP symptoms, enabling them to get early diagnosis and treatment. STIGMA*STRIDE is a large first step to improve women's pelvic health in the global community. APOPS initiatives are:

  • Generate global awareness.
  • Provide guidance and support for women with POP.
  • Bridge patients/practitioners.
  • Establish value of routine POP screening standards.
  • Capture accurate POP statistical data (App).
  • WHEN developing zone program (Women's Health and Empowerment Network).

                                How Can I Help?                                                          EVERY VOICE MATTERS! 

APOPS stance is the only way to reduce stigma is to talk about POP and incontinence out loud and this event is the platform! Join the cause; join us in Milwaukee or host a STIGMA*STRIDE event; check out our Host a Fundraiser page for ideas. Register your Event to participate in STIGMA*STRIDE and have your event posted to our Event page. Also consider: 

  • Sponsor STIGMA*STRIDE.
  • Endorse STIGMA*STRIDE.
  • Host a STIGMA*STRIDE event.
  • Make some noise; use social media to share STIGMA*STRIDE info.
  • Post STIGMA*STRIDE on your event page.
  • See what others have to say about APOPS energy; submit your comments or logo in a show of support for STIGMA*STRIDE via our contact page or call APOPS at 262-642-4338.

Prefer Paypal?

To mail in a donation, download a donation form; mail your donation to:

APOPS                                                                                                                                               8225 State Rd 83                                                                                                                                 Mukwonago, WI 53149                                                                                                                          USA

                       About APOPS Founder

Sherrie Palm is the Founder/Executive Director of APOPS, Association for Pelvic Organ Prolapse Support, author of Pelvic Organ Prolapse:The Silent Epidemic, a speaker and educator on the topic of pelvic organ prolapse, and a grassroots POP health advocate. Sherrie dedicates her time to generating international awareness of pelvic organ prolapse, and developing guidance and support structures for women navigating POP.
Letter From Our Founder
Curriculum Vitae
story_txt:
We Need Your Help

EVERY VOICE MATTERS!

 My journey to increase awareness of pelvic organ prolapse (POP) began with my diagnosis in December 2007. Like most women, I'd had never heard of pelvic organ prolapse, and had no idea that: 


 1/3 to 1/2 the female population suffers in silence with POP symptoms. 
Childbirth and menopause are common POP causes, and aggressive athletic activities, constipation, chronic coughing, genetics, hysterectomy, neuromuscular diseases, and heavy lifting are POP causes as well. 

Women of ALL ages experience POP. 






         The Most Common POP Symptoms:


Women need to know signs and symptoms of pelvic organ prolapse, ALL women. While marketing my book Pelvic Organ Prolapse: The Silent Epidemic to share what I'd learned on my journey, I recognized something more needed to be done to generate awareness and provide guidance and support for women navigating POP. Association for Pelvic Organ Prolapse Support (APOPS), a US based 501(c)(3) with international arms, was born in 2010.




POP has been on medical record for over 4000 years and is still not talked about out loud because stigma keeps embarrassing symptoms hidden behind closed doors. We must continue to talk out loud and share POP information until it becomes common knowledge for all women.
                  Who Should Join STIGMA*STRIDE                                        EVERY VOICE MATTERS!



Women with pelvic organ prolapse. 
Advocacy providing support and guidance for women's pelvic health. 
Healthcare practitioners treating POP.
Industry evolving tools and treatments. 
Research exploring the POP frontier.
Academia educating practitioners.
Media providing exposure. 

We must all come together to generate the next big shift in women's health awareness. The time for change is NOW. As we all start talking about POP out loud, women will recognize POP symptoms, healthcare will start routinely screening for POP,  education, research, and media exposure will increase, and every sector engaged in the POP arena will evolve. 



                       What is STIGMA*STRIDE                                                   EVERY VOICE MATTERS!


 STIGMA*STRIDE   will bridge the world with an international Walkathon/Giving Day to break down the shroud of stigma that has kept pelvic organ prolapse and incontinence hidden behind closed doors. APOPS will host the mother walkathon in the Milwaukee, WI. The vision is to springboard at least 20 walkathons in the US, 5 walkathons in other countries, and a multitude of individual online giving days and other fundraising events during June 2015, POP Awareness Month, to generate awareness, inspire dialogue, and provide funding to evolve projects and programs in APOPS pipeline. Our budget to host our first STIGMA*STRIDE is $17,950. Funds generated in excess of event expenses will go toward tooling for our International POP Awareness Campaign.


Your generous contributions will fund STIGMA*STRIDE event expenses including:



Facility costs.
Publicity and marketing.
Fees/licenses/insurance.
Print materials.
Sound system/media exposure.
Detailed project proposal and budget available for download.

                               Why STIGMA*STRIDE                                                       EVERY VOICE MATTERS! 


As we generate awareness and talk out loud about pelvic organ prolapse and embarrassing symptoms such as incontinence, the stigma will soften  and women will recognize POP symptoms, enabling them to get early diagnosis and treatment. STIGMA*STRIDE is a large first step to improve women's pelvic health in the global community. APOPS initiatives are:  Generate global awareness.
Provide guidance and support for women with POP.
Bridge patients/practitioners.
Establish value of routine POP screening standards.
Capture accurate POP statistical data (App).

WHEN developing zone program (Women's Health and Empowerment Network).


 
                                How Can I Help?                                                          EVERY VOICE MATTERS! 
 APOPS stance is the only way to reduce stigma is to talk about POP and incontinence out loud and this event is the platform! Join the cause; join us in Milwaukee or host a STIGMA*STRIDE event; check out our Host a Fundraiser page for ideas. Register your Event to participate in STIGMA*STRIDE and have your event posted to our Event page. Also consider: 

 
Sponsor STIGMA*STRIDE.


Endorse STIGMA*STRIDE.

Host a STIGMA*STRIDE event.
Make some noise; use social media to share STIGMA*STRIDE info. Post STIGMA*STRIDE on your event page.
See what others have to say about APOPS energy; submit your comments or logo in a show of support for STIGMA*STRIDE via our contact page or call APOPS at 262-642-4338.


Prefer Paypal?
To mail in a donation, download a donation form; mail your donation to:
APOPS                                                                                                                                               8225 State Rd 83                                                                                                                                 Mukwonago, WI 53149                                                                                                                          USA
                         About APOPS FounderSherrie Palm is the Founder/Executive Director of APOPS, Association for Pelvic Organ Prolapse
Support, author of Pelvic Organ Prolapse:The Silent Epidemic, a speaker and educator on the
topic of pelvic organ prolapse, and a grassroots POP health advocate. Sherrie
dedicates her time to generating international awareness of pelvic organ
prolapse, and developing guidance and support structures for women navigating
POP.Letter From Our FounderCurriculum Vitae

story:
About the Outreach:

The Global Psychology outreach will have five teams working at community sites in Kenya addressing the requests of schools, churches, and orphanages. These request include providing trauma informed individual therapy and grief counseling for children who have lost their parent to HIV/AIDS. Additionally, training in psycho-education on alternatives to corporal punishment, domestic violence, sex education, HIV/AIDS 101, and counseling related to the reduction of stigma of a positive HIV status, and stress management for staff will be provided. My team includes two other therapists, we will travel daily from the Kenyan capital of Nairobi to a small community near the Ugandan border. There, five schools have requested assistance and training for some of the topics listed above. Other requests include providing schools supplies and basic items for the children. 

How you can help:

Join us for the 5K fun run!! 

 EVENT DETAILS:
Location: Irvine Regional Park - Starting and ending at Group Area 3. 

1 Irvine Road

Orange, Ca

Date: June 29th
Time Schedule for the Event:

730am- 815am: Day of Registration

 815am- 830am: Opening Ceremony

830am- 930am: Run/Walk 5k

Donate:

If you will not be able to participate in the 5k, you can also make a donation.  Your donation will go to funding the outreach as well as purchasing the items that the schools and orphanges have requested. These items include bathing towels, socks, undergarments, toiletries, and storybooks for children. The school requests include pencils, dictionaries, rulers, school bags, erasers, and sharpeners. If you would like to specify which items you would like to contribute with your donation please make a notation and we will purchase the items in Kenya.  Thank you!!!!

story:
Short Summary

The U.S. consumes a staggering 20 million barrels of crude oil a day,  Besides gasoline there are over 6000 products that are produced with crude oil.  Our goal is to develop solar powered Generators and tools to replace gasoline powered items that anyone can afford. We will also develop and spread ways of replacing or getting extended use out of products produced from oil.

We will produce highly efficient solar panel systems built for specific needs as opposed to large expensive systems that are one size fits all.  Our systems will range from emergency back up power, portable power, electric vehicle charging stations, and power to remote locations. All which operate near silently and with zero emissions.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need funding to continue our research and production; the funding will go towards production materials, tools, and hiring of essential personal to ensure we produce the best product possible.

Products we plan to produce with out funding:

*A completely green lawn service,  battery powered mowers, trimmers, and blowers all recharged by solar energy

*Disaster relief trailers (Large solar generator capable of powering emergency shelters)

*Solar powered residential back up generators (can also used to power tools,    landscape lighting, pumps, electric vehicle chargers, and other needs when not  being used for back up power)

*Portable solar powered generators

*Solar Powered electric vehicle chargers

*Maintaining and expanding our online presence along with sponsoring of events to provide awareness. 

    The Impact

    Providing an environmentally friendly alternative that most people can afford will allow a much greater number of people to begin reducing their carbon footprint and provide a much greater awareness of ways everyone can do their part.

    The continued replacement of crude oil with renewable energy and lack of waste will not only have a great impact on the environment but with the decreased demand the price for oil will go down along with the price of goods.


    Risks & Challenges

    We are currently operating only in the midwest, national growth will require a large upfront funding or time to grow and develop new products that will help with making a national impact.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      Share our pages and start switching to electrical products as opposed to gasoline powered products such as mowers and generators.

story:
I’m Elisha Simpson, yogi and kids yoga teacher.  I know yoga can change lives. It changed mine.  My mission is to help a particularly vulnerable group, exploited and at-risk teenage girls through our organization, The Crossover Yoga Project.  We bring a curriculum of yoga and creative art therapy to girls in the juvenile justice system, empowering them to make positive changes for a better future.  

With your help, I can bring this powerful tool to Westchester County, NY, and the Northeast through The Crossover Yoga Project.

For the past 8 years, the Art of Yoga Project in Palo Alto, CA, has seen impressive results from this curriculum.  At least 80% of their participants have made better life choices, steering away from violent reactions during stressful situations.  This evidence informed method integrates yoga, creative arts, health education and character development to help girls gain self-control, self-awareness and self-respect. 

Let's face it - too many women are traumatized and incarcerated:

  • In the past 10 years in the United States, the rate of incarcerated women has increased over 800%, double the rate of men.
  • Westchester county spends $270,000 a year for one teenager to go to prison
  • When kids go to jail, they are mentored by their peers to commit crimes as means to survival: within 3 years, 80% of teens are re-arrested.

The Crossover Yoga Project gets to the root of the problem- we get to girls who have been broken down by society and help them rise, heal and move towards a new identity on a brighter path to their future. 

We need $7000 to help our girls, helping them make a difference in their lives and their community.  Your support of The Crossover Yoga Project will help us work towards reducing the skyrocketing rate of recidivism.

Your donation will:

Purchase the curriculum ($3000) - a unique teen girl-centered, 18-week art and yoga program with a 80% positive impact on participants
Kickstart our visual identity campaign letting more people become aware of this powerful tool ($3000)
Initiate the process of becoming a legal non-profit.  Establishing resources to reach out and make a difference in a girl's life ($1000). Your dollars CAN make a difference, one life at a time.

Our team of committed  yogis and creative art therapists guide traumatized teen girls to self-healing.  Yoga and art therapy helps steer them away from the trauma held inside that is expressed through crime, depression, eating disorders, self-mutilation and self-medication.  

Donate now to our campaign.  Spread the word on Facebook, Twitter, Indiegogo share tools, or any other social media. Encourage your friends to help The Crossover Yoga Project .  All it takes is one girl to make a difference within herself and within her community.

Thank you!

Elisha & Susannah


Elisha Simpson, RYT, RCYT                                Susannah Johnston, RYT

Founder, Project Director                                    Director of Development

story:
Hello all,

 

I am advocating for my dear friend, Angela Garrett.  Angela has been diagnosed with stage 4 breast cancer which has unfortunately spread throughout her bones. She is currently a patient at the Cancer Treatment Centers of America in Newnan, GA.  Angela finished her last radiation treatment this week.  She currently awaits scheduling of a double mastectomy.  Angela is on a feeding tube; and though her
body is growing stronger, she is frequently weak from lack of proper nutrition.

Angela is a fighter and a woman of strong faith.  She continues to go to work every
day like normal.  While her place of employment is doing their best to keep her employed and insured by allowing her time to leave early for doctors’ appointments and treatments, she just started her new job a few months ago and therefore lacks the personal time off she needs to get through her pending surgery and subsequent treatments.  While Angela recuperates from her surgery, she will not get paid from her employer and there will be no money coming in to handle household bills and keep her health insurance current.  Angela is single; and her only source of
income is her job.  Friends and family members are doing everything they can to help by making sure someone takes her to and from her doctors’ appointments and treatments and ensuring that someone stays with her while she’s at home.  Needless to say, however, the household bills are still accruing each day—not to mention the medical bills that continue mounting.

Will you help my friend Angela?  If a large number of us band together and
contribute a little, I’m confident we can raise the monies Angela needs.  No amount is too large or small. Any and all funds will be used for household bills,
medical expenses, transportation to and from appointments/treatments, medical
supplies, and other items needed for Angela’s care. In addition to asking for monetary support, I ask that you join me and other friends of Angela Garrett in praying for God to heal Angela, cure her, preserve her life, and usher in her total restoration and renewal.  If you would join us in this effort by making a contribution, we would greatly appreciate it.  If you would also help the Friends of Angela
Garrett raise the monetary and prayer support Angela needs by distributing this
message to persons on your email distribution list and by posting in on your
Social Media sites, we would also be grateful.

 
Thanks in advance for your support.

Lemora B. Dobbs and the Friends of Angela Garrett

story:
Mission: Train & Thrive

The FitLife mission is to help people attain their fitness goals and to feel great about the process. We want our clients to Train & Thrive. We will help them to reach their goals by leading them through high quality workouts in a group or personal training environment. We want people to feel that fitness can become an enjoyable part of their lives.  If you are a client, FitLife will make you happier and healthier while providing you with energy to improve other aspects of your life. 


Background

FitLife is a fitness studio focused on providing fun and intense group classes along with personal training. 

My name is Dominika Wozniak and I am the founder of FitLife. The vision for this studio has come from my own love for having an active and fit lifestyle. Fitness has always been a part of my life. I began intensive fitness training at a young age in Slovakia when I first fell in love with tennis. I played tennis professionally and also as an NCAA athlete for the University of Oregon and have been fortunate to train under some terrific fitness coaches.  Since retiring from tennis I relish opportunities to inspire others to love fitness. I currently teach fitness and tennis classes and am certified to teach Pilates.

I moved to Ann Arbor four years ago and have a terrific set of clients for both fitness and tennis classes. It is with their support that I now turn to opening and managing a successful fitness studio.  With all my years of experience in sport and fitness, I know what it takes to attain individual fitness goals and apply my previous experiences to help my clients attain their goals. Now I am very close to reaching my goal of providing a fitness studio that is fun and uplifting. I believe being active and enjoying fitness should be a part of everybody’s life. 

Product Offerings

Group Classes

Group classes will be offered throughout the day, between 6am and 10pm to meet your demanding schedule. There will be a wide variety of different classes offered such as basic stretching classes, bootcamps, circuit training, HIIT (High Intensity Interval Training), Pilates, Yoga,  and Mommy (post-natal) classes.  The variety of classes will provide you with the opportunity to cross-train or to only participate in specific classes that you enjoy. Depending  on how you feel and what your goals are, you pick the class and we will make sure you feel fitter and happier because of that choice.

Personal Training

Personal training sessions will be planned and created just for you. Your trainer will utilize a variety of different types of equipment and techniques to make you work hard and have you reach your fitness goals. You will always have the option to receive periodic fitness evaluations and to set your goals and personalize your program to cater to your individual lifestyle and needs.

Space

FitLife will be open from 6am until 10pm. The spaces we are considering are between 3500 to 4500 square feet. The size of the space should allow us to provide group classes, personal training as well as a few other amenities and comforts.  We will have women’s and men’s change rooms with at least one shower in each change room (depending on space and plumbing). The studio will be very accommodating to client needs and schedules as we will provide services including secure lockers (no need to bring a lock); towel service to ensure clients have one less thing to worry about; clean and high quality yoga mats for group classes for clients who are unable to bring their own mats or prefer to use the studio's. Since we know the importance of being hydrated a variety of beverage options will also be available. We are planning on being located close to Varsity Tennis Center while also being easily accessible from interstate 94.


What We Need & What You Get

Goal for Funds

FitLife will be a studio that offers space for group classes and personal training along with men’s and women’s change rooms. The potential space we have in mind is located close to Varsity Tennis center and has very few fitness studios nearby, but also has apartment complexes nearby. With a high density population near the studio, it will be a convenient and a desirable option for many people. 

We currently have about $45,000 allocated for renovating the space, but require another $25,000 to ensure that all renovations can be completed. The goal of this funding campaign is to raise funds to help renovate the space for the fitness studio. The funding campaign is also being used to show stakeholders (lenders, landlords, employees) that FitLife has clients and supporters prior to opening day.

These funds will allow us to provide the amenities and equipment that we know clients value. Showers, flooring and ventilation for fitness studio purposes increase renovation costs substantially, but with your help we can ensure that we provide a high quality studio from the opening day.

By helping us fund FitLife, you can choose from a variety of FitPerks to help you attain your fitness goals once we open FitLife studio. FitPerks are discounted packages, a great deal nobody else can get except those who helps us to fund FitLife. You can purchase multiple FitPerks, especially if you are looking for a great gift for your family member or a friend (or even yourself). Your FitPerk will not expire. You are free to redeem it when you please.

The Impact

Your contributions mean a lot to me. You are not only helping me to reach my dream, but it also shows your interest in the studio as well. Your support shows my business partners that FitLife can be successful. By successfully funding this campaign you also provide me with the opportunity to impact your fitness lifestyle in a positive manner.

Risks & Challenges

Our Challenges are:

  • Challenge #1: Getting the space we want. Landlords are reluctant to rent space to new businesses without some signal of a revenue generating client base. We can overcome this challenge by reaching our funding goal as it helps establish that FitLife has a credible client base that cares about the studio's success.
  • Challenge #2: Expanding interest in FitLife to potential new clients. The funding campaign is also being used to get people who do not currently train with me (Dominika) to learn more about me and my training services, with the hope that they come join our group classes and personal training sessions in the studio.

These challenges can be solved by reaching the $25,000 goal and showing that we do have a client base  to start a new business. They will also be overcome by having a location near individuals who care about a healthy lifestyle and where there is a lack of fitness opportunities. A successful marketing plan as well as word of mouth by current clients will also help tackle these challenges.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, please help by spreading the word about FitLife Campaign. Tell your friends to use Indiegogo share tools as well! We really appreciate and value your help!

How to help:

  • Get the word out about the FitLife financing campaign through conversation. The more people who are aware of what we are trying to develop the more likely that we will be successful in opening FitLife.
  • A good way to spread the word is using the Indiegogo share tools to let your social network friends know about the campaign as well.

There will be a wide variety of different classes offered such as basic stretching classes, bootcamps, circuit training, HIIT (High Intensity Interval Training), Pilates, Yoga,  and Mommy (post-natal) classes.  The variety of classes will provide you with the opportunity to cross-train or to only participate in specific classes that you enjoy. Depending  on how you feel and what your goals are, you pick the class and we will make sure you feel fitter and happier because of that choice.
Personal Training
Personal training sessions will be planned and created just for you. Your trainer will utilize a variety of different types of equipment and techniques to make you work hard and have you reach your fitness goals. You will always have the option to receive periodic fitness evaluations and to set your goals and personalize your program to cater to your individual lifestyle and needs.
Space
FitLife will be open from 6am until 10pm. The spaces we are considering are between 3500 to 4500 square feet. The size of the space should allow us to provide group classes, personal training as well as a few other amenities and comforts.  We will have women’s and men’s change rooms with at least one shower in each change room (depending on space and plumbing). The studio will be very accommodating to client needs and schedules as we will provide services including secure lockers (no need to bring a lock); towel service to ensure clients have one less thing to worry about; clean and high quality yoga mats for group classes for clients who are unable to bring their own mats or prefer to use the studio's. Since we know the importance of being hydrated a variety of beverage options will also be available. We are planning on being located close to Varsity Tennis Center while also being easily accessible from interstate 94.
What We Need & What You Get

 
Goal for Funds

FitLife will be a studio that offers space for group classes and personal training along with men’s and women’s change rooms. The potential space we have in mind is located close to Varsity Tennis center and has very few fitness studios nearby, but also has apartment complexes nearby. With a high density population near the studio, it will be a convenient and a desirable option for many people. 
We currently have about $45,000 allocated for renovating the space, but require another $25,000 to ensure that all renovations can be completed. The goal of this funding campaign is to raise funds to help renovate the space for the fitness studio. The funding campaign is also being used to show stakeholders (lenders, landlords, employees) that FitLife has clients and supporters prior to opening day.
These funds will allow us to provide the amenities and equipment that we know clients value. Showers, flooring and ventilation for fitness studio purposes increase renovation costs substantially, but with your help we can ensure that we provide a high quality studio from the opening day.By helping us fund FitLife, you can choose from a variety of FitPerks to help you attain your fitness goals once we open FitLife studio. FitPerks are discounted packages, a great deal nobody else can get except those who helps us to fund FitLife. You can purchase multiple FitPerks, especially if you are looking for a great gift for your family member or a friend (or even yourself). Your FitPerk will not expire. You are free to redeem it when you please.

The Impact
 Your contributions mean a lot to me. You are not only helping me to reach my dream, but it also shows your interest in the studio as well. Your support shows my business partners that FitLife can be successful. By successfully funding this campaign you also provide me with the opportunity to impact your fitness lifestyle in a positive manner.
  Risks & Challenges 
Our Challenges are:

Challenge #1: Getting the space we want. Landlords are reluctant to rent space to new businesses without some signal of a revenue generating client base. We can overcome this challenge by reaching our funding goal as it helps establish that FitLife has a credible client base that cares about the studio's success.
Challenge #2: Expanding interest in FitLife to potential new clients. The funding campaign is also being used to get people who do not currently train with me (Dominika) to learn more about me and my training services, with the hope that they come join our group classes and personal training sessions in the studio.

These challenges can be solved by reaching the $25,000 goal and showing that we do have a client base  to start a new business. They will also be overcome by having a location near individuals who care about a healthy lifestyle and where there is a lack of fitness opportunities. A successful marketing plan as well as word of mouth by current clients will also help tackle these challenges.

  Other Ways You Can Help 
If you can't contribute, please help by spreading the word about FitLife Campaign. Tell your friends to use Indiegogo share tools as well! We really appreciate and value your help!
How to help:

Get the word out about the FitLife financing campaign through conversation. The more people who are aware of what we are trying to develop the more likely that we will be successful in opening FitLife.
A good way to spread the word is using the Indiegogo share tools to let your social network friends know about the campaign as well.

story:
My name is Katie-George Dunlevy and I am a para-cyclist in the Irish squad.
I am visually impaired and ride on the back of a tandem. I compete with my pilot Eve. We provide our own equipment.

We need financial support to purchase a new bike, which is a racing tandem designed for use in individual time trials raced on the road. It is a specialised custom made tandem and is a considerable cost. If we are unable to reach our target any donation that we receive will cover our other expenses such as flights, bike maintenance, kit, regular physiotherapy, sports massage and a strength
& conditioning coach.

We are working hard and believe we have every chance of getting a medal at the
Rio Paralympics in 2016. Currently our equipment is holding us back. We need specialised equipment so we can be on par with other nations and achieve our
full potential and our ultimate goal, which is Gold. I came 5th in the London 2012 Paralympics and just missed out on becoming World Champion last year, a photo finish determined the final verdict. If we had the best equipment available we would have won. Recently we were 4th at the World Championships, a heartbreaking photo finish showed we missed out on a medal. We are missing out on medals
by such close margins and don't want this to be the case in Rio next year.

If we had the right equipment we would be putting Ireland on the medals table.

My father is from Mountcharles, County Donegal. We are passionate about Irish success.

Eve and I are at our best but will continue to miss out by the closest of margins
if our bike lets us down.

As the Rio Paralympics get closer we are looking forward to continuing our preparations and working hard to achieve our aim, to medal at Rio. Anything
you give will be greatly appreciated. Please help to make our dreams come true.

story:
IN SHORT

X-RUNNER is an innovative and award-winning social enterprise providing families who live in Lima’s poorest areas with a simple, safe, and waterless toilet system.

In Peru’s capital, there are still around 2 million people who don’t have their own toilet and can only rely on pit latrines. This leaves families at risk for many diseases. Failing sanitation leads  to increasingly contaminated and eventually inhabitable and dangerous neighborhoods.

After a successful pilot in 2012, x-runner has expanded its sustainable sanitation system, reaching more than 1000 people every day!

YOUR SUPPORT creates direct impact and value!

With your support we can continue to bring dignity and a basic human right to Peru’s poorest families. Your contribution is crucial to helping us expand our waterless toilet system to the next 10 neighborhoods and to doubling our impact by reaching another 1000 beneficiaries!


BACKGROUND

Lima is the 2nd driest capital in the world. The city faces severe water scarcity and has to rethink how to provide safe sanitation to families without relying on a water-based sewer system. No other invention has saved more lives in its history than the toilet! A reliable and safe toilet system prevents infectious diseases, increases hygiene at home, and prevents ground water contamination. This means that not only the person who “has to go” benefits from reliable sanitation, but also the entire family, and even surrounding neighborhoods.




OUR MISSION

X-RUNNER provides families who live in the poor urban parts of Lima with an innovative, waterless sanitation system.


HOW X-RUNNER WORKS

Families who sign up for our service receive a waterless toilet installed directly in their homes. The toilet doesn’t require any water and it separates urine from feces, allowing for the latter to be collected in a dry state in a portable container.

For a small monthly fee, our X-RUNNER collection truck goes by the communities once a week and picks up the poop in compostable bags. This way, X-RUNNER safely removes tons of feces filled with pathogens from communities and allows families to live in clean homes.

At X-RUNNER we care about the environment. Therefore, we treat the collected waste and turn it into nutrient-rich compost.


WHY WE NEED YOU

Reliable and safe sanitation will bring social, environmental, economic and educational benefits to the region. That’s why YOUR SUPPORT creates direct impact and value!

With your support, X-RUNNER can expand its system and its operations to another 10 neighborhoods by:

  • Supplying more toilets
  • Picking up many more tons of poop
  • Hiring more local employees
  • Increasing our composting infrastructure
  • Launching larger health campaigns 

X-RUNNER ‘s effectiveness can be seen in our latest reports: 

  • 93% of our beneficiaries say that the dry toilet has improved their lives.
  • 82% of our beneficiaries say that they plan to keep it for a long time.
  • 4 months after installing the toilet, users reported an average diarrhoea reduction of 12%


OUR GOAL

We want to raise at least 25’000 US$ to expand to the next 10 neighborhoods.  And this is just the beginning: The more money we raise, the quicker we can reach more families and change more lives.

If you do not want to send your contribution online, you can instead make a direct contribution. Please contact j.altenburger@xrunner-venture.com .


WHAT OTHERS THINK ABOUT US

“X-runner is one of those rare organizations that not only cares deeply about their customers, but really understands them as well. Design for Extreme Affordability at Stanford has learned so much from X-runner. We have thoroughly enjoyed our partnership and hope to continue our relationship for a long time!“ 

Joan Dorsey, Design for Extreme Affordability, Stanford University
“(X-RUNNER) has an incredibly important impact in the development of the most forgotten places in Peru, and its operations are definitely changing the lives of these communities.” 

Carmen Graham, Jury member MIT Technology Review

x-runner  won the 2014 MIT Technology Review Award for Peruvian Innovators under 35. It also made the Forbes 30 under 30 list in early 2015, and has been named one of the prestigious SUSTANIA 100 sustainable solutions for the world.

We’re serious about providing quality and a professional service: We supply toilets from the world's leading dry toilet producer (and generous x-runner supporter) SEPARETT! For our service and treatment we collaborate with Stanford University and Eawag, two of the leading institutes in the field. 

We are members of the Sustainable Sanitation Alliance and we’re a certified B Corporation, which means that we meet worldwide standards of social and environmental performance, as well as accountability and transparency. 


THE TEAM   

X-RUNNER is a women-led social enterprise. Co-founders Jessica Altenburger (Swiss) and Isabel Medem (German-Peruvian) launched their operations in Lima, Peru, in 2012 with the brand name “Family’s”. To date, they have built their enterprise with an interdisciplinary team of 14 local members; many of them coming from communities that x-runner operates in.


FAQs

  • What happens if you raise more money than the initial goal?

    Every additional dollar donated will go directly into adding more neighborhoods to our operations. So, the more money we raise, the more households will be able to access our toilet and system.

  • What happens if you don’t reach your fundraising goal? We’ll still continue to operate, but we won’t be able to add as many client households to our operations.

  • Do you only raise money through this campaign? The funds raised here are a crucial part of our annual budget, which consists of further grants from foundations and development agencies. See our website for information about our partners: http://xrunner-venture.com/partners/4583965244"

  • Are these contributions tax deductible? No, we’re a social enterprise and legally not eligible to have tax-exempt status.
  • I want to donate a substantial sum and I don't want to do this online. How can I get in touch with the team? Please reach out directly to Jessica: contact@xrunner-venture.com
  • Do you make profits or are you a non-for-profit? Being a social enterprise, we are a hybrid: All our revenues and future profits (we’re not profitable yet) will be directly re-invested into the enterprise. This allows us to scale, to improve our operations and to create more jobs. 
  • Do you work with volunteers? We have a permanent team of 16 members, which are legally employed and have a regular salary. In addition, we work with student volunteers from one of the local universities.
  • Why do people in the video call x-runner "family's"? x-runner is the name of the enterprise and "family's" is our brand name in Peru. 

PERKS

Choose one of our suggested amounts or contribute a customized amount (click "CONTRIBUTE NOW"). If you choose the latter,  you will receive the Perk that is closest to the amount you chose! Here are some sneak peeks: 


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Contributions are great, but you can also help by spreading the message on your social media or through e-mail!

story:
My name is Mike.  In 2001 I had an accident and was diagnosed a quadraplegic.  Since that time I've worked hard to relearn to drive, live independently, raise my daughter as a single father, obtain my Michigan Builder License then more importantly remarry and  become a father again to twin boys (now 2 years old).  Unfortunately, the one thing that has remained out of reach has been walking again.

ReWalk is my missing link.  ReWalk is a robotic exoskeleton that provides powered hip and knee motion to enable individuals with a spinal cord injury to stand upright and walk.   With the ReWalk system I will not only have my legs back but it will show my children that if you never give up anything is possible.  To see me walking in a unit check out the YouTube  links below; for more about rewalk, go to www.rewalk.com .

We Need Your Help

The ReWalk system is expensive.  It was approved by the FDA in June of 2014, but is not covered by my insurance.  I am committed to working hard physically and also to using all of my personal financial resources, but there is no way I can do this on my own.  The first step (no pun intended) is physical therapy across the state over several weeks.    The next step is the actual purchase of the Rewalk system fitting and adjusting.  There will also be expenses incurred through traveling, food and missed work.

    All funds raised will go towards the purchase and use of the ReWalk system.  Should I not meet my goal in the time allotted by this site, the funds will be saved and added to until I can purchase my new legs.  If I raise more than I need, I will work with ReWalk to pass the funds along to a worthy person with their own dream to walk.

      Why Help?

      I am currently starting the rewalk rehabilitation program and using a system           at U of M.  Funds raised will be used to purchase my own ReWalk unit to take home. 

       I'm from a hard working family who believes that if something needs doing then you do it.  If you think about it,  what would you do to be a whole person again after losing everything you knew? ReWalk is what I need to do.  Thank you for helping me walk again!
