story:
We all know that patient education is a mess.  It's confusing, impersonal and there is a huge disconnect between what doctors tell you, what you understand and what you remember. 

At Mambo Health, we want to build a mobile application that will fix that. 

The problem is, there are lots of companies already trying to do that.  But, none of them are doing it well.  If they were, we wouldn't be trying to solve this problem.

We want to approach this differently.  We have ideas about how we should build this application (you can review our ideas under the updates tab), but we want to reach out to you, our supporters, our users, our patients and ask:

 

What should we build?

 

What features should the application have, what information should it contain, hell, what should it even look like?

Tell us, and that is what we will build. 

Lets really put the patient at the center of the "patient-centered care movement."

We need your support and we need your help. 

Your contribution will enable us to build this application.  Mambo Health is completely bootstrapped.  We are using our own money, time and skills to launch this, but we can't do this forever. 

We need to buy server space, and since this application will contain patient information, that server space needs to be HIPAA compliant.  HIPAA compliant server space is really expensive!

In return for your contribution, you will become part of our community and our trusted advisors.  We will do our best to ensure that your ideas are incorporated into the application and that you  have a direct say in how we build this.  We will send regular updates.  We will solicit your opinions and advice and we will incorporate it into the application. 

I, Jenn Snidow, will send you an email from my personal email address and you are free to reach out to me at any time with questions, suggestions or ideas to help improve this application and this company.

We are passionate about changing the way patient education is delivered.  We want to stop this cycle of confusion, misunderstanding and fear.

No more stories.
story_txt: We all know that patient education is a mess.  It's confusing, impersonal and there is a huge disconnect between what doctors tell you, what you understand and what you remember.  At Mambo Health, we want to build a mobile application that will fix that. The problem is, there are lots of companies already trying to do that.  But, none of them are doing it well.  If they were, we wouldn't be trying to solve this problem.We want to approach this differently.  We have ideas about how we should build this application (you can review our ideas under the updates tab), but we want to reach out to you, our supporters, our users, our patients and ask: What should we build? What features should the application have, what information should it contain, hell, what should it even look like?Tell us, and that is what we will build.  Lets really put the patient at the center of the "patient-centered care movement."We need your support and we need your help. Your contribution will enable us to build this application.  Mambo Health is completely bootstrapped.  We are using our own money, time and skills to launch this, but we can't do this forever.  We need to buy server space, and since this application will contain patient information, that server space needs to be HIPAA compliant.  HIPAA compliant server space is really expensive!In return for your contribution, you will become part of our community and our trusted advisors.  We will do our best to ensure that your ideas are incorporated into the application and that you  have a direct say in how we build this.  We will send regular updates.  We will solicit your opinions and advice and we will incorporate it into the application.  I, Jenn Snidow, will send you an email from my personal email address and you are free to reach out to me at any time with questions, suggestions or ideas to help improve this application and this company.We are passionate about changing the way patient education is delivered.  We want to stop this cycle of confusion, misunderstanding and fear.No more stories.

story:
Please go to our second round of our crowdfunding campaign as this one has ended and we have been able to raise a total of $1,030. Thank you sincerely for your support. 

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/cumasu-transcending-stigma-through-technology-mobile/x/17757432#/

 

Introduction

Imagine your name is Maureen from Nairobi, Kenya, working as a hairdresser. You are the only breadwinner for your parents and siblings sometimes working 15 hours a day. You start catching a cold that you cannot seem to shake off, your vision starts to blur, and you are losing a significant amount of weight over time. Despite knowing how important your vision is for your work, you ignore the symptoms. The stigma around it limits your access to diagnosis and treatment. 

Finally, after your sister was able to convince you, you went to a local hospital and got tested for HIV. You are HIV positive. How could this have happened to you?

After a while, the untreated HIV made you blind and you could no longer work because of how long you had to wait to seek diagnosis and treatment due to fear of the stigma around it. Now you are 34 with no partner or children, and you have been contemplating suicide. 

Maureen's story is the embodiment of many more people in which HIV/AIDS has left people in unstable positions within society, ultimately killing them prematurely. According to Avert, there are 4,500 new HIV infections every day among adults 15 years and older. 37% of those infections are among young people (aged 15-24 years), and this is an even worse statistic when we find out that women in the same age group have a higher HIV prevalence than men in the same age group.

My story begins with my parents fleeing to Germany as political refugees. Racism left me ostracized at a young age. From those experiences, questions related to social stigma have been a part of me ever since I can remember. And they have, in part, led me to start my venture, Cumasu, which seeks to address the lack of access to healthcare faced by marginalized communities in developing nations. Specific challenges include lack of privacy, social instability, and a general social stigma governing sexual behavior. We seek to create a new normal in which there is easy access to clinics for sexual health-related diagnoses and support, maintaining patient dignity in the process.

Through an appointment-scheduling platform using USSD technology along with an SMS component, we are providing access to diagnosis and treatment, as well as, allowing clinics the opportunity to provide psychosocial support to improve appointment and prescription adherence all via a mobile device as mobile penetration is over 90% in 2016. 

Through this, Cumasu came to the conclusion that we envision a world in which every human including marginalized communities receive access to proper healthcare as dignified participants through the leveraging of technology and collaboration to tackle the stigma around sensitive diseases, and ultimately connect care providers with those in need of care.

Primary Assets:

Startup Experience - Sohrab Co-founded Bean Voyage in 2015 to empower women coffee farmers in Costa Rica to enhance their income by 300% via an e-commerce platform. 

Education - Sohrab majored in Linguistics, as well as, in Business and Non-profit Management at Earlham College which has aided him in adapting to other cultures through a lens of language. He has also learned basic skills such as accounting, business plan writing, and grant writing among many more. 

Incubator - Sohrab is currently attending an incubator for social entrepreneurs called the Watson Institute based in Boulder, CO where he receives both mentorship and the tools on essential understanding and acknowledgement of the challenge he is tackling, as well as, further team building skills which are detrimental in Sohrab’s pursuit to build a team on the ground in Nairobi, Kenya.

Mentors -

  • Founder/CEO Stevan P. Simich and VP of Product Rob Blatchley from Mogli SMS provide SMS solutions for organizations globally. 
  • Eric Glustrom as an EchoingGreen and Ashoka Fellow is guiding me in expanding my supporting network on the ground as he has extensive experience working on the ground in East Africa. 

KANCO - KANCO as a partner, has a membership of over 1,200 organizations and numerous individuals that are networking, collaborating and are bound together by a common vision of an HIV, AIDS, TB and other public health issues of importance in  Kenya. 

Developer -

  • Gerald Ogola from Nairobi, Kenya, is a mobile applications developer who graduated from Strathmore University and has extensive experience in developing various USSD platforms. 
  • Brian Lyuba is by trait a web applications developer based in Nairobi, Kenya who will be responsible for building our website mycumasu.com in which users will have dashboards unique to them and their needs. 

Support - I have seasoned entrepreneurial support and guidance by Wyclife Omondi and Sonia Kabra, founders of Buupass based in Nairobi, Kenya working with USSD Technology with an SMS component.

Passion - Sohrab Amiri is fully committed to seeing this project be piloted with one health clinic on the ground. He will be building up his network and forming partnerships with different organizations, clinics, and communities. He will also be building up a team with identified positions by contacting professors and students from the University of Nairobi and Strathmore University

The Technology

On a daily basis, we have many things we interact with but we have actually never known their real name. USSD is one of them. It stands for Unstructured Supplementary Service Data which is a function of your mobile device allowing you to dial numbers on your phone when you want to call somebody. However, instead of calling somebody, you are dialing a set of 3 digits and * and # to access an application provided to you by your network provider.

Think of any operation one does on their cell phone which is not text, internet or making calls. Let us pick an operation, for example checking credit or buying bundles on your cell phone. The process normally involves entering a number in your cell phone with a unique structure. Imagine typing in *473# on your cell phone.

Interactive USSD applications are ubiquitous in the African mobile ecosystem. USSD is universally accessible on any mobile phone, making it a powerful tool for data collection. Through USSD technology, Cumasu will be able to make use of the robust analytics to help monitor appointment and prescription adherence as we will receive feedback in reflection to the questions we will be texting the patients. The USSD gateway is built to handle thousands of simultaneous requests at any one time. Cumasu can give anyone with a mobile device access to structured information via the interactive nature meaning we can layer authentication and leading questions to deliver the right information.

Under this link, you may find a video demonstrating an animation of the user interface of the Cumasu 1.0 platform.

The Requested Funding/Budget

Our start-up is in need of $3,984 to run a proof-of-concept of Cumasu 1.0 with health clinics with the help of KANCO to have a strategic plan for improvements and functionalities for Cumasu 2.0. These are the expenses associated with the pilot project after extensive research and discussions with locals living in Nairobi, Kenya with these breakdowns:

1. $2,000 for the development of Cumasu 1.0 which will be paying for various expenses associated with the development, as well as, animators. 

2. $213 for a shared USSD code for 4 months by Africa's Talking 

3. $514 for the flight from Frankfurt to Nairobi (round-trip, 01/10/18 - 03/16/18)

4. $700 for lodging  (65 days)

5. $260 for nourishment (considering $3-5 for two meals each day)

6. $126 for transportation within Nairobi with Matatus

7. $51 for Visa for 3 months

8. $120 for Yellow Fever Vaccination in Germany

This brings it to a total of $3,984 in order to begin the pilot project starting January 10th, 2018 until March 16th, 2018. 

The minimum viable product of Cumasu 1.0 functioning on any mobile device will entitle these functions:

Functionalities for the patient:

1. Schedule initial appointments

2. Reschedule appointments

3. Request test diagnosis result

Functionalities for the clinic:

1. Send delays or cancellations to scheduled appointments

2. Send SMS reminders for appointment and prescription

3. Make data-driven decisions through assessment of certain health recommendations via our robust data analytics

Functionalities for the Cumasu team:

1. Web platform will demonstrate data on appointment attendance and prescription adherence

2. Data will allow for us to make certain health recommendations in collaboration with health clinic

Outcomes

1. Develop the Minimum Viable Product Cumasu 1.0 by December 18th, 2017

2. Pilot run Cumasu 1.0 with a health clinic

3. Gather data of proof on improvements of appointment and prescription adherence

4. Build partnership with a health clinic to continue working with them

5. Receive feedback from the clinic and patients to iterate on Cumasu 1.0 and use all our learnings to develop a strategic plan for Cumasu 2.0

Measurement

Part of Cumasu’s commitment is to demonstrate the impact the mobile platform will have for health clinics and the patients we wish to serve. Therefore, Cumasu promises to track its impact through these measurements to demonstrate them to each supporter and the public:

1. USSD Technology allows with the robust analytics to monitor appointment and prescription adherence to see via the web platform how many people attended their appointments, as well as, understand if it improves prescription adherence

2. Pre and post interviews with both health clinic practitioners and patients

3. Video/Photo documentation of the progress of the development of Cumasu 1.0 and the work with health clinic and patients based on consent

4. Newsletters will be written once a month summarizing each month’s work, progress, and experience to share via social media, as well as, each supporter. Within the newsletter, feedback from both patients and health practitioners in reflection to Cumasu 1.0 will be shared

Now imagine you are again in Maureen's shoes and you were aware of the benefits that come with using the Cumasu application. Imagine you could have simply scheduled an appointment in privacy and see a doctor. Imagine you would have received constant reminders and support from the health facility and the Cumasu team to stay on your prescribed treatment in order for you to live a more prolonged life, as well as, be equipped with the information and motivation to battle the stigma around your disease. HIV is not a death sentence anymore, and we at Cumasu made it our mission to restore the dignity of people suffering from diseases that are coupled with social stigma, and ultimately empower their voices. 

 

 

We at Cumasu, thank you sincerely for your support!

 


Sincerely,

The Cumasu Team

story:
My name is Victoria Bollons. I have had the honour and good fortune to have known and been friends with Lee Coxhead for almost a decade.

Lee is a loyal, trusting, trustworthy, gregarious person who grabs life by the proverbials. Oh, and did I forget to mention that he is generous, almost to a fault. Not just with his time but everything at his disposal. Don't believe me? Well, check out Lee's Facebook page for many stories and testimonials of his philanthropic endeavours. You'll also notice that he's never the one to instigate these or seek any personal glory. Truly, he's one of life's good guys.

Unfortunately, good guys aren't always lucky guys. Six days ago Lee had a life threatening motorcycle accident and remains in a critical condition. The prognosis is that, with a fair wind, he will be able to leave hospital in 6 to 9 months.

To put some perspective on this, 5 years ago Lee had a motorcycle accident that left him with multiple injuries and one leg shorter than the other. After months of physiotherapy, learning to walk again and rebuilding his life, he started his own business. A few weeks ago he took the brave step of leaving full time employment and going self employed to pursue his own business. We met up soon after and Lee was on cloud nine, full of optimism and enthusiasm for this new chapter in his life..

So now you can appreciate, Lee is to be in hospital for the next 6 - 9 months with no income whatsoever. Combine this with his mortgage and other financial commitments and you can see the predicament.

When Lee does leave hospital he will need all the help, support and encouragement  (both emotional and financial) that he has shown to so many others.

All donations will go directly to Lee in the hope that we can assist with one of the major obstacles that Lee will have to face in the challenging months ahead.

We appreciate all of your time, thoughts and donations. Lee is a most worthy recipient of all these things.

story:
Short Summary

On May 10th 2015 my brother and I, and our good friend Evan Lee will be running the Delaware half marathon in support of Camp Arrowhead's campaign to raise money to complete their disc golf course. The three of us are previous campers (and staff) and believe strongly in the work that Arrowhead does in changing the lives of Delaware's youth. Our belief is that disc golf is an outdoor activity that supports environmental awareness, community, and provides an outlet for family outings and we would like to prove it by helping to create another Delaware course!

Camp arrowhead currently has a nine-hole course and would like to raise money to expand it. This expansion will allow them to open the course up to the disc community of Delaware in addition to providing funds for equipment (discs) to teach campers the fundamentals of the game.

Camp aims to raise $4,500  to add an additional 9 holes to Camp Arrowhead's disc golf course, as well as update and improve some of the original 9 holes (by adding concrete/ artificial turf starting pads and multiple hole/basket placements to jazz up the course). 

(THE GOAL IS $4500, THE BAR HAS BEEN SET LOW ON THIS PAGE BECAUSE OF FUNDING TOOL RULES, $4500 IS THE GOAL!)

Every dollar helps and provides a little bit more motivation for the three of us to run 13+ miles! Any funds raised past the goal of $4500 will be given to camp to use as they see fit.

All camp information and when to sign up for summer sessions can be found at http://www.camparrowhead.net/

Any Questions on the race and support e-mail tylerg@udel.edu

Any Questions about the future of the course e-mail scott.r.lafontaine@gmail.com

story:
Canadian Science for Comfort - World's only one of a kind orthopedic solution to sooth your back, anywhere you sit. 

As a Human Spinal Biomechanics Researcher, I have been working with thousands of licensed back healthcare specialists across United States and Canada. In the past decade, my team and I have created an extensive line of home spinal health care solutions that helps people take care of the health of their entire spine from the neck to the lower back. However, QiPillow (pronounced as Chi-Pillow) is the one we are most proud of, because it will benefit the most people in the world.

Most of us have a sedentary life style, today. Unfortunately, our body is not built for sitting. And most chairs, sofas and car seats are not built to support our back. The problem with sitting is that it tends to destroy our healthy posutre and cause the deep stabilizing muscles in our lower back to tense and stiffen, both of which often lead to stiffness, pain and fatigue in our back.   

As a 100% Canadian innovation, QiPillow is here to rescue. Being world's only one of a kind orthopedic solution, QiPillow effectively helps you both improve your sitting posture and prevent your deep stabilizing muscles from tensing. 

In a third party consumer use study, 91% of participants were amazed about how well QiPillow helped them improve their sitting posture and comfort while relieving their back stiffness, pain and fatigue while sitting. (See below for details) 

How does QiPillow work?

The secret is in its air-controlled ergonomic core. Powered by the same technology used in expensive back support of luxury cars, QiPillow also uses air as its supporting medium. Its air-controlled ergonomic core is great at maintaining its support, and is highly conforming and easily adjustable. As a result, QiPillow will never collapse under your body weight, and never lose its ergonomic support to your back. And like a Sleep Number Bed, QiPillow will adjust to your body, your seat and your comfort, instead of the other way round.

QiPillow maintains its support, while ordinary pillows lose 2/3 or more of their support under body weight (imagine that the forearm is your spine).

Who can benefit from QiPillow?

Anyone can benefit from QiPillow, whether your are an office worker, a taxi driver, a truck driver, a retired senior, or even a student doing a lot of home work. QiPillow helps you sooth and protect your back while seemlessly blending into your sitting environment, at home, work, school or in your car.

If you or someone you know have a challenged back or simply wish to improve sitting posture or comfort, this innovation is engineered for you. 

Plant a tree!

For each QiPillow you order, we will make a donation to plant a tree in the Atlantic Forest of Brazil - one of world's most endangered tropical forests on earth. As the lung of the world, it benefits everone in the world by regulating the global climate. It helps stabilizing global climate and fighting global warming. Its health directly impacts the health of the glabal ecological system.

 

 WHY WILL YOU LOVE QIPILLOW?

1. QiPillow helps 91% of users improve sitting posture and comfort, while reducing back stiffness, pain and fatigue due to prolonged sitting – The support provided by QiPillow to your back is gentle and soothing at all times, regardless the design of your sofa, chair or seat. In a third party consumer use study, after seven days of use, 91% of participants agreed that QiPillow helped them sit more comfortably. Imagine you could sit and play longer with your kids on you sofa. Imagine you don't have to stand up and stretch your back every 3 minutes and could achieve more in less time. Imagine you could rest and rejuvenate better, the next time you sit!

Amazing benefits proven by the third party study:

 

2. With QiPillow, your back support adjusts to your body, your seat and your comfort – instead of the other way round. Like a Sleep Number Bed and expensive back support in luxury cars, QiPillow gives you the total control and can be easily adjusted to your utmost comfort. You can make it a little softer or firmer in less than 10 seconds.  It will always conform to your back, seat and comfort. Your comfort is set completely according to your preference.    

Quick_flow valve - easy inflation with no tool required

 

Quick and clean inflation – a few puffs of air will do. your lips rest on your fingers instead of the valve.

 

3. Stylish and universal – orthopedic back support is important to anybody who sits for prolonged periods. But they often don't look good. As the only one of its kind, QiPillow's innovative design provides superior orthopedic support to your back while blending seamlessly into your sofa, couch, lounge chair, arm chair, office chair, bed and car seat. It adds a beautiful touch in virtually any sitting environment at home, work and in cars.

Orthopedic support can indeed be this beautiful ...

 

 

4. QiPillow helps improve your sitting posture instantly – the ergonomic support of QiPillow automatically goes where it is needed the most behind your back, and helps support your back and maintain a healthy posture effortlessly. Your back will stop sinking into the sofa. Your posture will be improved instantly. A third party consumer use study shows that QiPillow helped 91% of study participants improve sitting posture.

A healthy upright posture supported by QiPillow

 

5. QiPillow Helps you reduce stiffness, pain and fatigue in the back – it has been said that 90% of chairs used in offices are not fit to what they are used for. One of the key problems is that people have a hard time to maintain a good sitting posture. Slouching increases the stress and tension in the back, and is the key cause for mechanical back pains, stiffness and fatigue due to prolonged sitting. QiPillow helps users prevent slouching, reduce stress and tension in the back. In a third party clinical study, after seven days of use, 91% of participants with back pain found that QiPillow helped them reduce stiffness, aches, pains or fatigue.   

6. QiPillow helps you look better and feel younger – Poor posture makes a person look older, unhealthy and less confident. Slouching also reduce your vital capacity, compromise your breathing, your concentration and mental capacity. QiPillow helps users maintain a better posture, look better and feel younger.

  ­

7. It is soothing and calming to your back, like no other – after a day of busy work, the soothing and calming effect of QiPillow is literally "God sent". A third party consumer use study, 86% of participants with back pain found that QiPillow helped sooth and ease their back. QiPillow's soothing effects can be noticed within seconds of use, by virtually all users.

8. Easy to use – It takes less than 1 minute to customize QiPillow to your utmost personal comfort. Virtually anyone can do it. 

9. Portable – at only 15.5 oz., QiPillow weighs less than half of the weight of a traditional sofa pillow of the comparable size. Once packed away, QiPillow’s volume would be about only 1/5 of a traditional sofa pillow of comparable size. You can easily take it anywhere, even on airplanes.

Weighs only 15.5 oz

 

Less than 1/5 of original size after deflating and folding

10. Quality – QiPillow is made of the highest grade materials. Its ergonomic core is made of pure polyurethane that is extremely strong and durable. It can support body weight upto 350 LB. The surrounding cushioning layer is made of high elasticity polyester fibers. The cover is made of premium 200g micro-suede which is soft, cushy, dust-free, low maintenance and highly durable.  QiPillow has been rigorously tested by SGS – a global quality assurance agency.

Premium micro-suede fabric for the cover

 

Pure polyurethane air chamber, and high elasticity polyester fiber for additional cushioning

 

 

Product tested by SGS – a global quality assurance agency

    

 

How does it work?

The secret is in its air-controlled ergonomic core that maintains a perfect support to your back at all time. Air is resielient to compression, yet easily controllable and fully conforming. Unlike ordinary pillows filled with feathers, fibers or memory foam, QiPillow never loses it support. Its support constantly conforms to your body, your seat and your comfort. The ergonomic core is fully adjustable to suit your utmost personal comfort.

The core is surrounded by a soft cushioning layer to give the pillow its cushy and cozy touch and feel.

The pillow is then encased in a cool detachable and interchageable cover which can be taken off for washing and can be replaced by a favorite pillow cover of yours.

Where is the tech?

Using the same technology of Sleep Number Beds and expensive back support in luxury cars, QiPillow is the only one of its kind to transform your couches, chairs and car seats into healthy comfort stations. The technology is also in the materials of QiPillow’s magical ergonomic core, its surrounding cushioning layer and its cover. Here are some of their many benefits:

-          Proven health benefits

-          Improves sitting posture

-          Unparalleled comfort

-          Better rejuvenation

-          Superior portability

-          Super easy to use

-          Low maintenance

-          Low cost

-          3 year warranty

 

Whom is it designed for?

QiPillow is designed for virtually anyone who enjoys a comfortable and healthy sitting at home, work or in cars.

Do you or your loved ones need to sit for prolonged periods at work?

Do you or your loved ones enjoy a long ride in a car, train or airplane?

Do your kids enjoy sitting on a sofa or in a chair playing with their iPad or computer game?  

Do you or your loved ones enjoy sitting on a sofa or in a chair to read a book or watch TV?

With the pending launch of Apply iTV, our time spent sitting in front of the TV is expected to further increase.  It will be more important than ever to make sure that our time spent in sofas is as healthy as possible.

QiPillow can help you, your family and loved ones improve sitting posture and comfort, effortlessly.

 

QiPillow for Your family ...                                      Your loved ones, and ...

 

You

 

 

Why did I create QiPillow?

For over a decade starting in 2002, my team and I have been working with thousands of back pain specialists around USA, Canada, UK, Australia and many other countries, and assisting their patients in drug-free back-pain relief while sitting. Our innovations can be characterized as effective, versatile, multifunctional, easy to use and low cost.

I love having a good rest sitting on my favorite sofa. However It was always difficult to maintain a proper posture. I couldn’t find a sofa pillow that could help because they all collapsed behind my back. I was tired of slouching when sitting on sofas. That’s when I started creating a solution to help people to improve their sitting posture and comfort while sitting. I hope that QiPillow will help make people's lives a little more comfortable.

R&D, Quality standard?

In order to satisfy the demands of the most discriminating doctors, we consistently followed the highest standard throughout the R&D process. The efficacy of QiPillow has been proven by third part consumer use study. The product quality has been rigorously tested by SGS – an internal quality assurance agency with its origin traces back to Switzerland in 1878.

What it is not for?

QiPillow is not designed as a sleeping pillow which you would use for regular sleep through out the night day in day out. Its health benefits are best utilized when used to spport the back. 

QiPillow is not a pain killer. It helps combat the cause for back pain, but not the pain itself. In particular, it helps you reduce and prevent slouching which is a key cause for back pain.

QiPillow is not designed for users without core stability or any acute medical conditions.

Where we are at?

We have been working on QiPillow for 3 years now. We have completed the design and a small production run. Product performance is clinically proven.  Product quality is rigorously tested tested by SGS. Your help will allows us to quickly expand our production to get QiPillow into the hands of the millions who need it. 

Why you would want to support QiPillow?

By supporting QiPillow, you could help ...

1. make your sitting more comfortable and rejuvenating

2. put an end to your loved ones' strugles for better sitting posure and comfort  

3. make your family and loved ones happy 

4. You get one of first QiPillows the world has ever seen,

5. You will help support the environment, and

6. allow us to help more people who need QiPillow 

Please join us, today. Together, we can make this world a little more comfortable.

Keep in mind, QiPillow makes a great gift to anybody who enjoyes a comfortable and healthy rest while sitting at home, at work or in cars.

An important note to our oversee friends: we sincerely apologize for the high shipping costs. The shipping costs for small quantities are indeed mind boggling. Unfortunately it is what the courriers and postal offices in USA and Canada charge. If you like QiPillow, please kindly help spread the word. Thank you in advance.

Canadian Science for Comfort - World's only one of a kind orthopedic solution to sooth your back, anywhere you sit. 
As a Human Spinal Biomechanics Researcher, I have been working with thousands of licensed back healthcare specialists across United States and Canada. In the past decade, my team and I have created an extensive line of home spinal health care solutions that helps people take care of the health of their entire spine from the neck to the lower back. However, QiPillow (pronounced as Chi-Pillow) is the one we are most proud of, because it will benefit the most people in the world.
Most of us have a sedentary life style, today. Unfortunately, our body is not built for sitting. And most chairs, sofas and car seats are not built to support our back. The problem with sitting is that it tends to destroy our healthy posutre and cause the deep stabilizing muscles in our lower back to tense and stiffen, both of which often lead to stiffness, pain and fatigue in our back.   
As a 100% Canadian innovation, QiPillow is here to rescue. Being world's only one of a kind orthopedic solution, QiPillow effectively helps you both improve your sitting posture and prevent your deep stabilizing muscles from tensing. 
In a third party consumer use study, 91% of participants were amazed about how well QiPillow helped them improve their sitting posture and comfort while relieving their back stiffness, pain and fatigue while sitting. (See below for details) 


How does QiPillow work?
The secret is in its air-controlled ergonomic core. Powered by the same technology used in expensive back support of luxury cars, QiPillow also uses air as its supporting medium. Its air-controlled ergonomic core is great at maintaining its support, and is highly conforming and easily adjustable. As a result, QiPillow will never collapse under your body weight, and never lose its ergonomic support to your back. And like a Sleep Number Bed, QiPillow will adjust to your body, your seat and your comfort, instead of the other way round.
QiPillow maintains its support, while ordinary pillows lose 2/3 or more of their support under body weight (imagine that the forearm is your spine).

Who can benefit from QiPillow?
Anyone can benefit from QiPillow, whether your are an office worker, a taxi driver, a truck driver, a retired senior, or even a student doing a lot of home work. QiPillow helps you sooth and protect your back while seemlessly blending into your sitting environment, at home, work, school or in your car.
If you or someone you know have a challenged back or simply wish to improve sitting posture or comfort, this innovation is engineered for you.

story:
My Name is Tracy Murphy, I am a Dialysis patient. I've been on Dialysis for a little over 3 years now. A few months back I was talking with one of my Doctors about ways to work out while being on Dialysis. Before my kidneys failed I was a fitness instructor and would teach aerobics classes a few times a week.  The Doctor had suggested looking into a bike I could use while having dialysis done. I never heard of it before and went home that night after my treatment of dialysis to find out more. Sure enough after doing a quick google search on the net I was able to find some dialysis bikes and all the benifts they had to offer a dialysis patient like myself.

Biking while on Dialysis has been a huge success for many dialysis patients. Recently we had some Physiotherapy Students from Dalhousie University work with our dialysis patients to find out just how much using the bike while on dialysis would help benefit their physical and mental health. The results were amazing - It Really helped to improve the patients quality of life. One of the goals the dialysis patient Peggy had set was to be able to walk around her block with confidence that she could make it there and back. Seems like a simple goal for most however to many of our dialysis patents this is a big achievement.
 Another issues as a Dialysis patient that we have is dealing with Restless Legs - Having to sit in a chair for 3 to 5 hours at a time 3 - 5 days a week is no easy task. There are many times that I'd love to just get up and walk around however while connected to the machine it's not safe. Having the option to peddle is a great relief when you feel the need to move.
While reading up on the dialysis bike I also learned how by using the bike while having dialysis done we can actually help clean more of our blood!. Theres a pump on the dialysis machine that we can increase or decrease the speed of depending on what a safe pump speed would be for each person. The faster the pump the more blood that will get cleaned in your body. When we ride the bike and have dialysis done at the same time our blood will pump that much faster there for leaving us with less toxins in our blood at the end of our treatments ;) 
 
 With the help of Trenas Studio in Bedford NS I taught a kick boxing class where we donated any funds given to this cause. We raised a little over $80.00 towards our Goal. My goal is to raise enough to purcase 3 bikes for our units.
 
The Bikes are about $1300 each making our goal $ 3900.00 
The hospital does not have it in their  budget to help with any of the costs for the bikes. please helps us reach our goal and make this dream possible. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • Each Bike is $1300 to purchase. We have 3 Dialysis Units at our Halifax Hospital. My goal is to raise enough funds to purchase 1 bike per unit.
  • One of the perks I will give to those who are able to donate is to skype you while I am at the dialysis unit so you can see where your donations have helped.
  • Every dollar Truly helps. If we are not able to reach our goal of one bike per dialysis unit then we will combine all the funds raised to purchase what we can.

 

 Please help us make some noise about our campaign and pass the word around. Thank you so much for your time and support

story:
We are embarking on a historic journey from Boston to Rio to petition for clean water as a right for all Americans. Join us.

This holiday season, join us for the journey of a lifetime!  Your generous contribution on Indiegogo will allow us to purchase and customize the van that will showcase our record-breaking petition for clean water for the Americas.  With any pledge greater than $25, your name will appear in a creative, typographic mosaic that will cover the very petition van that will take us throughout the Americas to Brazil.

Your name, or the name of a loved one, will appear in our official petition book, in the video credits of a YouTube documentary release after the tour, and even on the van itself with a pledge greater than $25!

But wait, why water? 

Don't know much about the world's water crisis?  That's OK!  Take two minutes and click here at Water.org’s homepage to learn more.  

It will be two minutes that could change your outlook on life completely.

Why Unity?

Unity is the key solution for our world’s water crisis.  The United Nations has demonstrated the importance of unity through their groundbreaking initiative in the Millennium Development Goals (MDG), 2000-2015.  To date, the MDG have been mankind’s most successful effort in combating modern poverty. Reasonable goal-setting and a collective drive have been the key ingredients for its success.  Water for the Americas strives to become an extension of this great effort.

Why the Americas?

We are so close to achieving UN-sanctioned Developed Region Status in Latin America and the Caribbean!  And that’s why we’re committing our campaign to the region.  

With the success of our tour, we hope to attract key players representative of society’s four sectors essential for our success in water development-citizens, private, non-profit, government- to initiate UN-approved round-table discussions to establish developmental goals in water for the region of Latin America and the Caribbean. By utilizing UN and WHO metrics, we hope to release educated material that can guide society as a whole into a greater unified effort to secure safe drinking water for all in the Americas.

The Americas and Beyond

Sometimes, the development industry forgets the value of unity behind our common interests.  Herein lies the problem.  We envision a greater overall reaction to efforts like this one if we were to be successful with achieving sustainable access to clean water in the Americas.  Our hope is to demonstrate with this project how the world can come together to achieve goals proposed by the UN and WHO, and how we could then unite efforts for other regions in the world.

Our Campaign Summary

Check out our official Tour Summary listed below.  We hope that our visuals help to bring Water for the Americas to life.  

The only thing missing is a tour van with your name on it!








Please note that the above-mentioned cost breakdown constitutes the bare-minimum for tour execution.  As suggested, food, accommodation, and other personnel costs are not included in the breakdown and will be incurred by Reach Trade LLC if not funded by Indiegogo patrons.  Additional funds will be invested for personnel costs while on tour and heightened security/emergency funds.

Want to know more about us at Reach Trade?

Never heard of Reach Trade?  Learn more about our business and our water projects, past and present, here:

Reach Trade (USA): http://reachtrade.com/

Reach Peru (Peru):  http://reachperu.com/

Additional disclaimer:  Reach Trade, LLC, is not a non-profit, therefore, contributions are not tax deductible. On the tour, we will be hosting events to raise funds to combat the water crisis.  Individuals who wish to make tax deductible donations can contact us for more information at paul@reachtrade.com or dan@reachtrade.com for more detail.
story_txt:
We are embarking on a historic journey from Boston to Rio to petition for clean water as a right for all Americans. Join us.This holiday season, join us for the journey of a lifetime!  Your generous contribution on Indiegogo will allow us to purchase and customize the van that will showcase our record-breaking petition for clean water for the Americas.  With any pledge greater than $25, your name will appear in a creative, typographic mosaic that will cover the very petition van that will take us throughout the Americas to Brazil.Your name, or the name of a loved one, will appear in our official petition book, in the video credits of a YouTube documentary release after the tour, and even on the van itself with a pledge greater than $25!But wait, why water? Don't know much about the world's water crisis?  That's OK!  Take two minutes and click here at Water.org’s homepage to learn more.  It will be two minutes that could change your outlook on life completely.Why Unity?Unity is the key solution for our world’s water crisis.  The United Nations has demonstrated the importance of unity through their groundbreaking initiative in the Millennium Development Goals (MDG), 2000-2015.  To date, the MDG have been mankind’s most successful effort in combating modern poverty. Reasonable goal-setting and a collective drive have been the key ingredients for its success.  Water for the Americas strives to become an extension of this great effort.Why the Americas?We are so close to achieving UN-sanctioned Developed Region Status in Latin America and the Caribbean!  And that’s why we’re committing our campaign to the region.  With the success of our tour, we hope to attract key players representative of society’s four sectors essential for our success in water development-citizens, private, non-profit, government- to initiate UN-approved round-table discussions to establish developmental goals in water for the region of Latin America and the Caribbean. By utilizing UN and WHO metrics, we hope to release educated material that can guide society as a whole into a greater unified effort to secure safe drinking water for all in the Americas.The Americas and BeyondSometimes, the development industry forgets the value of unity behind our common interests.  Herein lies the problem.  We envision a greater overall reaction to efforts like this one if we were to be successful with achieving sustainable access to clean water in the Americas.  Our hope is to demonstrate with this project how the world can come together to achieve goals proposed by the UN and WHO, and how we could then unite efforts for other regions in the world.Our Campaign SummaryCheck out our official Tour Summary listed below.  We hope that our visuals help to bring Water for the Americas to life.  The only thing missing is a tour van with your name on it!
Please note that the above-mentioned cost breakdown constitutes the bare-minimum for tour execution.  As suggested, food, accommodation, and other personnel costs are not included in the breakdown and will be incurred by Reach Trade LLC if not funded by Indiegogo patrons.  Additional funds will be invested for personnel costs while on tour and heightened security/emergency funds.Want to know more about us at Reach Trade?Never heard of Reach Trade?  Learn more about our business and our water projects, past and present, here:Reach Trade (USA): http://reachtrade.com/Reach Peru (Peru):  http://reachperu.com/Additional disclaimer:  Reach Trade, LLC, is not a non-profit, therefore, contributions are not tax deductible. On the tour, we will be hosting events to raise funds to combat the water crisis.  Individuals who wish to make tax deductible donations can contact us for more information at paul@reachtrade.com or dan@reachtrade.com for more detail.

story:
Voice Of An Angel

Born with a voice of an angel, Julie began singing professionally in 1982.  Over the years, she has sung for greats such as Rod Stewart, Diana Ross, kd Lang, Whitney Houston, Elton John, Andrea Bocelli, Barbara Streisand, Beyonce', Usher, Celine Dion, Earth Wind & Fire, and the list goes on.

Three years ago, while on tour backing up 7-time Grammy award winning recording artist John Mayer, as well as preparing for her own solo project, she discovered a lump on her breast during a self examination.  After seeing a doctor, she was diagnosed with breast cancer.  Devastated, she had to leave the tour in order to begin chemo and radiation treatments.  While dealing with the pain of this disease, and discomfort of the treatments she endured, Julie was determined to support other survivors by speaking and even singing for many national cancer foundations such as The Patient Advocate Foundation, the Patrick Dempsey Cancer Challenge, and Amgen’s Break Away From Cancer organization. 

While staying the course with her mission spreading hope to others, and surviving her breast cancer, one year later, the cancer returned, but this time, in her lungs. The very organ that supports the deliverance of her ethereal voice to the masses.  Julie finds it difficult to breathe when just walking to her mailbox to retrieve her mail.  However, she pushes on and continues to sing whenever possible. Late last year, the cancer spread to her bones and brain.  Julie is literally fighting for her life.

With the high cost of medical treatments, Julie's savings from past tours and other performance projects are exhausted.  She has spent her career supporting others, and now she could use the support. In the beginning of her fight, a select few have come through for Julie above and beyond her wildest dreams; helping her get through her initial series of treatments.  However, the battle is still on and she needs our help now.

Your donation will assist with Julie's future medical expenses including therapy, medicine & supplements needed to keep her body strong, and rid the cancer from her body.  Not to mention, it will assist with her everyday living expenses as she's unable to work at this time.

Julie is ready to beat this cancer for good.  She knows it will take every ounce of fight she can muster, and the financial assistance to do so. Be assured, she is up for the fight!

We can give Julie a fighting chance and provide her some peace of mind! Can we count on you?

Looking forward to your favorable response through your donations :)  Keep Julie's complete recovery in your thoughts and prayers!

Blessings of Love,

Team Julie

story:
UPDATE:

We reached our 12K goal, which is amazing!! Thank you so much to everyone.

We're setting ourselves a stretch goal of 15K, and here's why:

We got an interesting email last week, followed up by an interesting phone call, informing us that People In The Know think there is a US market for the Drip Clip. If we're able to rally folks in the next few hours and meet our stretch goal, we could use the funds to help us file for FDA approval of the device much sooner than we anticipated! We're still trying to process all of this, but the potential sounds really exciting! It would help us build our market more rapidly, and with lower barriers to sales and marketing. 

 

Our Dream

We are a start-up company with the mission of building hyper low-cost medical devices for resource-limited settings (anywhere from hospice care to developing world clinics, disaster relief, etc). This campaign is to fund the manufacturing and field testing of our first product, the Drip Clip. 

We think there is room for more than philanthropy in the world of global health, and we want to show that if you build the right kind of solutions, then people will buy them. The Drip Clip is the first prototype developed by Shift Labs, and with your support we can gather critical user feedback to ensure the first product we sell is one people actually want. 

What is the Drip Clip? 

Our first product is a drip monitor, a replacement for expensive pumps that dose fluid from IV bags. A physician at Doctors Without Borders alerted us to the difficulty that front-line health workers in resource-limited settings often have counting IV drips by hand and then, in their heads, estimating the accurate doses of crucial medicines. 

To use the Drip Clip, you clip it to an IV bag and it reads instantaneously. It requires no expertise to use, but it can provide precise information. It measures drip rates by detecting variations in light transmission between an LED and photodiode. The LCD screen displays the flow rate pre-calculated to the units of mL per hour. 

Who we are 

The highly paid actors you saw in the video: Beth, Lisa, Phil, Cameron, Shevin, and Jacqueline are only a small portion of the founders, advisors, and doctors collaborating on this project. We have a crew of multidisciplinary hackers, makers, business experts and entrepreneurs contributing their passion and expertise. 

The core of Shift Labs are: 
Beth Kolko, PhD - human-centered design, ethnography, technology design for resource-limited settings 
Lisa Lafleur, PhD - diagnostic test design for resource-limited settings, microfluidics, immunoassays 
Phil Rutschman - signal processing, embedded software, electronics 
Dr. Shevin Jacob, the newest member of our core team - infectious disease specialist and WHO consultant who has spent several years practicing in resource-limited settings

We also have a larger team of talented medical professionals and engineers, and some first-rate mentors and advisors. Some of the people who help make us great are: Dr. Eric Rasmussen, Dr. Cameron Bass, Dr. Xandra Rarden, Rob Flickenger, David Hulton, Adam Cecchetti, Pablos Holman, Pierce Nichols, Matthew Borgatti, and Bre Pettis. 

Shift Labs emerged from our belief that medical technology could be more creative and less expensive -- and ultimately sustain a for-profit business model. We’d worked on technologies and products in the past, only to have them never see the light of day. We’d try; we’d take some of our work to companies with the knowledge and power to change the world, but they weren’t interested. The tipping point was having a VP at one company explain why they weren’t interested in the low-cost innovation being discussed: “we could make cheaper technology, but it wouldn't support the cost of our sales force." We believe that the world has changed enough that old models need not dominate. We think there is a space in the world where we can fuel an ethically successful and sustainable business without it being driven solely by charity and donation. We can maintain very low costs in ideation, engineering, and manufacturing so the people who need our devices most can afford them. 

What we have done so far 

Worked with doctors to identify needs in the field 
Determined low-cost solution to drop rate counting need 
Designed and validated early prototypes 
Validated electronics systems and created two board revisions

What we have left to do

Finalizing the housing. We're finalizing the design with an industrial designer over the next 6-8 weeks, and concurrently we'll be shopping around for manufacturers for our production run. We’re focusing on simplicity of use, durability, and resource efficient manufacturing. 

Drip Clip assembly. We've reached out to local "Opportunity Workshops" that employ disabled workers to do electronics assembly. They do a lot of work for Boeing, so they have experience with precision assembly, and they are local so we can eliminate some of the complexities with outsourcing. 

Determine field testing goals and surveys. We want to make sure that our products pass the "want" as well as the "need" test, especially in rural areas. We'll also use our field tests to see if there are other features that are important, and how usage under real-world conditions can help us improve our design. 

What we'll do with the money

Fund the Manufacturing of a First Batch of Drip Clips 
Electronics - For a run of 10 - $44.84, 100 - $12.60, 1000 - $7.36, 5000 - $6.49 
Housings - Depending on the number of Drip Clips, we’ll either use resin casting (approx $3 per unit), or a small run of plastic housings (approx $3-5 per unit). We have materials to do the tooling on site for resin casting, and we would outsource for plastic housings. 
Assembly - $15/hr, 1 hr/unit 

Fund Field Testing in India and East Africa 
Sending doctors to field sites - $0 (all company advisors volunteering their time) 
Sending 2 engineers to field sites - $5000 

Our medical partners will do the testing, and Shift Labs team members will travel to help collect and analyze data and hack on the prototype as necessary in the field. 

Distribution and regulation 

It turns out there are lots of great, low-cost medical technologies out there -- either actually being produced, or in prototype stage. But the complex world of distribution means that by the time a $10 piece of technology makes it to an actual purchaser, it costs $100 or maybe $1000 because of all the steps in the chain. We're being creative about distribution, too. But for more on that, keep an eye on our blog at shiftlabs.com.

Also, we want to make sure you know we're following all local and international guidelines for testing of our devices. And we'll go through the regulatory procedure for the markets where we sell our devices.

story:
Who we are

I founded this organization, Give Back International, in 2008 with the intent of raising money to help the Haitian's living in the Dominican Republic. It started off as a student group at the University of California, Berkeley and has since expanded across the US. We are in the process of forming a non-profit with the hopes of being able to impact an even greater number of people.

Our Mission is simple, to provide free medical clinics, supplies and education to underprivileged communities throughout the world. We will accomplish this by sending teams of healthcare professionals to the Dominican Republic, Haiti and other nations with prominent underprivileged communities. By combining medicine and education, Give Back International aims to provide a long-term improvement in healthcare as well as foster a sense of hope in these nations. 

Dominican Republic Statistics:

-More than 1 in 4 children live in poverty

-Chronic malnutrition affects 1 in 5 pre-school children

-Population: almost 10 million people with 1.5 hospital beds per 1000 people compared with 4 beds per 1000 people in the US

Haiti Statistics:

-78% of Haitians live off less than $2 a day

-50% of children under 5 are malnourished

-AIDS/HIV infects almost 6% of the population compared with 0.5% of the US population

What We Need

Our organization is leading two medical missions to the Dominican Republic this summer with over 35 pre-medical, medical students as well as nurses and physicians. We are raising money to help fund supplies for these trips.

Every penny that we raise is used towards medications and medical supplies on one of our upcoming missions. An example of how your donation can make a difference:

$5 will supply a family of 6 with toothbrushes, toothpaste and soap

$15 will provide essential vitamins for mom and baby for an entire pregnancy

$25 will provide 100 people with treatment for scabies

$50 will supply 50lbs of clothes to a village

Thats right, 100% of donations are used to fund supplies! Each team member must fund their own trip. We want to provide as much medication and supplies to this community.

Although our goal is set at only a $1,000, we hope to surpass that. Each trip we spend roughly $3,500+ on supplies ALONE. Every $1 counts!

The Impact

To date we have raised over $13,500 and treated over 4,500 patients on eight missions to the Dominican Republic and Haiti!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to donate at this time we would greatly appreciate the help by spreading the word about our cause. You can visit us on the web at www.givebackint.org or email us at info@givebackint.org.

story:
Old age is tough at Richmond Home...

Friends of Richmond Home is a registered not-for-profit organisation that has been set up to ensure the well-being and dignity of Grenada's most vulnerable elderly by helping the Richmond Home cope with its unmet needs.

Richmond Home for the Elderly is a geriatric Home that offers free residential facilities to senior citizens. The Home was set up to welcome Grenada’s neediest people when they reach old age. Most of the residents are elderly people who have lost their independence and do not have family to ensure their care or are destitute. As a result, about 80% of the residents do not benefit from family support.

Despite all the efforts put in place by the staff, the material needs of the home in consumables and equipment isn’t met by the Government alone and the home substantially relies on donations for everything from washing powder to major repairs to the building.

You can find more about the home and our organisation on Our Website

How you can change their lifes

In conjunction with the Home's management and the Ministry of Health, we have established a detailed wish list of needs to cater to the most urgent needs of the residents. The list accounts for:

  • Consumable items that are either not provided or not provided in sufficient quantities by the Government;
  • Residents’ personal items are normally provided by the resident’s families;
  • Home equipment needs.
The total donations needed for fulfill the home equipment needs and the consumable item for a year is US$ 36,000.


This is only 3,600 people giving US$ 10

With your help, we can reach that target:

Give US$ 10 or more
Inform your family, friends, work colleagues, school friends and organisation's members about the campaign
Share this campaign on Facebook and other social networks

story:
T is for... Top Surgery.

Hi! My name is Aron or Moe, depending on when and where we met. I'm a 29-year-old genderqueer transguy, and I'm finally having top surgery with Dr. Curtis Crane on August 18th.

Holy cow! That's in less than 17 days, right? 

Yeah, it is!

Dr. Crane is a world renowned surgeon, running a plastic surgery clinic out of Greenbrae, Calif., that is dedicated exclusively to gender confirmation procedures for the transgender community.  I shopped around a lot, and his combination of experience and the holistic approach he brings to his practice led me to choose him for my surgery. He's so popular in fact, that I was going to have to wait until June 2015 for a surgery date! Then, the miraculous happened: Someone cancelled, and I took the appointment. 

While I've saved for this surgery for over five years, it turns out I'm still a bit short. (More on that below.) 

Most important for you to know, however, is that this surgery has been a long time coming and is very important to my mental and physical well-being. While I don't have the kind of soul-crushing body dysphoria that some trans people experience, I experience consistent stress, distress, and downright physical pain trying to hide this part of my body from the rest of the world -- a world that now thankfully sees me as male due to the wondrous effects of testosterone. Chest binding has numerous negative impacts on one's health and has caused enough back & neck damage over the last 9 years that I can't even bind anymore. Having this surgery, and having it soon, will make a permanent, positive impact on my daily life, health, and happiness.

I'm ready to be healthier, happier, and more comfortable. 

T is for... The Cost.

The cost of this surgery is high: $12,945 to be exact. I also have to take at least 1 - 3 weeks off of work (mostly unpaid plus more time off special events work) and travel to the Bay Area from Southern California for surgery. 

Since the surgeon I chose is in state, I will not incur as many travel expenses as I might have, but the total cost will still be around $14,885. 

  • Top Surgery (incld. hospital fee and anesthesiologist): $8,820
  • Body Contouring Liposuction: $3,825
  • Anti-Nausea/Scopalamine Patch: $300
  • Two trips to SF and back (pre-op and post-op): $270
  • Accommodations in SF: $600 already covered via pre-campaign donation!
  • Immediate Post-Surgery Care: $395
  • Longer-term Post-Surgery Care: $675

Regrettably, none of this will be covered by insurance. (And I still gotta pay rent and feed my hungry, fat, lovable, cancer-surviving cat!)

I've been working multiple jobs to save up for this surgery for as long as many of you have known me, and I've managed to put away $10,266 for surgery costs. This leaves me $4,019 short. 

T is for... This is Where You Come In.

I'd like to humbly ask for your help making up part of that $4,019 difference. (I'm hoping to raise slightly over half -- or $2,500.)

$10 will provide me with a post-surgery meal and add immensely in my healing process. 

$30 will provide me with a tube of Metaderma scar gel and help get me beach body ready for next summer. 

$75 will cover pre-surgery blood-work and make sure everything is working the way it should before I go under. 

$135 will pay for the gas for one trip back and forth to the Bay Area for my pre-op or surgery appointments. 

And $5 will, I'm told, cover one stitch. 

You've all been so wonderful, warm, and supportive throughout this entire process, so I'm hesitant to ask for even more.  I will make this surgery happen in 17 days regardless of coming up short in my surgery fund, but having the knowledge that I won't have to bridge the entire gap post-surgery -- when I'm not going to be able to work my side jobs in special events much for 1-2 months -- will ease my mind incredibly and allow me to focus that much more on my recovery. 

Anything you're able to provide is wonderful, even if it's warm wishes, cards, or visits in LA or SF instead of donations. (I love visits!) Also, just simply sharing this with your social network would be amazing. It would only take 125 people giving $20 per person -- or even better, 250 people giving only $10 per person -- to make this happen. (Awesome!)

    T is for... Thank You. 

    Seriously. Thank you. 

    Thank you for your donations and for sharing this with your social networks. Thank you for reading this far into my story! But most importantly, thank you for your support, love, friendship, and kindness. It's meant the world to me to be surrounded by such a lovely community of friends and family, and I've been able to do that much more to make myself happy because of the support you've all shown me. I've repeatedly found myself in awe from the kind words people have shared -- and not everyone is this lucky. So really, thank you from the bottom of my heart. 

    T is for... The After Story. 

    Want to know what happens? Want to see the blood, the bandages, and Rosana's attempts to feed me after surgery? Follow me on Instagram or Facebook and search #operationhipstertanktop. 

    I will also post follow-up updates here; feel free to reach out to me by email as well. 

    Note: Paypal payments have not been enabled at this time but are forthcoming. Also, more perks!
story_txt:
T is for... Top Surgery. Hi! My name is Aron or Moe, depending on when and where we met. I'm a 29-year-old genderqueer transguy, and I'm finally having top surgery with Dr. Curtis Crane on August 18th.
Holy cow! That's in less than 17 days, right? 
Yeah, it is!
Dr. Crane is a world renowned surgeon, running a plastic surgery clinic out of Greenbrae, Calif., that is dedicated exclusively to gender confirmation procedures for the transgender community.  I shopped around a lot, and his combination of experience and the holistic approach he brings to his practice led me to choose him for my surgery. He's so popular in fact, that I was going to have to wait until June 2015 for a surgery date! Then, the miraculous happened: Someone cancelled, and I took the appointment. 
While I've saved for this surgery for over five years, it turns out I'm still a bit short. (More on that below.) 
Most important for you to know, however, is that this surgery has been a long time coming and is very important to my mental and physical well-being. While I don't have the kind of soul-crushing body dysphoria that some trans people experience, I experience consistent stress, distress, and downright physical pain trying to hide this part of my body from the rest of the world -- a world that now thankfully sees me as male due to the wondrous effects of testosterone. Chest binding has numerous negative impacts on one's health and has caused enough back & neck damage over the last 9 years that I can't even bind anymore. Having this surgery, and having it soon, will make a permanent, positive impact on my daily life, health, and happiness.
I'm ready to be healthier, happier, and more comfortable. 



T is for... The Cost.

 The cost of this surgery is high: $12,945 to be exact. I also have to take at least 1 - 3 weeks off of work (mostly unpaid plus more time off special events work) and travel to the Bay Area from Southern California for surgery. 
Since the surgeon I chose is in state, I will not incur as many travel expenses as I might have, but the total cost will still be around $14,885. 


Top Surgery (incld. hospital fee and anesthesiologist): $8,820
Body Contouring Liposuction: $3,825
Anti-Nausea/Scopalamine Patch: $300

Two trips to SF and back (pre-op and post-op): $270
Accommodations in SF: $600 already covered via pre-campaign donation!

Immediate Post-Surgery Care: $395

Longer-term Post-Surgery Care: $675


Regrettably, none of this will be covered by insurance. (And I still gotta pay rent and feed my hungry, fat, lovable, cancer-surviving cat!)
I've been working multiple jobs to save up for this surgery for as long as many of you have known me, and I've managed to put away $10,266 for surgery costs. This leaves me $4,019 short. 


  T is for... This is Where You Come In. I'd like to humbly ask for your help making up part of that $4,019 difference. (I'm hoping to raise slightly over half -- or $2,500.)
$10 will provide me with a post-surgery meal and add immensely in my healing process. 
$30 will provide me with a tube of Metaderma scar gel and help get me beach body ready for next summer. 
$75 will cover pre-surgery blood-work and make sure everything is working the way it should before I go under. 
$135 will pay for the gas for one trip back and forth to the Bay Area for my pre-op or surgery appointments. 
And $5 will, I'm told, cover one stitch. 
You've all been so wonderful, warm, and supportive throughout this entire process, so I'm hesitant to ask for even more.  I will make this surgery happen in 17 days regardless of coming up short in my surgery fund, but having the knowledge that I won't have to bridge the entire gap post-surgery -- when I'm not going to be able to work my side jobs in special events much for 1-2 months -- will ease my mind incredibly and allow me to focus that much more on my recovery. 
Anything you're able to provide is wonderful, even if it's warm wishes, cards, or visits in LA or SF instead of donations. (I love visits!) Also, just simply sharing this with your social network would be amazing. It would only take 125 people giving $20 per person -- or even better, 250 people giving only $10 per person -- to make this happen. (Awesome!)


  

T is for... Thank You.  Seriously. Thank you. 
Thank you for your donations and for sharing this with your social networks. Thank you for reading this far into my story! But most importantly, thank you for your support, love, friendship, and kindness. It's meant the world to me to be surrounded by such a lovely community of friends and family, and I've been able to do that much more to make myself happy because of the support you've all shown me. I've repeatedly found myself in awe from the kind words people have shared -- and not everyone is this lucky. So really, thank you from the bottom of my heart. 



T is for... The After Story. 
Want to know what happens? Want to see the blood, the bandages, and Rosana's attempts to feed me after surgery? Follow me on Instagram or Facebook and search #operationhipstertanktop. 
I will also post follow-up updates here; feel free to reach out to me by email as well.

story:
Our Story

Last year, UCSB Men's rugby made it to the National Championship game, but did not finish the job.  We're looking to make a return to the National Championship game and bring back a gold medal!

 

The Impact

Our program is self-funded.  Each player pays dues to help pay for travel, uniforms, staffing and medical.  We will recieve ZERO help from the school, so the funds that are not raised will be an additional burden to each of the student-athletes on the team. This life changing experience is something that everyone involved with the program will remember forever.  Our playoff run will promote the club and help us with recruitment to keep UCSB one of the top Rugby Clubs in America.  Any help you can give will be greatly appreciated!

 

What We Need & What You Get

In reality, we need a lot more than our $15,000 goal, but this is a total we think it realistic for this campaign.  The dues the team pays goes towards team kit and funding the regular season.  We need your support to help us make it through the playoffs!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We want you to donate, but you can also help by spreading the word, posting our video on your Facebook page or Twitter account, or just emailing your friends.  Please use our 'Share Now' button

 

Go Gauchos! PARVI SED LENTI

story:
Chanchal Paswan was attacked with acid after being sexually harassed by a group of men for a very long time. She tried to lodge a complaint against these people but to no avail. Her efforts to resist their advances made her a victim of their brutality along with her younger sister. On 20th October 2012, the sisters were attacked by these men while they were sleeping on the terrace of their house in the Indian state of Bihar. Although Chanchal was the main target of the attackers her younger sister, Sonam also became an unfortunate victim of the attack. Sonam lost her both eyes in the attack. This happened in the Maner area of Bihar.
 
While their fight for justice continues, they need financial support for their treatment, rehabilitation and reconstructive surgeries.
 
A contribution of 20 US$ could mean a round trip to Delhi for one of the family members for their treatment. A contribution of 100 US$ could mean better legal aid. A contribution of 1000 US$ might help sustain Chanchal till the time she can move around. Although 2000 US$ is a very humble amount, it can help Chanchal and her sister a lot with their treatment.
 
 
 
Chanchal, Sonam and their parents with team Stop Acid Attacks

Stop Acid Attacks is India's first portal dedicated to documenting the stories of acid attack survivors, connecting them to potential donors, helping them with medical and legal aid and effecting policy change in their favor. Of all these things, the most important for them is financial aid because they need lifelong treatment and scores of reconstructive surgeries. Combine it with the fact that most of them happen to be from extremely poor backgrounds. Some of them are disadvantaged in ways that we cannot even imagine. These women have no institutional support- governmental or non-governmental- available to them. Many of them are not fit to work before going through scores of reconstructive surgeries!

 
Stop Acid Attacks urges you to contribute as per your ability and also spread the word. 10 dollars from just 200 people can help us achieve our target. Please spread the word. Please help us in helping them.
 
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/StopAcidAttacks?
Web: http://www.stopacidattacks.org
Twitter: https://twitter.com/StopAcidAttacks
