story:
FlameTube is very unusual electronic device, combining a retro-style shape of a radio tube with contemporary materials and innovative technologies. 


Right out of the box, FlameTube acts like an interactive candle with amazingly realistic flame, but it's just the beginning... By loading software applications, you can turn it into almost anything!

Decorate your home with realistic candle flames and many other visual effects! Combine FlameTube with stylish candle holders and interior accessories! Make your rooms cozy and unique! Start every single day on a positive note!

Install apps, write your own programs, create new peripherals, explore the world of IoT... Turn FlameTube into a kitchen timer, original clock, retro-style game console, music instrument, smart home sensor, notification point, earthquake detector and much more!

8-core CPU, wind, sound, acceleration sensors, multi-protocol peripheral port, innovative "lighting display" - everything  in a small lamp! Unbelievable opportunities for your creativity!


Candle App for FlameTube –
just snap your fingers!

One of the most exciting FlameTube apps is "Candle" (pre-installed). Simulated fire looks and acts exactly like a real candle flame. Just snap your fingers to light it on. Try to tilt, blow, or blow out, and see its natural responses.

To light it on, just snap your fingers!

Tilt FlameTube, and the flame will deflect.

Blow and see its natural reaction!

Blow it out and take a look at magic sparkles!



One candle - a lot of benefits!


“I always use FlameTube as a key element of interior decoration. It looks cool, and my clients are happy!”

“FlameTube in a long trip is like a small piece of my cozy home.”

"Romantic dinner with FlameTubes – what can be better?"

“When I feel lonely, I take my FlameTube and go to a cafe… And the magic happens!”

"My best pictures I draw under the light of FlameTube!"

If you're tired, you can fall asleep... The flame is absolutely safe.

Using FlameTube, you get a lot of fun, and always stay on a positive note!

FlameTube experience


FlameTube design combines retro-style shape of a radio tube with contemporary materials and innovative technologies. It symbolizes time continuity – from candle-illuminated romantic past, through the era of warm tube sound and LED-equipped present time, to the future of intelligent things.



Thanks to the design, FlameTube looks great in most interiors. You can use it as is, or in combination with different kinds of candle holders and accessories. Uncover your creativity!

TV zone, fireplace shelf, bar counter, dining room, bedside table, hallway, lobby, are the best places for FlameTube


Invite your dearest one to FlameTube-lighted dinner. Say the most important words. Love and be loved.



If you're alone, just put FlameTube on the top of the desk in a cafe. Take the device to a concert instead of a lighter. Be unique, be unusual. 



FlameTube is one of the best possible gifts for anyone. Granting the positivity to your friends, you create the most comfortable environment for yourself. One FlameTube is great, more is even better! The more FlameTubes your friends receive, the better they can decorate the party and their houses!


Become a developer!

FlameTube is a kind of a microcomputer. Currently, more than 750 software projects for robotics, signal processing, displaying, sensing and much more, are available for FlameTube’s CPU. FlameTube’s multi-protocol port is compatible to hundreds types of peripherals.


Turn your FlameTube into a contactless kitchen timer, smartphone companion, notification point for your smart home, let it work as a music instrument, retro-style game console, or invent something unique.  

One of stretch goals is FlameTube IoT Battery, allowing you to connect FlameTube or other attached device to the Internet! Using IoT Battery, you can communicate with your FlameTube locally or remotely.



Creation story

Creation of FlameTube was very exciting but not easy. Step by step, we tested our ideas of user interface, the design, circuits, electronic components, materials and other important elements. We made an uncountable number of prototypes until FlameTube got its final appearance.

After 3 years of hard work, we got the product, that we really love. We’ve made 20 units and granted them to our friends. Each of them use FlameTube in everyday life and like it very much.



Support the project!

We would be happy to share our exciting experience to everyone, as soon as possible. To make it happen, we need your help. Join us, tell your friends, share the link in social networks. Let’s together enter to the new era of human-centered things.


FAQ

 Why Flex?

 We really want FlameTube to bring pleasure and profit to many people. The Indiegogo campaign will help us to produce the product as soon as possible. But, even if we don’t collect the required amount of money during this campaign, we will do our best to find the money other ways and to produce FlameTube in time.

 What is “multi-protocol port”?

 The port contains 5 multi-purpose I/O lines that can be programmed to run several protocols, working together or independently. Digital and (with very simple circuitry) analog signals are supported. So, it’s possible to use more than one peripheral device, driven by different protocols, at the same time.

 What kind of peripheral devices and protocols are supported by FlameTube multi-protocol port?

 Currently, exists more than 750 libraries, that’s possible to use in FlameTube software development, supporting a lot of signals, protocols and peripherals, including:

  • USB 1.0 and 2.0 (3.x is not supported): host and device; supporting storage devices, Bluetooth dongles, serial devices (incl. several modems), HID (keyboard, mouse).
  • UART (serial port), supporting modems, wireless modules, GPS modules, other serial devices.
  • I2C and SPI, support several types of EEPROM, SRAM, ADC, DAC, accelerometers, gyroscopes, sensors, peripheral interface extenders, Ethernet PHY/MAC chips, GPS modules, wireless modules, displays, RTC, LED drivers, addressable LEDs.
  • DMX512
  • Infrared remote (send, receive, record, play)
  • MIDI
  • SPDIF (digital audio I/O), analog audio
  • TV out (with some limitations)
  • X10
  • Digital I/O (switches, relays, motors, quadrature encoders, etc.)
  • PWM (servo, motors, dimming)
  • Several keyboards, mouses, game controllers
  • RFID (software-based, with very simple circuitry)
  • Capacitive sensors (software-based)
  • Much more.

 Is the firmware upgradeable?

 Early firmware versions are upgradeable using Developer Kit or IoT Battery. Versions with built-in loader are upgradeable via USB connection.  We will publish firmware updates and instructions as soon, as the infrastructure is ready.

 Does the SDK exist?

 Yes. We’re going to provide the SDK and instructions as soon, as necessary infrastructure is ready.

 What kinds of programming languages FlameTube support?

 FlameTube CPU supports C/C++, Assembler and easy to use CPU-specific interpreted language.

 What is the advantage of multi-core architecture of FlameTube CPU?

 It’s an easy way to independently run time-critical and highly-deterministic algorithms in parallel with other tasks. It’s important for realtime signal processing and precision multi-protocol I/O.

story:
***** Spinal tap was clear!!!! Now Nate is scheduled for the bone flap repair on 10/26, please keep him in your thoughts and prayers!


****Update: On 10/15 Nate had is port placed and a lumar puncture. The LP will determine if there are cancerous cells in his spinal fluid.

10/16 Nate's mom took him for a follow up with the neruosurgeon and was told that the bone removed for the surgery has slipped out of place and will have to be surgrically corrected. Please do what you can for this family... 

We have $16,245 to go for this family to meet the goal, if 400 people donate 40.00 each, the Trinca's will have most of their needs met for Nate's care.

Please share his story so we can help this family!

 

The day I met Nate, he immediately stole my heart. He approached me with a zest of life and with an understanding of life that no child should have to know. He manages to not only accept what has happened to him but remain so incredibly positive and inspirational during his journey. The Trincas are an amazingly loving and open hearted family. What they are going through is unimaginable as a parent. You wish nothing but to take their place. Please open your heart, read Nate's story. - Addie Russell

 

Nate's story

Nate is an exceptional little six year old boy. He is an extremely smart kindergartener reading at a third grade level and a lover of animals (especially birds). He loves to laugh and has a wonderful imagination. Unfortunately, all of what follows is somewhat normal to Nate, as he knows nothing else, which saddens us. However, he has faced such adversity with nothing but pure spirit and serious courage and truly is a role model for all of us.

At twenty weeks pregnant with Nate we were given the devastating news that he had Tricuspid Atresia, a congenital heart defect that would require three open-heart surgeries to correct. His first surgery was at three weeks of age, soon followed by the second at nine months. This second surgery landed him at Golisano Children's Hospital in Rochester, NY for a month and a half due to a serious staph infection. This infection also incidentally led to two mini stokes — subsequent focal seizures. Because the infection ravaged the tissue surrounding the incision, he was sent home with a wound vac and a pic line leaving us to administer three types of antibiotics every three hours for two months after. Nate finally had his last surgery (Fontan procedure) in May of 2011. With all three procedures now behind us, coupled with a number of hospitalizations, we were hopeful that he was finally in the clear and set to start kindergarten in the fall of 2011.

Almost a year ago, shortly after starting kindergarten, Nate started having little flash headaches in the mornings before school that seemed to come and go rather quickly. Soon it reached a point where the headaches had been going on for well over a week, and we started to become somewhat concerned. We decided to take him to see his pediatrician. The visit uncovered nothing, but his doctor did say that if he wakes up with a headache and/or vomiting in the middle of the night to have him seen right away. The morning of Thanksgiving day 11/24/2011, Nate woke up in the middle of the night vomiting and screaming in pain with a headache. We immediately rushed him to the emergency room at Levine Children’s Hospital, here in Charlotte. After an initial CT scan, it was discovered that he had plum size mass in his brain near his cerebellum. After an extremely successful five-hour surgery to remove the mass, he was soon in recovery and we eagerly awaited the pathology report. A few days later we met with an Oncologist from Levine to review the findings, and were delivered the news that no parent ever wants to hear… The diagnosis for Nate was Grade IV Medulloblastoma, a very aggressive type of malignant brain tumor. We were completely devastated.

Secondary to that, in order to complete the follow-up MRI (to be certain that the entire tumor was removed) another surgery had to be completed in order to remove the pacemaker leads that had been implanted from Nate's last open heart surgery. We were told that there was a strong possibility the leads could become superheated during the scan, and the procedure could burn up his little heart. The leads were removed on 12/6/11. The MRI was finally completed on 12/16/11 in conjunction with a spinal tap to be certain that the tumor was completely removed and to check for any circulating malignant cells in his spinal fluid — Both tests returned negative.

The Oncologist was adamant about beginning treatment immediately. We were inundated with next steps regarding standard of care therapy to treat Nate's diagnosis which would include six weeks (5 days/week) of radiation therapy coupled with nine cycles (approximately 10 months) of chemotherapy utilizing the following treatment drugs: Vincristine, Lomustine, Cisplatin and Cyclophosphamide. This type of intense treatment on a developing six year old can also bring about a whole range of potentially severe and long-term permanent damage. We were told by numerous doctors that the radiation could cause Nate's spine to stop growing and the radiation to his brain could also potentially result in a loss of some cognitive function as well. In addition, side effects ranging from the typical nausea, vomiting, weight loss, and diarrhea, to those more serious (and permanent) lung/kidney damage, hearing loss, developmental problems, as well as the strong possibility for developing other types of cancer years later could also follow. This honestly scared us beyond belief, especially considering Nate's already pre-existing condition with Tricuspid Atresia and weakened heart. It is such a hard decision, because no matter which way we go regarding treatment, be it standard of care radiation and chemotherapy or alternative therapies, it will always be a roll of the dice. However, being very concerned for Nate's overall health and quality of life, we were bound to find another solution and began searching high and low for an alternative cancer treatment.

We discovered the Alivizatos Treatment Program… An immunotherapy-based approach to treating various forms of cancer, especially brain tumors. We have been following the treatment protocol initially suggested by Nate's doctors at IBC (International BioCare Hospital) and to date, Nate has gone through two rounds of treatment. Because the Alivizatos Treatment Program is not recognized by the FDA as being a standard of care treatment protocol for cancer patients, none of the costs are covered by insurance carriers and it is only available outside the United States. Until now, we have been able to pay for all of Nate's treatments, but we have currently exhausted all of our resources and now living check to check trying to see that Nate and our other children at least have their basic needs met.

 

Where we stand now

Nate's most recent MRI on September 14th of this year delivered some very unfortunate news, and we were completely disheartened to learn that there has been a recurrence of the tumor. On 9/25/12 Nate had surgery once again to remove the new tumor, and the latest MRI from 9/26/12 showed that there was still some residual tumor left in his brain as well as additional areas of concern in two regions of his spine. We are currently awaiting a final pathology report and have been speaking with his team of doctors — Hopefully we will soon know what our next steps will be. His little body threw us a curveball. We knew either way, conventional or alternative, that his treatment would be a gamble, but we have complete faith he WILL get through this. We still fear the devastating effects of conventional radiation and chemotherapy, however, we are open-minded and simply want the best possible outcome for him.

The idea of letting Nate have a normal childhood is what keeps us going, and we will continue holding onto that dream for him. Please know that help in any way possible is appreciated more than you can imagine. We just want to "Keep Nate Great!"

Any contribution you can give will go toward Nate's medical bills (past and present) and needs, such as copays, hospital bills, prescriptions, as well as any supplemental alternative therapies and/or treatments that are not covered by insurance.

 

Other ways you can help

It's completely understood that not everyone can help financially, but there is definitely a way that everyone CAN help... Please keep Nate in your thoughts and prayers and help spread the word of his story. It could have more of an impact than you might ever know!

We will be posting updates here on indiegogo, but you can also get even more information and follow Nate's story on Facebook. Show your support and "Like" his page at: https://www.facebook.com/KeepNateGreat
story_txt:
***** Spinal tap was clear!!!! Now Nate is scheduled for the bone flap repair on 10/26, please keep him in your thoughts and prayers!
****Update: On 10/15 Nate had is port placed and a lumar puncture. The LP will determine if there are cancerous cells in his spinal fluid. 
10/16 Nate's mom took him for a follow up with the neruosurgeon and was told that the bone removed for the surgery has slipped out of place and will have to be surgrically corrected. Please do what you can for this family...  
We have $16,245 to go for this family to meet the goal, if 400 people donate 40.00 each, the Trinca's will have most of their needs met for Nate's care.
Please share his story so we can help this family!
 
The day I met Nate, he immediately stole my heart. He approached me with a zest of life and with an understanding of life that no child should have to know. He manages to not only accept what has happened to him but remain so incredibly positive and inspirational during his journey. The Trincas are an amazingly loving and open hearted family. What they are going through is unimaginable as a parent. You wish nothing but to take their place. Please open your heart, read Nate's story. - Addie Russell
 
Nate's story
Nate is an exceptional little six year old boy. He is an extremely smart kindergartener reading at a third grade level and a lover of animals (especially birds). He loves to laugh and has a wonderful imagination. Unfortunately, all of what follows is somewhat normal to Nate, as he knows nothing else, which saddens us. However, he has faced such adversity with nothing but pure spirit and serious courage and truly is a role model for all of us.
At twenty weeks pregnant with Nate we were given the devastating news that he had Tricuspid Atresia, a congenital heart defect that would require three open-heart surgeries to correct. His first surgery was at three weeks of age, soon followed by the second at nine months. This second surgery landed him at Golisano Children's Hospital in Rochester, NY for a month and a half due to a serious staph infection. This infection also incidentally led to two mini stokes — subsequent focal seizures. Because the infection ravaged the tissue surrounding the incision, he was sent home with a wound vac and a pic line leaving us to administer three types of antibiotics every three hours for two months after. Nate finally had his last surgery (Fontan procedure) in May of 2011. With all three procedures now behind us, coupled with a number of hospitalizations, we were hopeful that he was finally in the clear and set to start kindergarten in the fall of 2011.
Almost a year ago, shortly after starting kindergarten, Nate started having little flash headaches in the mornings before school that seemed to come and go rather quickly. Soon it reached a point where the headaches had been going on for well over a week, and we started to become somewhat concerned. We decided to take him to see his pediatrician. The visit uncovered nothing, but his doctor did say that if he wakes up with a headache and/or vomiting in the middle of the night to have him seen right away. The morning of Thanksgiving day 11/24/2011, Nate woke up in the middle of the night vomiting and screaming in pain with a headache. We immediately rushed him to the emergency room at Levine Children’s Hospital, here in Charlotte. After an initial CT scan, it was discovered that he had plum size mass in his brain near his cerebellum. After an extremely successful five-hour surgery to remove the mass, he was soon in recovery and we eagerly awaited the pathology report. We were told that there was a strong possibility the leads could become superheated during the scan, and the procedure could burn up his little heart. The leads were removed on 12/6/11. The MRI was finally completed on 12/16/11 in conjunction with a spinal tap to be certain that the tumor was completely removed and to check for any circulating malignant cells in his spinal fluid — Both tests returned negative.

This type of intense treatment on a developing six year old can also bring about a whole range of potentially severe and long-term permanent damage. We were told by numerous doctors that the radiation could cause Nate's spine to stop growing and the radiation to his brain could also potentially result in a loss of some cognitive function as well. In addition, side effects ranging from the typical nausea, vomiting, weight loss, and diarrhea, to those more serious (and permanent) lung/kidney damage, hearing loss, developmental problems, as well as the strong possibility for developing other types of cancer years later could also follow. This honestly scared us beyond belief, especially considering Nate's already pre-existing condition with Tricuspid Atresia and weakened heart. It is such a hard decision, because no matter which way we go regarding treatment, be it standard of care radiation and chemotherapy or alternative therapies, it will always be a roll of the dice. story:
Who We Are

Hello, we are the Upchurch family, David, Dara, Audrey, Austin, Noah, Isaac, Hunter, and Caden. We are a blended family, and amidst the difficult journey of parenting, we have discovered that 2 of our children have special needs. Our son Caden was born with Spina Bifida, a condition that has left him paralyzed from the waist down. Though he cannot walk, Caden is one determined little fella. He loves to play with his brothers and sister, and does his best to keep up with them. Our son Noah was recently diagnosed with Autism. Noah is a natural born Rock Star. He loves to sing, listen to music, and perform with his siblings on a pretend stage. Sometimes the road of life can be rough, but, we know that every day is an opportunity to see GOD provide in a new way. Victory Lane Camp has been a blessing to our family, and we are thankful for the helping hand that this organization so willingly stretched forth. We are very excited to be a part of this ministry to families with special needs.

We would love to go to camp again this year. Would you help us meet our goal?

What We Need

The cost for a family to attend Victory Lane Camp is $2000. To help families experience this opportunity, Victory Lane Camp establishes campaigns for each family to reach this goal. The Upchurch family has already received donations from other outside sources, so they only need to raise $900.

About Victory Lane Camp

Victory Lane Camp empowers and equips families with special needs to heal through their disability so that their future together builds healthy communities. For more information about Victory Lane Camp, please visit our website.

Other Ways You Can Help

Victory Lane Camp families need more than just financial assistance to go to camp this summer. We need your help to get the word out to your communities!

  • Follow us on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and Pinterest and share our message with your friends and family! We want to get the word out about how Victory Lane Camp empowers and equips families!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to help the Upchurch family meet their goal!

Thank you for empowering and equipping this family to attend an experience that would have otherwise been out of reach.

*Special thanks to the Henry County Community Foundation for their generous donation of $1,000 to help the Upchurch family come to camp*

story:
My father, William Jacka Sr. is stuck in the Isabella, Philipines with a LIFE THREATENING brain mass! He can no longer walk, talk, or even feed himself.He is unable to receive proper diagnosis and treatment, and needs to have a medi-vac flight back here to his home in California where he has full medical coverage and can receive the help he needs! This is a DIRE medical situation, and we desperately need all the help we can get to save my father's life! 

To compound this dire emergency, I have two half-sisters (from my father) currently living in the Philippines that need filing fees to achieve citizenship status. Without this official status, should the worst case scenario occur and my father not survive this brain trauma, they will be denied any and all death benefits to which they may be entitled, and left penniless orphans. 

Any and all help we can receive to help our family through this unexpected and horrible emergency is greatly appreciated!  We have set up a blog on facebook Well Wishes for Wm Jacka's Recovery.  https://www.facebook.com/groups/WellWishesForWmJacka/497162220390643/?notif_t=group_activity

story:
Hello! My name is Nathalie and I play field hockey. I started playing hockey when I was seven years old, because my father came from the Netherlands, where it is a huge sport, and he wanted me to try it out too. I quickly grew to love the game, and when i turned eleven I joined the Potomac Field Hockey Travel League. The travel league was very helpful and fun for me to join because I had never played competitively before. I went to many tournaments with that team, including Harvest Hockey, Disney Junior Field Hockey Showcase and many smaller tournaments. Soon I decided to play for a higher class team, Rampage Field Hockey, but soon switched back to PFH (Potomac Field Hockey). In all I have played for five different teams, and went to Festival, the largest hockey tournament in the United States, and to the Disney Field Hockey Showcase three different times, I also play for the Olympic team feeder program.
    This campaign is to raise money to go to World Camp Barcelona, an internationally acclaimed field hockey camp that I was invited to when I played at World Camp USA this summer. Out of the three hundred kids there I was one of the thirty-six selected for the elite camp that will take place in August of next summer. This camp is really important to me because I want to play competitive field hockey in college, and it would be amazing for me to be able to go to a camp with nationally acclaimed coaches and international field hockey players.
    I need to raise 3495 USD for the fee for the camp, this fee includes boarding, food, coaching expenses, airfare, etc. This fee is all inclusive, so airfare, food, boarding etc. are included, and I've included some perks for donating myself! Please help me get to World Camp Barcelona so I can improve my field hockey skills and reach my goal of playing college hockey!

story:
Hello Family, Friends, Farmers and Fellow Yogis! You will be excited to learn that I, Carina Claire, am attending Bikram Yoga Teacher Training in Phuket, Thailand this fall! This is a very big step in my life towards becoming a more self sustaining person and it is a true passion. The yoga has radically transformed my life in so many ways. My body is so happy and strong, my mind is so much more peaceful and my spirit has been warmed up. My relationships are more open and honest and so is the way I interact with the world. I am much less afraid to be pushed out of my comfort zone into something new and unknown. I can finally breathe. These are all things I want to share with others, I want to stand at the front of the room and see people change - to be part of their changes. I look back an cannot believe how much I have changed in six months since starting at Bikram Yoga Portsmouth. I have gotten off of methadone, I have gotten a job for the first time in five years, ended an unhealthy relationship, moved back to Eliot, got a car (thanks Dad!) and everything I needed to drive it, made so many amazing new friends, and became my own person. I will always be eternally grateful to those who were instrumental in the beginning of my yoga days - Jess Bacon and Sara Curry, you guys rock!

To accomplish my goal of becoming a Bikram Yoga teacher, I have worked with Vocational Rehab to have them pay for the training. This still leaves a few things I cannot afford on my own! The big one is, I will need a plane ticket from the states to Thailand and back. The training is September 14 - November 16, so I don't have much time left. I have a really short deadline for this fundraiser because it can take up to 15 days to receive the money once the deadline is reached. If anyone in my family wanted to coordinate for the plane ticket instead of donating the money, that would be incredible and less stressful having to wait until the last minute to buy the ticket. Other things I will need are more yoga clothes (!), money for food and water (as we are only provided 1 liter of water per day, plus at two meals and must purchase any additional water), a visa,  and probably money to ship my medication out to me while in Thailand. 

Also if you don't know me, my name is Carina Claire. I live in Eliot, Maine down by the river. I often drive too fast in my Volvo on my way to Bikram Yoga Portsmouth where you can catch me most nights working on my standing head to knee at the 6:30pm class or 4:30pm on Friday and Sunday! Please, if you have any questions or have any other way you want to help, even just words of encouragement, my email is: carinaclairem@gmail.com

SO MUCH LOVE!

Please send this link to anyone who's life has been changed by yoga :)

You are all rock stars!

story:
It Takes A Village!

 The VHHFA is a non-profit that connects veterans of all eras with holistic health professionals offering services across the spectrum of the healing arts.

The foundation acts as a conduit to match individual veterans with holistic health professionals offering services best suited to address the veteran’s needs in a safe and healthy environment.
 
In appreciation for the veterans and current service members’ sacrifice to this Nation, alternative health care professionals volunteer their time and offer services free of charge to support veterans in their process of healing.
 
This approach allows the holistic community to participate in the collective responsibility to rehabilitate service members and support their families throughout the reentry process.
 
 
 The Foundation strives to empower veterans, service members and their entire families alike with “skills not pills” – to provide access to transformative skills to cope with and eventually alleviate the physical and emotional burdens that are common to military service, especially in a time of war and conflict.

 What We Need 

We are asking for seed money to cover marketing materials and our office expenses for 6 months so we can grow and continue our mission. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please know that a gift of any amount will help us.  But there are other ways you can help, too!

  • Tell everyone you know know about us and give them the opportunity to contribute!  Check out our website at www.VHHFA.org.
  • We would be happy to reach out to any of your friends or contacts personally if they have the means and desire to help us on a bigger scale.
  • If your business or school would be interested in sponsoring us, we'd love to talk and would be happy to publicly recognize them on our website.
  • If your employer would list us as an option for employee giving, that would give us great exposure.
  • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
My beautiful wife of 22 years was diagnosed with stage IIIA breast cancer this past April while I was working as a guard at the US Embassy in Kabul Afghanistan. My name is Tony Key and my wife is Beverly. I was able to shorten my contract to come home to take care of my wife and our two children. Since I was able to come home the middle of May she has had surgery to have lymph nodes removed on her right side. She had biopsy and abmormal cells removed from her left side as well as a Chemo port installed. We have started the Chemo Therapy cycle now and still have 5 months left before we can schedule her for a double masectomy and then begin daily radiation for 6 weeks.

I am now at the point where I am asking my friends, their friends and every other generous soul to help me pay for her treatment. Beverly is being treated at MD Anderson Cancer Center and is recieving unmatched care, however, Medicaid only pays part and we don't have any other insurance so this has become extremely financially overwhelming and we still have a long way to go. What ever amount that you could give may seem small to you but I can promise you that it means a life time to us. I have loved this wonderful lady for the last 22 years and I want at the very least 22 more.

I cant offer large or significant perks other than I will update everyone on Beverly's continued progress as well as our prayers for everone. Please remember to pass this on to your family and friends as we need all the help we can get. If you leave your name and address we will send you a hand written thankyou card and a pink ribbon. God bless everyone that reads this.
story_txt:
My beautiful wife of 22 years was diagnosed with stage IIIA breast cancer this past April while I was working as a guard at the US Embassy in Kabul Afghanistan. My name is Tony Key and my wife is Beverly. I was able to shorten my contract to come home to take care of my wife and our two children. Since I was able to come home the middle of May she has had surgery to have lymph nodes removed on her right side. She had biopsy and abmormal cells removed from her left side as well as a Chemo port installed. We have started the Chemo Therapy cycle now and still have 5 months left before we can schedule her for a double masectomy and then begin daily radiation for 6 weeks.
I am now at the point where I am asking my friends, their friends and every other generous soul to help me pay for her treatment. Beverly is being treated at MD Anderson Cancer Center and is recieving unmatched care, however, Medicaid only pays part and we don't have any other insurance so this has become extremely financially overwhelming and we still have a long way to go. What ever amount that you could give may seem small to you but I can promise you that it means a life time to us. I have loved this wonderful lady for the last 22 years and I want at the very least 22 more.
I cant offer large or significant perks other than I will update everyone on Beverly's continued progress as well as our prayers for everone. Please remember to pass this on to your family and friends as we need all the help we can get. If you leave your name and address we will send you a hand written thankyou card and a pink ribbon. God bless everyone that reads this.

story:
What is Extra Caddy and why we need your help

Frank Mancinelli saw a need for an easy way to carry multiple loose clubs when his buddy walked out of the woods with clubs sticking every which way, making a trip away from the cart to rescue his ball less enjoyable because he was struggling with his clubs. Surprisingly, Frank found there was no product out there for carrying a few clubs that wasn't bulky and impracticle for everyday use. So he decided to invent it himself. The result is Extra Caddy.

When you've hit your ball into the woods opposite the cart path, typically you grab a few clubs you might need and take a field trip, often bringing your putter so you have it when you reach the green. You may set those clubs down near the green while you putt. Then you reunite with the cart and put your 3 iron, pitching wedge, putter, etc, back in your golf bag. Unless you left your pitching wedge on the far side of the green. It happens. With Extra Caddy those not so great holes of golf don't get any worse because your clubs are fighting you. You keep those loose clubs together so misplacing one is less likely. And, of course, it makes them easy to carry. It's a simple problem, and the solution is simple. That solution is Extra Caddy. 

Designed to be as easy to use as a product like this should be, Extra Caddy just works, plus it stows easily by clipping to your bag. You look great using it too. Yes, even though you're walking out of the woods and having just overshot the green Extra Caddy allows you to do so with style.

You can stop using handkerchiefs and zipties, stop fumbling with carrying, setting down & picking up, and keeping track of multiple clubs when you're away from your bag. Extra Caddy is here. FINALLY.  

The good news is that Frank and his team have gotten this product to the tipping point. This project is up and running. But to go big we need money to do things including: placing bulk orders to reduce manufacturing costs, redesigning to keep quality but reduce costs, engaging in a marketing campaign, & adapting to what we hope will be growing order fulfillment needs. We feel this is a great product and that with the right resources Extra Caddy will be a success. We'd love you to be a part of that! Our goal amount is just enough to give us the boost we absolutely need. If we are lucky enough to exceed our goal, we'll go bigger, we'll do more, and Extra Caddy will hit the shelves nationwide with a fully prepared team behind it, thanks to you.

story:
bELIeve

Calling all soldiers and bELIevers of life...

Scans have returned and they were not great, but it doesn't give me a reason to give up hope. Told by my doctor that I may have cancer for the rest of my life, I refuse to believe her and let cancer win. A warrior and a fighter, this has just added fuel to my fire. Determined to overcome this battle, I have learned that this journey does not get easier, but you become stronger. I believe in life. I believe I have a future. I believe in hope.

While continuing my treatment as planned, I am daring to go beyond. Stepping up and taking back control, I am now seeking help and ready to ask for third and fourth opinions. Unfortunatley, due to the rarity of my cancer, there are very few specialists in this country (only five to be exact). This is where you come in... my soldiers and bELIevers. Not one to typically ask for extra help, and always one to acknowledge that I am blessed, I humbly come to you for help.

My family has been so supportive and by my side throughout this entire experience, but we can only afford so much. The specialists that I wish to meet are in Houston, Texas and New York. While my insurance has covered most of my treatments, they do not cover outside consultations. I humbly ask you, if you can, to donate and bELIeve. Donations will be used to cover airfare, traveling expenses, but most importantly the appointment fees. Any little help is extremely appreciated and I can't thank you enough in advance. Any extra funds after these consultations will be saved for either future medical expensives or once recovered and in remission (which I am claming I will be in one day) will be donated; 50% to Cancer Research and 50% to Dancers With Cancer.

I seriously cannot thank you all for the support you have given me from day one of this journey. I am beyond blessed and grateful to have you all in my life.

"The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams." Eleanor Roosevelt 

Eli

story:
Short Summary

Janis is a loving wife and mother. Her adult daughter moved in with us over a year ago, we are supporting her and her granddaughter while her daughter is in school and we have been living on a single income. Money is tight for us and a few day ago Janis suffered a heart attack. We just cannot afford the hospital bill, medical expenses plus the time off work for me to take her to her appointments and the payments for those appointments.  

  • I am asking for support as a last option to help cover these costs so that Janis can have a full recovery without losing our home and get back to the healthy loving woman, wife and mother that she is and needs to be.
  • Your contributions will help to cover the original hospital stay, operation and prescriptions as well as expenses for appointments, time I need off work for those appointments and the resultant cardiac therapy and any additional prescriptions
  • Janis has suffered from diabetes and PAD for more than 10 years now making every day life difficult. PAD is a degenerative disease that can only be monitored, not cured. The help Janis receives now will go to aiding her in her recovery and maintenance of her condition and result in giving her a chance at a somewhat normal life. 


Other Ways You Can Help

I understand better than anyone that some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn't mean they can’t help:

  • Please share this with your friends and on your social media sites. The more the word gets out the better chance of reaching our goal.
  • There are tools right here on indiegogo to help share. Please take the time to look into these tools. Anything else you can think of will be appreciated.

And that’s all there is to it.

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
CADASIL is a hereditary disease that affects the blood vessels in the brain. strokes, heart attacks, dementia and eventual death are what waits people with this illness as not even doctors know much about it. there is no treatment and research into a cure hasn't been attempted. it is so rare that it only affects 500 families within the world, us being one of them. 

my mum suffered with this illness since she was 18. some days are better then others. on her worst days she stays in bed with a migraine that is so bad that it causes her to lose her eyesight and her memory. she has suffered numerous mini strokes and a few i have sadly witnessed. it has effected her memory to the point where she has become distressed due to the fact of not remembering that she even had children. she cant do simple things like wash her hair or brush her teeth so these things shes needs help to do most of the time. we as a family have dedicated our time to making her as comfortable as possible with the time that we have with her as her illness makes it hard to determine how long we really have left. 

my mum has always been the rock that has held our family together, but one day i witnessed all that fall apart and my mum deteriorate until she was so depressed and ill that she was the shell of the hero i had grown to know and love unconditionally. she takes strong painkillers that don't work but they do make her fall asleep at 7 pm at night and as i have college and no longer live at home, it makes it very hard to spend valuable time with her that she may not have. this deeply saddens me. 

in order to get a little piece of mind for those suffering with this unforgiving illness i have put together a solo cycling event that i will be training for and carrying out during my summer holidays at university. this event includes cycling from my home town Stevenage, Hertfordshire, to countries all around Europe including Germany and Poland, in 25 days. i am doing this to raise money and awareness for CADASIL and meet some families of sufferers on the way. the more completely bonkers an idea the more it is noticed. its my turn to be the rock, and care for those who have given so much yet are destined to take so much more this illness throws at them. they are strong individuals and families and i want to support them.

my facebook page supporting this event and campaign which will have regular updates about progess being made with my training and the planning of the event e.g. sponserships etc. please join and share my facebook page. 

facebook.com/cycleforCADASIL

thank you for all your help

story:
About us

We are Good Ventures, a small ethical product development company based in London, UK. We specialise in developing ethical, natural skincare products. We are a small team of 2, completely boot strapped and self funded. 
 

About S5

Our new range, S5, is a range of treatment skincare products designed to transform stressed, reactive skin into resilient, healthy skin. We see people with stressed skin conditions such as acne, redness, dryness and premature ageing every day and we wanted to develop products that would work for them. 

We strongly believe organic and natural is the future of skincare, but we also know people need to see results. The products we've created are the results of months of research into ingredients to find the most effective natural and organic ingredients out there, to match the performance of that nasty chemical stuff you've been putting on your skin. And the research we've done shows that the irritation those chemicals cause can actually lead to skin stress and ageing. 

Our products don't do that, they break the cycle of skin stress by limiting exposure to chemical irritants and by stopping skin inflammation in its tracks. They reinforce the natural barrier layer of the skin and help it protect itself against environmental aggressors. 

How do we do that? By using natural ingredients that have naturally evolved a defence mechanism against stress in extreme environments such as the Arctic, the Desert, the Rainforest, the High Altitude regions and the Sea. These extremophilic ingredients thrive in conditions that would normally kill most life because of adaption mechanisms they've evolved over millions of years. We've harnessed these and put them into the S5 range. 

The project

We've designed the products, they are in testing at the moment with our partner lab. We've just secured our first major retail listing (Selfridges department store, London, UK, launching August/September) and we need to invest into brochures and sampling materials. We also need to manufacture all of the products over the next few months, before funds start coming in from our first few sales. We've got most of our funding in place but we need a little bit more to make sure the launch really goes well as we will only get one shot to get it right. 

Where's the Money Go?

Quality materials and the labor to fill the products (all based in the UK). Quality packaging materials such as 100% recyclable glass  jars (UK based) and FSC board for the beautiful cartons we are creating (also UK based). Once the packaging has been manufactured, we will have enough for several production runs and the new range will be up and running with several customers (hopefully) on board. 

This helps us to build a sustainable small, independent product design business that supports an ecosystem of other small businesses, from production to retail. 

How you can get involved

We'd love you to be one of the first to experience this unique new range and to have the best skin you can have. You can also (if you wish) join the fold of our wonderful product development group who try all new products we develop before the launch and give us their feedback so our products are the best they can be. 

Thank you for helping us push the boundaries of natural skincare together!

story:
Our Story

Amrik and Jaswinder Chattha are celebrating their 50th wedding anniversary by looking to encourage friends, family and strangers to help them save 50 lives a year with a new blood bank refrigerator for Rajendra Hospital in the town in which they fell in love, Patiala, India. 


The Impact

Pataila trauma care is in dire straits. A new blood bank fridge will help injured victims receive blood transfusions and save an estimated 50 lives in the city per year. 


What We Need & What You Get

A new fridge is $7000 and donors will receive a tax deduction letter from the Patiala Health Foundation, a U.S. based 501-C3 non-profit. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word by Facebook, Twitter and email. There's no way to celebrate life than by saving one.

story:
Short Summary

 In the Highlands of Scotland there are very few months a year where the weather is suitable for skateboarding activities and there are no indoor facilities to help the kids progress and develop. We aim to open a small indoor ramp for all ages to provide a space for skateboarding.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need funding to pay for the initial build of the ramp and making the space safe for people to use.
  • The ramp will be a low cost admission to help cover bills and repairs. The ramp will be situated in a city center building and open 7 days a week throughout the year.
  • The funds will cover building materials, labor costs, sound proofing and lighting.

The Impact

There was a previous facility in our old location which can be seen in the image above. This gave children and teenagers a safe environment to practice and develop their skills whilst benefiting from a larger social group. We observed previously that this helped children gain more confidence and creativity.  We can further develop by running lessons and growing the scene further.

Other Ways You Can Help

We would love for everybody to spread the word and help us get this facility in place. There is nothing like this now in the highlands and it would give these kids something they can call their own.

Please share on your social networks or even come down to the building to see where it will go in The Village community shopping space, Union Street, Inverness.

story:
STOP SECOND HAND SMOKE !! Help people stop smoking & save lives.

My name is Gary Hamilton and I am the creator of the NIK STIK disposable electronic cigarette. I am a former CEO Of Mid America Lumber Company and Vice Chairman of Gilbert and Bennett Manufacturing, a steel company, as well as JGH Acquisition which was a holding company. In an effort to produce the finest disposable electronic cigarette available, I enlisted the help of Dr. Peter Wirshing, PHD in biochemistry whom was previously employed as a research scientist at Scripps in La Jolla, California. Dr. Wirshing now resides in China and oversees all aspects of NIK STIK production, design, quality control and logistics.

For a very long time, I have deplored the negative effects the smoking of tobacco cigarettes has had on people. It destroys their health, has a terrible odor, burns clothing and furniture, and pollutes the air that other people breathe. And it sometimes results in death. Although I no longer smoke tobacco cigarettes - I quit as a young Marine in Vietnam of all places - I suffered through the deaths of both parents and a sister brought on by cancer. They each were very heavy ong time smokers. Another sister lost her husband to lung cancer at age 43. I would like to see tobacco cigarettes become a thing of the past as soon as possible and that is what this campaign is about: To convince people that there is a way of weaning themselves from tobacco with the NIK STIK.

Yearly, there are about 1.7 billion cartons of cigarettes sold in the U S. Although that number is slowly declining as taxes on cigarettes continue to climb, it is still ruining lives by the millions in this country. With the NIK STIK disposable electronic cigarettes, a tobacco smoker can achieve the same satisfaction without the filthy smoke and carcinogens which number in the hundreds. You see, the NIK STIK contains nicotine just like a tobacco cigarette. This is what satisfies the craving. Nicotine by itself, although addictive much like caffeine, is a naturally occurring substance that is even found in some vegetables. Nicotine is not the cause of all the problems from smoking tobacco. You see, the cigarette manufacturers put hundreds of ingredients in their product to make them taste good. this includes things like dozens of spices and sugars. All of these things are burned including the tobacco and cigarette paper and then sucked into the lungs. That is what makes people sick and short of breath and creates respiratory diseases.

I am looking to raise $1 million in funding which will pay for product production and inventory, print advertising and radio campaigns, marketing tools such as in store displays, and a concentrated sales effort in the field. The cigarette companies abhor a product such as this. After all, who needs them when a smoker can get the same enjoyment from a NIK STIK. And guess what? Smokers will save a ton of money when they get off of tobacco cigarettes and use the NIK STIK. You see, each NIK STIK is equal to three packs of cigarettes. Big $$ savings of $1000 or more per year. Although $1million is the desired contribution for a rapid campaign success, a lesser amount of money will also be effective but at a slower rate. Remember, the whole idea is a way of weaning smokers from the big tobacco cartel. They are the pusher man. And by the way, the government is part of the problem as they add their taxes so as to further hurt the addicted tobacco smoker.

We will make a real difference when we get the NIK STIK in the hands of smokers. They will enjoy the same smoking pleasure while enjoying the NIK STIK which looks like a cigarette, has smoke (atomized water vapor) like a cigarette, lights up on the end when puffed (LED) like a cigarette, and tastes like a cigarette. And all of this for a lot less money. Please help us wean smokers from their nasty and unhealthy habit. Let's get rid of second hand smoke, and let's put a dent in the BIG TOBACCO/GOVERNMENT CARTEL. Even a small contribution will be helpful. Your $25 contribution will get you one each of a regular and menthol NIK STIK for you to use your self or to pass on to someone you know that smokes. They will thank you as this will provide them a way of breaking from the chains that bind them to their addictive tobaco cigarettes. This product has a chance to change the world. Become a part of it and please let everyone you know about this worthwhile effort. Thank you for your support.

I am a former CEO Of Mid America Lumber Company and Vice Chairman of Gilbert and Bennett Manufacturing, a steel company, as well as JGH Acquisition which was a holding company. In an effort to produce the finest disposable electronic cigarette available, I enlisted the help of Dr. Peter Wirshing, PHD in biochemistry whom was previously employed as a research scientist at Scripps in La Jolla, California. Dr. Wirshing now resides in China and oversees all aspects of NIK STIK production, design, quality control and logistics.
For a very long time, I have deplored the negative effects the smoking of tobacco cigarettes has had on people. It destroys their health, has a terrible odor, burns clothing and furniture, and pollutes the air that other people breathe. And it sometimes results in death. Although I no longer smoke tobacco cigarettes - I quit as a young Marine in Vietnam of all places - I suffered through the deaths of both parents and a sister brought on by cancer. They each were very heavy ong time smokers. Another sister lost her husband to lung cancer at age 43. I would like to see tobacco cigarettes become a thing of the past as soon as possible and that is what this campaign is about: To convince people that there is a way of weaning themselves from tobacco with the NIK STIK.
Yearly, there are about 1.7 billion cartons of cigarettes sold in the U S. Although that number is slowly declining as taxes on cigarettes continue to climb, it is still ruining lives by the millions in this country. With the NIK STIK disposable electronic cigarettes, a tobacco smoker can achieve the same satisfaction without the filthy smoke and carcinogens which number in the hundreds. You see, the NIK STIK contains nicotine just like a tobacco cigarette. This is what satisfies the craving. Nicotine by itself, although addictive much like caffeine, is a naturally occurring substance that is even found in some vegetables. Nicotine is not the cause of all the problems from smoking tobacco. You see, the cigarette manufacturers put hundreds of ingredients in their product to make them taste good. this includes things like dozens of spices and sugars. All of these things are burned including the tobacco and cigarette paper and then sucked into the lungs. That is what makes people sick and short of breath and creates respiratory diseases.
I am looking to raise $1 million in funding which will pay for product production and inventory, print advertising and radio campaigns, marketing tools such as in store displays, and a concentrated sales effort in the field. The cigarette companies abhor a product such as this. After all, who needs them when a smoker can get the same enjoyment from a NIK STIK. And guess what? Smokers will save a ton of money when they get off of tobacco cigarettes and use the NIK STIK. You see, each NIK STIK is equal to three packs of cigarettes. Big $$ savings of $1000 or more per year. Although $1million is the desired contribution for a rapid campaign success, a lesser amount of money will also be effective but at a slower rate. Remember, the whole idea is a way of weaning smokers from the big tobacco cartel. They are the pusher man. And by the way, the government is part of the problem as they add their taxes so as to further hurt the addicted tobacco smoker.
We will make a real difference when we get the NIK STIK in the hands of smokers. They will enjoy the same smoking pleasure while enjoying the NIK STIK which looks like a cigarette, has smoke (atomized water vapor) like a cigarette, lights up on the end when puffed (LED) like a cigarette, and tastes like a cigarette. And all of this for a lot less money. Please help us wean smokers from their nasty and unhealthy habit. Let's get rid of second hand smoke, and let's put a dent in the BIG TOBACCO/GOVERNMENT CARTEL. Even a small contribution will be helpful. Your $25 contribution will get you one each of a regular and menthol NIK STIK for you to use your self or to pass on to someone you know that smokes. They will thank you as this will provide them a way of breaking from the chains that bind them to their addictive tobaco cigarettes. This product has a chance to change the world. Become a part of it and please let everyone you know about this worthwhile effort. Thank you for your support.

story:
Rise Against Ebola


 Hello, my name is Barrett,
      I am in the seventh grade and recently I have heard about the Ebola Virus, and the pain and havoc it is causing. I would like to obtain some money so I could donate to directrelief.org, and help the victims of Ebola, and their families. I currently do not have any perks for this charity, but I may add some depending on the response I get.

About Ebola

    The Ebola Virus was discovered in Sudan and Congo in 1976. The name Ebola originated after the name of the river that flowed by the town of Yambaku, where the virus was first uncovered. After someone catches Ebola, symptoms occur within 3 days to 2 weeks. Some of these symptoms are fever, sore throat, pain, and headaches. As of now, approximately 3,000 reported deaths have been caused by this disease. The CDC (Centers for Disease Control and Prevention) says the virus could reach 1.4 million cases by early next year. Ebola spreads through human contact, and contact with bodily fluids and blood. CDC stated that the chance of Ebola reaching America is extremely low. Ebola is currently not curable, and there is not yet a vaccine to prevent it.

My Mission

     My goal is to obtain $500 to donate to directrelief.org. This company sends items over to the Ebola stricken countries such as, saline bags, exam gloves, isolation gowns, boxes of sterile syringes and needles, rubber boots, cases of face masks, and protective shoe covers. We would send the donation to the Ebola response in West Africa. The money and items would help these people immensely, it would save lives, and help stop the Ebola Virus. Please help and donate to this cause, thank you. 
Works Cited:
http://www.directrelief.org   http://www.w...
http://www.dogonews.com/2014/9/29/making-sense-of-the-ebola-virus

story:
I am Chaya Grossberg, writer for Mad in America and my own popular blog www.chayagrossberg.com. My dream has been for the past decade-plus to help every single person who wants to come off psychiatric pharmaceuticals to do so. I have helped many people get off psychiatric drugs through my consultations, support groups I have led, and writings. I have worked with thousands of individuals at Freedom Center, Western Massachusetts Recovery Learning Community, Alternative to Meds Center, Portland Hearing Voices, Mental Health Association of Portland, Mental Health Association of San Francisco's Warm Line. The next mission is to write a book "Breaking free from psychiatric drugs" guiding people how to come off psychiatric drugs. This book will include my extensive experience over the last 10 years and I will also be interviewing many experts for the book. The editorial advisory board for the book includes Advisory Board: Jon Keyes, Matthew Morrissey, Celia Brown, George Badillo, Nancy Rubenstein Delgiudice Gottsteinm Delphine Brody, and Lyle Murphy.

We need to raise money to cover the costs of writing, interviewing, editing, and printing the book. So we are turning to you to help support us. In return we are offering a variety of perks, from books, healing sessions, detox guidance, massage, and cleaning services. Your contribution will help us get this book written, and spread the book out to the various networks. Thanks!


As a consultant I have helped many people get off psychiatric drugs. Here are some of their testimonials:

Chaya Love, your article has me all teary eyed.  You are such an inspiration to me! When we first met, I sought out your expertise, as a peer mentor and as someone who had successfully tapered off all psych drugs. What transpired during our sessions was profoundly healing for me. You met me where I was, never above me, and showed me a true picture of the gifts I had within, to be shared with the world. I felt so understood and seen through your keen insight. You awakened in me, treasures and as you spoke them aloud, I knew that my voice was important. You told me that you saw me speaking in front of large crowds and that made me very nervous yet excited all at once. The thing is, being in your presence, I recognized myself beyond all roles and labels and was able to take my place in the orchestra of life, center stage. Thank you for all that you share and be!
– Ayin Cushnir, Portland, OR

Thank you, Chaya, so very, very much. I received tremendous, exquisite and profoundly honoring and validating, soul nurturing support, in addition to practical and excellent self care suggestions for next steps to consider, that you offered, sharing your own positive experiences of them supporting your own well-being.

I am truly refreshed and invigorated, as well as challenged in a nurturing way, to keep stretching and growing towards my dreams and soul purpose. I was beyond delighted with the support I experienced with you tonight. I look forward to more.

Feel free to share this appreciation acknowledgement however of value to you and/or others, Chaya.
– Tom Clute, Portland, OR


.....

story:
Somebody once told me that living life with a chronic illness would be easy, that a doctor would diagnose you, give you treatment and you would be able to go back to living life the way you knew before. I never really took this into consideration as I thought “that will never happen to me, a family member, anybody I hold close to my heart”. But, unfortunately, I was wrong.

This is my mother’s story.

It all started six years ago, waking up one morning to a new day. Something was wrong, my mom began having troubles seeing, blurry and double vision, constant migraines, dizziness, and much more. Doctors visit after doctor’s visit, nobody knew what was wrong. It was all just thought to be strabismus, which further lead to eye surgery. For a solid month after surgery, my mother’s vision and pain was outstanding, it was like she had a new set of eyes. No pain and clear vision. But it didn’t last long. At [td1] moment, symptom after symptom of what seemed to be “Lyme disease” started showing up. Let me tell you, my mom and dad LOVE the outdoors, if they could be anywhere in the world it would be in BC, sitting in a lawn chair enjoying the scenery and the beautiful atmosphere. As my mom later figured out, this Is where her disease took place, and took over her body, her well-being, her relationships and more importantly, her own life. Six years have come and gone and 9 months ago, after begging to be tested for Lyme disease and blood work done in Canada constantly showing up negative, further action began to take place. Blood work was sent to the USA, resulting in a big POSITIVE.  My mother knew well enough to make herself aware of Lyme disease, but she wasn’t at all prepared for it and what the disease would do to her, al the symptoms her body would be putting her through. Panick attacks, migraines, arthritis, stomach aches, nauseas, numbness, weakness in her limbs, stiff neck, memory loss, insomnia, constant vomiting, tingling sensations, heart problems, twitching in her face, night sweats, shortness of breath, diarrhea, unexplained shaking, seizures, depression, light sensitivity, this was just the start of all her symptoms, all her excruciating pain she was about to go through. There are days I don’t even know how she is still surviving and finding the courage, hope, and strength to wake up each day and go about it, repeatedly telling herself that she is okay and she is getting better, but she finds it within herself and all her pain, to face another day. I don’t know how she does it, but she is my biggest role model and inspiration. This, is my mother’s story.

“The road to recovery never runs straight, flat, and smooth, with no bumps or hills. I’ve taken many steps forward and many more backward, mentally and physically. But the bravest thing I ever did was continuing my life when all I wanted to do is die.”

My goal is to raise money for treatment for my best friend, my mother, but the more important goal of mine is spreading her story and letting her know she is not alone, thousands are suffering. If 5,000 is raised, my mom can see the light in treatment and a better tomorrow, if 10,000 is raised, my mom has a chance of seeing an even brighter future ahead of her. If more than my goal of 10,000 is contributed, all remaining money will be donated towards LymeLife Charity.
Thank you for your time xxoo



 [td1]Oment,

story:
I am Chris Quintana (Qdriver) and I have been road racing cars since college in 1985.

My dream has been to race in a 24 hour endurance race and now I’ve been given the chance to share a car thanks to my good friend, Kai Goddard who invited me to race one of the three Lexus cars on a three car team.  This is a proper Pro Race.

My car will be a 2001 race prepared IS-300, which I will share with four other drivers.  These guys have raced and won before, and we have a good chance of a win.  The amount of time that we are in the car is long enough to burn through one tank of fuel.  This IS-300 placed 5th in class in 2010 at the NASA 25hr Thunderhilll.

I do not have traditional sponsors.  This is where you might help. I will add your name as my sponsor onto this N1 Concepts, Lexus sponsored race car, to ride out the complete 25 hour race! 

All money will be used, and I have budgeted $775 on Southwest Airlines, $1057 for RV instead of hotel rooms (split 4 ways) and my cost to race is $4000. Five days of meals and expenses add up to $244.

The NASA Thunderhill 25 Hour race is popular with the professional racers and teams because almost all other Pro-Racing series have ended and this is the last race before Christmas. Entry list includes Lexus IS F, Seat Leon SuperCopa, Porsche GT3 Cups, Audi R8-LMS, Audi TT-RS, Superlite SLC, BMW M3 GTR, and rumored factory support from Lexus, Honda.  I’ve always placed well on the amateur 3 and 6 hour endurance races, paced myself well and dedicated my wins to my late father, who was the best driver I knew.

video of Kai Goddard (KaiGoddardMotorsports.com) racing Lexus IS-300 in 2010, placing 5th in class.  My teammate.

story:
Hi everyone, 

 

Just a heads up that I'll be asking for your support in the following weeks as I'll be fundraising for an upcoming Ambassador Challenge in Cambodia with the Oaktree Foundation.

"The challenge is about finding future leaders for us to share our knowledge and experience with."

 

During the fundraising period, I'll be inviting you to participate in some fun events with me and I hope that you'll be willing to come along and make some donations. 
These super cool events will include a games night, BBQ, and hopefully something along the lines of a cake stall at school. 
If you have any questions don't be hesitant in asking me. 

 

All donations welcome. ;D

story:
Sweet Beginnings

My name is Davina Soondrum, and I am a humble confectioner. Former pastry chef for Franklin Fountain and later the Head Confectioner for Shane Confectionery in Old City, and a 2013 Star Chefs Rising Star. My edible portfolio of sorts has been featured on PBS, The Food Network, Cooking Channel, Travel Channel, and numerous print platforms and blogs ranging from city papers to Martha Stewart Living and Smithsonian Magazine.  

(Photo courtesy of Chris Crisman Photography)

A Bar is Born

Candy is dandy, but a bar is the star. Salted chocolate caramel, cocoa nibs, soft chocolate torrone, and Wilbur's Bronze Medal dark chocolate became The Whirly Berley Bar- a now signature staple for Shane. This helped the confectionery win "Best Chocolate" from Philadelphia Magazine and garnered my distinction for an Artisan Rising Star from Star Chefs. A confectioner's greatest wish realized: the reaction and support for one candy bar has been wonderful, albeit highly addictive. Hence, the quest begins now to bring a veritable line of artisanal candy bars to you and yours starting this September.

The Sugary Line Up

These delectable bars will utilize the goodness of fresh dairy, locally roasted nuts and spices, and drizzles of sinfully smooth local chocolate. More flavors will be revealed through the blog, but for now kindly allow me to introduce a few members of the decadent team:

  • Creme Brûlée: Roasted white chocolate nougat, crunchy toffee bits, and a thin gooey veil of butter caramel
  • The Pumpkin King: Autumnal brown sugar nougat, malted pecans, and pumpkin spice caramel 
  • Birch Beer Malt: Malted milk chocolate nougat layered with organic birch caramel
  • Red Velvet: Extra dark chocolate torrone and beet sugar infused caramel (no red dye no. 40 for us!)
  • Gimme S'more: Graham cracker nougat, smoked dark chocolate ganache, and pillowy fluffs of marshmallow
  • Peking Peanut: Hoisin infused nougat, micro brewed soy sauce caramel, and Chinese 5-spice roasted peanuts
  • Ms. Peanut: Locally roasted and ground peanut butter nougat, double salted peanut caramel

Know Where Your Confectionery Contributions are Going

Trademarks and license, website, photographs, a space to mass produce candy bars, equipment, packaging, branding, shipping, and most importantly ingredients (hello sweet sweet chocolate!) all add up to quite a tidy sum. To help execute this delicious project I would like to bring in some of the most talented craftsmen I have the pleasure of being friends and colleagues with. Compensation for their creative endeavors are necessary as well

Delicious Ambitions

Bars that taste delicious must do good as well. Giving back to the community and working in tandem with local charities will be this company's very own sweet intention. Everyone that contributes to this campaign will be kept abreast both via email and blog of news, mischief, sweet rewards, and a confectioner's slow descent into madness. 

(Like chocolate? Like jewelry? Check out some of the delicious perks that can come your way! With special thanks to Jennifer Wong and her amazing abilities as a silversmith)

Bringing the World Sweet Intentions

There are a myriad of ways to help contribute to bringing this chocolate covered dream to fruition. The monetary support would be amazing (you will get some pretty decadent rewards as a result), but it is understood that not everyone is able to do so. Spreading the word (Facebook, Twitter, Indiegogo, carrier pigeon) would be just as greatly appreciated. It is a short amount of time to raise an ambitious amount of money so notes of encouragement, high fives, fist pounds, and chest bumps are always welcome! All contributors will also be extended an invitation to the Sweet Intentions launch party

For any questions or concerns anyone is free to contact me via Facebook, Twitter (@sweetmisswonka), and idiegogo. Sweet Intentions website, Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter handle are all to follow in the following months
