story:
What is LidFlush?

LidFlush replaces the traditional flush lever on your toilet with a magnetic tether which engages your toilet seat lid. The toilet flushes simply by closing the lid. By requiring the lid to be closed when the toilet is flushed, aerosolized bacteria is suppressed. In addition, LidFlush ends the contention between couples over whether or not the toilet seat should be up or down.

Note: This is a prototype unit. The production unit will be significantly refined.

How does it work?
LidFlush is a retrofit product that will fit most "gravity flush" toilets. LidFlush installs under the toilet tank lid, providing a slide for a magnetic tether which attaches to the "flapper valve". This replaces the traditional lever and chain.


Note: Prototype shown in video, production unit will operate more elegantly

Requirements

  • The height of the toilet lid must be higher than the top of the tank (see below)
  • The tank wall must be vertical like a standard toilet
 

Note: LidFlush may not work with some artisan toilets due to tank design.

Q. Will LidFlush permanently alter my toilet?
A. No. LidFlush is a retrofit product which can be removed without damage to your toilet.

Q. How does LidFlush attach to my toilet?
A. A plastic tether guide rests on top of the tank wall, and a metal disk is affixed to the toilet lid using a removable adhesive.

Q. Can I put the lid down without flushing to save water?
A. Yes, the production unit will have a flush optional function built-in.
Q. I am concerned about the gap between the lid and tank.
A. The production unit will be significantly refined to minimize the gap. In addition, an optional decorative trim will be provided to close any remaining gap. The gap is required to allow the tether to move freely.

The Impact

The Hygiene
in 1975 Dr. Charles Gerba (known widely as Dr Germ) released a research paper on the microbiological hazards of household toilets. Referred to as the "Toilet Plume" Clostridium difficile, which is known to cause diarrhea, is sprayed 25 centimeters, or nearly 10 inches, above the toilet seat when you flush without putting the lid down, This aerosolized bacteria persists in the air for 12 minutes after flushing with the toilet lid open.
The Harmony

LidFlush provides one less point of contention for couples and families. By fundamentally changing the way the toilet flushes (making the lid the flush lever), nobody has to give anything up and everyone wins.

We have designed LidFlush to be easy to install by anyone with a pair of plyers (if needed) and no technical expertise. By lowering the barrier for adoption, we believe we are further empowering those who wish to promote better cleanliness in the bathroom.

Additional benefits are provided including :

  • Suppression of aerosolized bacteria
  • Better aesthetic appearance of restroom
  • Keeps pets and children out of toilet

 

Video: The Toilet Plume

What We Need & What You Get

We've made the initial investment in the product, including prototyping, live testing, and focus groups. Now we need to overcome the initial manufacturing and start up costs, including :

  • Design and machine injection molds
  • Patent and legal expenses
  • Website, ecommerce, and marketing costs
  • Initial product run to fulfill reward perks
  • Shipping and packaging expenses
  • Misc business expenses

We've determined the minimum costs required to go into production, fulfill perks, and start selling LidFlush directly to the public through our ecommerce website. Once successful, our next goal is to bring LidFlush to retail stores nationwide and ultimately to a global market.

The price of the perks is similar to the projected retail price plus shipping. Your contribution will allow us to go directly to market when the perks are fulfilled.

If we are unable to achieve our funding goal, the funds collected will be prioritized toward the initial manufacturing costs (making molds) and conducting our first production run to fulfill our commitment to you, our supporters.

The Team

People

We are Steve and Chris, a pair of inventors and entrepreneurs who turned a chance encounter into a meaningful union. What started as water cooler chat has become a mission to solve two age old problems.

After 2+ years of design and prototyping, we are ready to bring this revolutionary product to market, with your help of course. Launching a product of any kind is challenging.

We are proud to announce that this product will be manufactured in Santa Cruz, CA. and will also create local jobs in the process. This was a key objective of ours being entrepreneurs with a social mission to support our local community.

Your participation in our campaign will not only allow us to bring this product to market, but will validate the need, and hopefully get some laughs from our video.

Experience
Steve and Chris have both run successful service based businesses both in B2B and B2C markets, and we are both avid problem solvers accustomed to working in lean startup mode. We've taken a serious look at the problems we wanted to solve, and how to engineer the simplest solution (which is usually always the best solution). Based on feedback we have collected in this process, we believe there will be reasonable interest and demand for LidFlush.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk we face is being wrong about the need for this product. You will be the judge. We wouldn't have come this far if we hadn't met people who said "no really, where can I buy one".

The most significant cost is the design and manufacturing of the molds. If the initial product design has any structural flaws (i.e. the plastic is subject to premature failure), the molds will need to be modified (best case) or completely redesigned.

LidFlush is primarily constructed from plastic, and a compound must be flexible enough to bend, yet strong enough not to break. Of course we will conduct extensive tests of the final product prior to delivery, however it will be difficult to accurately simulate the test of time.

We have partnered with a local plastic component manufacturer with 24 years in business who has demonstrated the technical and business competency, including fortune 500 customers. We are confident this was the right choice as a supplier for our plastic components.

The product is designed to have a lifespan similar to the existing flushing mechanisms (i.e. levers). We would of course be obligated to provide replacement units if either of these scenarios were to occur in a short period of time (less than 1-2 years after installation).

Other Ways You Can Help

The easiest way you can help is to promote our campaign to your friends and family via email and social media. We are extremely pleased with the creative work behind our campaign video which we believe will be enjoyed by many and thus easy to promote in your networks.

You can also subscribe to our mailing list so we can keep you updated on the LidFlush campaign and product.

Subscribe to our mailing list

* indicates required
International Shipping and Misc Contributions

If you would like to contribute to our campaign in any amount without a perk, or you need to provide payment for International Shipping.

International shipping for most perks to most Euro countries costs an additional $15 US. Larger perks may require additional shipping fees. If you are outside of the US, we can not guarantee shipping costs will be limited to $15US, and we will contact you via email with additional information.

How to add funds for International Shipping.

After clicking "Contribute Now" and selecting your package (if applicable), be sure to increase the contribution amount in the field above by $15US.

I forgot to pay for international shipping!

No problem. Click on the perk that says "Donate Now" and type in $15US. Please make sure you make this additional contribution under the same email address as the original purchase.

Disclaimers

LidFlush uses PayPal for payments. Per PayPal's crowdfunding guidelines, we must provide the following disclaimers :

LidFlush will make a best effort to provide the campaign rewards (aka "perks"), but delivery is not guaranteed. You are making a contribution to our campaign. Pre-ordering of the LidFlush product is not implied.

story:
I am writing in the name of a person who cannot yet speak for himself and his own life for he is just a child.

Mihai on the left (foto from 2008)

On his innocent face touched by pain, from time to time a shy smile makes its place. He knows he is sick, feels very weak, but still believes that, despite everything, one day he’ll get well.

At the age of only 13 Mihai is fighting a hard battle with cancer. The boy has an aggressive brain tumor (the full diagnosis shows an expansive, recidivating malignant process in the right side of the cerebral falx). The disease was detected at only 7 years when it affected his sight. Mihai's parents say they will never forget this day which changed entirely the life of this family.

The disease has progressed very rapidly since then.  In 2008 the boy has gone through 3 neurosurgical interventions. At just one week from the first intervention the second followed and in June, this year - the third one.

The young boy has long lost the feeling of a normal childhood by spending so much time in hospitals and fighting physical pain.

Mihai lags in growth, has hormonal dysfunctions and after the second operation has also been diagnosed with diabetes insipidus. He also has teeth problems which cause terrible pains and the dentists are afraid to treat him because of the associated risks.

The boy had also a cardiac arrest and was in a state of coma for 3 weeks.

Currently Mihai is going through hell, he can't go out or attend school. The disease has changed him a lot, he cried and was close to entering a depression although this is very unfamiliar for children of his age.

The treatment and the medical interventions carried in the local medical institutions, here in Moldova, attained very little.

"We have been advised to go to Germany for treatment but the prices were excruciating", said Liliana with a sigh, "we just don't have such money. Nevertheless, our consulting doctor has told us that the specialists from a highly equipped, proficient clinic in Turkey can help us in our case. The laser surgery alone would cost about 17.000 euro which is still a lot for our modest budget but we truly hope to gather these money."

story:
Short Summary

 

My name is Bill, My Samantha has been battling cancer for a little over 3 years now. We have tried these fundraisers before and did get a little help. I hope we can do a bit better this time to help Samantha reach her goal at beating cancer. I am her fulltime (unpaid caregiver). We have very little money to make ends meet, let alone pay for prescriptions that are uncovered. I became unemployed due to time spent with Samantha. Samantha receives a small amount of money each month...its just not enough. We are asking for your help.


What We Need & What You Get

 

Samantha's prescriptions are for the terrible pain she endures on a daily basis. The cost is around $2500. a month. Samantha has been on everything so far and this is our last hope. She is currently going through chemo and is looking at a 12 hour surgery in early November. The money raised will go towards the Prescription to alleviate some of her pain..

The Impact

 

 Your contributions will really impact Samantha s quality of life during this crucial time. She has suffered long enough.

Risks & Challenges

 If we are not able to get the drug she needs, we will certainly fall deeper in debt which makes the prospect of losing our home even more dire.

Other Ways You Can Help

If your are unable to donate, we understand. This economy has hit everyone, but if you know someone who may be able to help...please forward our story t them.

story:
Hi, we are ex-students, current students and co-workers of jr. high math teacher, Ms. Cathy Gilbreath who has recently been diagnosed with breast cancer. We're from a small town in West Texas and the nearest hospital to treat her is 120 miles away. Two weeks before Thanksgiving Cathy was in a car accident that required 10 hours of surgery to her neck and back. She is still in the hospital today. Even with her insurance, her medical bills would be unmanagable. 

Cathy has been involved with our school for 20+ years and has had an impact on many students' lives. She is the kind of teacher who would tutor ex-students for free for their college math courses. 

Your contribution would go toward her medical bills and help lift a stressful burden so she can concentrate on getting well. We are asking for what will be about a quarter of her bills.

Your contribution will be making a difference to a teacher's life and the education of her students. For each contribution you will be sent a 'Thank You' and you can return here to this site to hear about Cathy's recovery.

Good math teachers are hard to find, so we need to take care of the ones we've got.

Please share this campaign.

 

Thanks.

story:
Donations for Dan

 

     I would like to tell you about my friend Dan Wile. He is a child of God, son, brother, husband, father, uncle, cousin, friend...and he has Pancreatic Cancer. Since his diagnosis 2 years ago, Dan has not let his cancer define him but rather as an opportunity to experience miracles in his life. He is now in need of more miracles.

     Dan’s story began on a farm in Souderton, PA. By the age of 12 he knew he was here to help others and so he began his career as a Respiratory Therapist by enrolling in the Respiratory Therapy Program at Gwynedd Mercy College. Graduating in 1983, Dan has provided patient care in a variety of areas - teaching hospitals, community hospitals, long term facilities and most recently in home care. His compassion and dedication to his patients has never wavered. Now he is need of that same compassion.

     It was August 2010 that life changed forever for the Wile family. Married to his soul mate Ruth Ann since 1991, the couple has been blessed with two wonderful children: Alex, 19 years old and Sharra, 15 years old. While assisting with Ventilator Camp, Dan began experiencing extreme fatigue and digestive problems.Rapid weight loss over the next few weeks led him to seek answers. The devastating diagnosis of Stage 4 Pancreatic Cancer came quickly. Some sobering facts on Pancreatic Cancer:

 

  1. It is the 4th most common cause of cancer related deaths worldwide
  2. 95% of patients will not be alive in 5 years
  3. Complete remission is rare
  4. In 2010, there were 43,000 cases diagnosed in the US

 

     Standard treatment in the US includes surgery, chemotherapy and radiation therapy. Dan underwent a pancreato-duodenectomy ( Whipple Procedure ) requiring 3 weeks of hospitalization and 6 weeks later began chemotherapy. Dan was not given much hope as to the outcome of treatment and was advised to have his affairs in order. But Dan’s unwavering faith and support of his family and friends provided him with a miracle - his health began to return. He gained weight, his stamina increased and his mission to help others was as strong as ever. He returned to his job with PrO2 Respiratory Services after only 6 months. 

     Dan strove to return to a normal life, to make the most of this gift of more time that he had been given. When an opportunity to change careers was presented to him, he did not hesitate. As the person who replaced him, I can attest to the level of respect and affection of those whom he helped and worked with. He made a difference in the lives of so many people. And then the floor dropped out again. This summer Dan began to lose weight, his energy was not what it once was. Tests revealed the cancer had metastasized to his lungs. The next battle had begun.

     That brings Dan’s story to present day...and how we can all be a part of it. At present, the US medical community cannot offer Dan any viable treatment. His search for hope had led him to Bad Salzhausen, Germany and Dr. Herzog’s Special Hospital for Integrated Oncology and Hyperthermia Center. The clinic has helped many patients with  a treatment consisting of hyperthermia therapy ( up to 107 degrees) and moderate doses of chemotherapy. Dan has been accepted as a patient, his passport is on the way  ...and now the cost. $50,000. His family and friends ask you to consider a donation to help the family defray the costs. He will be in Germany for 3 weeks for treatment and his wife will accompany him. Payments can be given via credit card or Pay Pal on this secure site. I asked Dan what he hoped for as a result of this treatment. He told me “ My daughter is a sophomore in high school; I want to see her graduate college.” 6 years - a father’s wish. Please give what you can... and post this story to your Facebook account, Twitter account, email contact list - just please spread the word. And pray. Peace.

story:
Hi! I'm Dani Slepian, and I'm an HIV/AIDS Certified Registered Nurse from Boston, MA, USA, volunteering for 3 months with the Centre for Popular Education and Human Rights, Ghana, a human rights organization that works with the MSM community (Men who have sex with Men) on HIV education and prevention.

For the past nearly eight years, I've worked with HIV+ gay men at Fenway Health in Boston, New England's largest community health center serving the lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender population.  Having seen the ravages of HIV both personally and professionally over the last twenty years, I am passionate about HIV education and prevention, specifically within the MSM community. 

The Drop in Centre's purpose is to provide stigma (and cost) free care to MSMs for both HIV testing and treatment of STIs (Sexually Transmitted Infections).  The Drop in Centre is open once a week from 9 AM to 5 PM.  By donating to CEPEHRG's Drop in Centre, you will be funding free consultations and medications for MSMs.  The level of stigma these men face from Ghanaian society at large is incredibly high.  MSMs in Ghana seek health care at a much lower rate than the general population.  17% of those testing for HIV are testing positive for the first time.

All the money raised will go to direct care costs.  The full-time nurse who staffs the centre - and diagnoses and treats the patients seen there - is a volunteer.  

The centre only needs $1000 to operate for another 3 months.  I will match the first $250 that's donated.  So, really, we only need to raise $750!

The rate of HIV infection in Ghana is still at about 2%.  By donating to this cause, you are helping to reach the UNAIDS vision of "Zero new HIV infections. Zero discrimination. Zero AIDS-related deaths."

With the extremely generous support of many of you in 2008, we were able to raise over $6,000 for the Gay Men's Domestic Violence Project (now known as the GLBTQ Domestic Violence Project).  I believe that this campaign can be equally successful in reaching its goal.

I realize that not everyone is able to contribute monetarily.  If you aren't able to give at this time, please just help spread the word.  This nifty site, Indiegogo, has share tools - please use them!

Thank you so much for your support!

story:
Hello

My name is Rob and I am the owner of Interlaced Tech. Being a well qualified electronic and computer engineer, with over 13 years experience, I have decided to
put my knowledge of circuitry and computers to good use.

Having trained recently in certain software design disciplines has enabled me to
design and start building this transport safety device but I need your help to
make it become a reality.

I'm a highly motivated individual and passionate about technology. The true focus is the use of new technology to create a better future.

This campaign will help fund my own piece of unique tech to help save lives (and
much more)  in the form of our Remote Emergency Device or R.E.D

You will be able to help me fund the final stages of prototyping, finalising the end
design and safety testing before I look to launch the device on the world
stage.

What I Need & What You Get

I have already invested over £2000 in tools, software and hardware for R.E.D but we have a lot of work to do.

To finalise our prototype safety device will cost £8000 and should take no longer than six months to get a fully functional device up and running. This includes finalising patents.

The remaining funds will help to pay for 

£4000 on additional software creation and licensing
£5000 safety testing and certification

I will be looking to match the initial goal in order to pay for my time as will be committing my full attention to the project. The projects requirements mean I will not
have time to stay in full time employment but need to be able to still provide for my family.

Any funds raised will be able to go into the project but will reduce the impact by
stretching the time to complete the prototype.

Please remember that initial production, testing and sales of R.E.D will only be available in the UK to start with. We will however look to rolling out production and sales to other countries later. We expect this to start no later than one year after full production begins.

Please help and choose from one of the three initial perks of Contibutor, Assistant or Trialist. More perks will be added as the campaign gather momentum.

You will be able to choose/change your perk as they are added dependent on funds raised.

The Impact

With more people using the roads everyday there is also an increasing amount of accidents and thefts of vehicles.

In the UK there is a need for change to help reduce thefts and assist with accident
recovery.

The device proposed in this campaign is aimed at helping with both these
issues.

This new device will be able to once installed:

  1. Report an accident of a serious nature to the emergency services 
  2. Provide the location where the accident has occurred
  3. Provide tracking of a stolen vehicle
  4. Remote engine immobiliser.
  5. To be disclosed once patents secured.
  6. To be disclosed once patents secured.

Additional pre order or after market features:

  1. Accident recording (Black Box)
  2. High definition video playback
  3. Mobile WiFi
  4. Media streaming

Taking advantage of new technology the device will contain:

  1. Small form factor micro computer
  2. Integrated GPS transceiver
  3. Integrated mobile communications
  4. Collision detection sensors
  5. To be disclosed once patents secured.
  6. To be disclosed once patents secured.
  7. To be disclosed once patents secured.

The aim is to keep this initial functionality at a consumer cost of approx £100-£150.
Additional functionality is added at extra cost dependent on the consumers
requirements.

The entire device is small enough to be fitted to any Truck, Car, Motorcycle and even push bike. There are some other unique features that will be implemented into the final prototype and the details of which will be revealed later on.

Apart from push bikes, the device will be integrated into the vehicles engine control
for remote disabling and will be hidden so once fitted it can not be tampered with or disabled by criminals.

Updated information

I would like to add more information with regards to R.E.D and push bikes.

The device has two iterations with one for motorised vehicles and one for
push bikes. The technology for the push bikes is reduced in size and retains
the functionality for accident reporting as well as anti theft tracking
system.

In the unfortunate event that your bike is stolen, you will be able to track
the device anywhere in the world via the applications. We are working
on an new on-board battery that will last at least one month before
needing a recharge.

Stretch Goals

 £50,000

I will be able to start a limited production run of the first 200 R.E.D systems for
wider scale testing and integration. If we reach this stage you will have the chance to choose a perk for £100 to give you one of these first devices and help us with this testing phase.

More stretch goals will be added later as a clear project timeline is in place dependent on how much we can invest.

This will include looking into the Home Emergency System (H.E.S) 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help my cause any way you can, let your friends and family know, spread the word on social sites and include use of the tools available from Indiegogo such as simply sharing the link.

story:
Our Story

My brother, David, was in a horrible freak car accident when he was heading home from the store.  There was a lady traveling in the opposite direction that hit a sign causing it and more importantly its base to come into my brother's lane.  The sign base came through the roof of the truck he was driving right at the top of the windshield hitting him in the face and chest.  Luckily for David, our father was in the truck and immediately performed first aid and got life flight immediately dispatched.  He ended up with a broken neck (luckily no paralysis), a pulverized jaw, a broken clavicle, a broken scapula and many other injuries.  He has fought back and is in stable condition and will soon be released to go home.  He now begins a long recovery process which will include multiple surgeries and an estimated year recovery time to be back to a medical device and procedure free lifestyle.


The Impact

David's family consists of himself, his wife Keely (of three years) and his brand new baby Evelyn who was born in June.  With the blessing of a new child, they purchased a new home in Stansbury Park in August and were building their dream life.  His job has promised to hold his spot, but he is a dispatcher which requires him to be on the phone and to be running multiple computers, scanners, and phones all at the same time so he isn't likely to be able to return to work until this surgeries are all complete.  This puts him and his wife in a serious income crunch has he hasn't worked at his current job long enough to receive long term disability through his employer.  This puts a strain on all the families involved as we try and sacrifice and find the money to keep their mortgage payments paid and food for him and his baby.  My aunt had saw this site on television so her and I decided to see if we could try and raise money to help them with their mortgage payments.


What We Need & What You Get

What we are looking for is enough money to give to David and Keely so that their mortgage can be paid for the next year while David is rehabbing and trying to get back to his job.  His mortgage is roughly $1,100 a month and so $1,100 x 12 months = our $13,200 goal.  Donations will go only for their mortgage payments and if David is able to return to work before a year he would gladly refund money to those people who helped him out.   Donors will be given updates frequently about David and how he is doing as well as all the thanks that our family can give.  (Not to mention an untold amount of good karma).


Other Ways You Can Help

Prayers, prayers and more prayers.  My brother has been powered by prayer since his accident on Thursday December 29th, 2011.  There is also a donation account set up for David at U.S. Bank and people can make donations there.  Also, if you have other ideas about how you could help their family would love to hear about it.  Please shoot me an email and we can discuss anything you would like: richard.sohler@gmail.com.  Thank you for taking the time to read this.

story:
Healthcare QB is the first web and mobile application that empowers users to manage their own medical records, schedule doctor appointments, and keep track of diet and exercise - all in a convenient and secure manner.

With your support, Healthcare QB will be the hub where doctors and patients gather to exchange data, products and services.  No other platform gives all of the stakeholders in the health care industry a single landing point where they can connect and benefit from each other. 

Healthcare QB - changing the world, one patient at a time.

 

 

Spanish

Healthcare QB es la primera aplicación web y móvil que permite a los usuarios gestionar sus propios registros médicos, programar citas con el médico, y realizar un seguimiento de la dieta y el ejercicio - todo de una manera cómoda y segura.

Con su apoyo, Healthcare QB será el centro donde los médicos y los pacientes se reúnen para intercambiar datos, productos y servicios. Ninguna otra plataforma da a todos los interesados en la industria del cuidado de la salud de un único punto de aterrizaje donde pueden conectarse y beneficiarse mutuamente.

Healthcare QB - cambiar el mundo, un paciente a la vez.

French

Healthcare QB est la première web et application mobile qui permet aux utilisateurs de gérer leurs propres dossiers médicaux, planifier des rendez-vous médicaux, et de garder trace de l'alimentation et de l'exercice - tous d'une manière pratique et sûr.

Avec votre soutien, Healthcare QB sera la plaque tournante où les médecins et les patients se réunissent pour échanger des données, des produits et des services. Aucune autre plate-forme donne tous les intervenants dans l'industrie des soins de santé un point d'atterrissage unique où ils peuvent se connecter et profiter les uns des autres.

Healthcare QB - changer le monde, un seul patient à la fois.

Simplified Chinese


醫療保健QB是第一的網絡和移動應用程序，它使用戶能夠管理自己的病歷，安排預約醫生，飲食和運動跟踪 - 所有在一個方便，安全的方式。

有了您的支持，醫療保健QB將是那裡的醫生和病人聚集的數據交換，產品和服務的樞紐。沒有其他平台給所有的利益相關者，在醫療保健行業的一個單一的登陸點，在那裡他們可以彼此連接，並從中受益。

醫療QB - 改變世界，同一個病人在同一時間。

 

 

Russian

Здоровье QB является первым веб-и мобильных приложений, которая позволяет пользователю управлять своей собственной медицинской документации, графика назначений доктора, и следить за диетой и физическими упражнениями - все это в удобной и безопасным способом.

С вашей поддержкой, здравоохранения QB будет центр, где врачи и пациенты собираются, чтобы обменяться данными, продукцией и услугами. Ни одна другая платформа не дает всем заинтересованным сторонам в отрасли здравоохранения одной точке посадки, где они могут подключаться и получать выгоду друг от друга.

Здоровье QB - изменение мира, у одного пациента одновременно.

 

 

German

Healthcare QB ist der erste Web-und Mobile-Anwendung, die Benutzern, ihre eigenen medizinischen Aufzeichnungen verwalten, planen Arzttermine, und behalten Ernährung und Bewegung ermöglicht - alles in einem bequemen und sicheren Art und Weise.

Mit Ihrer Unterstützung wird Healthcare QB die Nabe wo Ärzte und Patienten zu sammeln, um Daten, Produkte und Dienstleistungen auszutauschen. Keine andere Plattform bietet allen Akteuren im Gesundheitswesen eine einzige Landung Punkt, wo sie verbinden und können voneinander profitieren.

Healthcare QB - die Welt zu verändern, ein Patient zu einem Zeitpunkt.

Arabic

الرعاية الصحية QB هو الأول على شبكة الإنترنت وتطبيقات الهاتف المتحرك التي تمكن المستخدمين من إدارة السجلات الطبية الخاصة بهم، وجدولة المواعيد طبيب، وتتبع نظام غذائي وممارسة التمارين الرياضية - كل بطريقة مريحة وآمنة.

مع دعمكم، وسوف الصحية QB تكون مركزا حيث الأطباء والمرضى جمع لتبادل البيانات والنواتج والخدمات. لا منصة أخرى يعطي كل من أصحاب المصلحة في صناعة الرعاية الصحية نقطة هبوط واحد حيث يمكنهم التواصل والاستفادة من بعضهم البعض.

الرعاية الصحية QB - تغيير العالم، ومريض واحد في وقت واحد.

 

 

Japanese

すべてを便利で安全な方法で - ヘルスケアQBは最初のWebユーザーは、自分の医療記録を管理し、医師の予定をスケジュールし、食事や運動を追跡するために支援し、モバイルアプリケーションです。

あなたのサポートにより、ヘルスケアQBは、医師と患者は、データ、製品やサービスを交換するために集めるハブになります。他のプラットフォームは、ヘルスケア業界、彼らは互いに接続し、恩恵を受けることができ、単一の着地点で利害関係者のすべてを与えない。

ヘルスケアQB - 、一度に一人の患者が世界を変える。

 

 

Korean

모두를 편리하고 안전한 방법으로 - 의료 QB는 첫 번째 웹 및 사용자가 자신의 의료 기록을 관리하는 의사 약속을 예약하고,식이 요법과 운동을 추적하기 위해 힘을 실어 모바일 응용 프로그램입니다.

귀 하의 지원과 함께, 의료 QB는 의사와 환자 데이터, 제품과 서비스를 교환하기 위해 수집 허브 될 것입니다. 다른 플랫폼은 의료 산업들이 서로 연결하고 혜택을 누릴 수있는 하나의 착륙 지점에서의 모든 이해 관계자를 제공하지 않습니다.

건강 QB - 한 번에 한 환자의 세계를 변화.

 

 

Italian

Sanità QB è il primo web e un'applicazione mobile che consente agli utenti di gestire le proprie cartelle cliniche, pianificare visite mediche, e tenere traccia di dieta ed esercizio fisico - il tutto in un modo conveniente e sicuro.

Con il vostro supporto, Sanità QB sarà l'hub in cui medici e pazienti si riuniscono per scambiare dati, prodotti e servizi. Nessun'altra piattaforma offre tutti i soggetti interessati nel settore sanitario un unico punto di approdo in cui possono collegarsi e beneficiare gli uni dagli altri.

Sanità QB - cambiare il mondo, un paziente alla volta.

 

 

Hebrew

בריאות QB הוא באינטרנט ויישומים ניידים הראשון שמקנים למשתמשים לנהל תיקים הרפואיים שלהם, לוח הזמנים תור אצל רופא, ולעקוב אחר דיאטה ופעילות גופנית - כל זאת בצורה נוחה ומאובטחת.

עם התמיכה שלך, בריאות QB יהיה הרכזת שבו רופאים ומטופלים לאסוף להחליף נתונים, מוצרים ושירותים. פלטפורמה אחרת לא נותנת את כל בעלי העניין בתעשיית בריאות נקודת נחיתה יחידה בו הם יכולים להתחבר וליהנות אחד מהשני.

בריאות QB - לשנות את העולם, חולה אחד בכל פעם.

 

 

Portuguese

Saúde QB é o primeiro web e aplicativos móveis que permite que os usuários gerenciem seus próprios registros médicos, agendar consultas médicas, e manter o controle de dieta e exercício - tudo em uma forma conveniente e segura.

Com seu apoio, Saúde QB será o hub, onde os médicos e os pacientes se reúnem para troca de dados, produtos e serviços. Nenhuma outra plataforma dá a todos os interessados na indústria de cuidados de saúde a ponto de desembarque único onde eles podem se conectar e se beneficiar de outro.

Saúde QB - mudando o mundo, um paciente de cada vez.



Greek

Healthcare QB είναι το πρώτο web και mobile εφαρμογή που επιτρέπει στους χρήστες να διαχειρίζονται τα δικά ιατρικά αρχεία τους, το χρονοδιάγραμμα τους διορισμούς του γιατρού, και να παρακολουθείτε της διατροφής και της άσκησης - όλα σε ένα βολικό και ασφαλή τρόπο.

Με την υποστήριξή σας, Healthcare QB θα είναι το κομβικό σημείο όπου οι γιατροί και οι ασθενείς συγκεντρώνονται για να ανταλλάσσουν δεδομένα, τα προϊόντα και τις υπηρεσίες. Καμιά άλλη πλατφόρμα δίνει όλα τα ενδιαφερόμενα μέρη στον τομέα της υγειονομικής περίθαλψης ένα ενιαίο σημείο προσγείωσης όπου μπορούν να συνδεθούν και να επωφεληθούν από κάθε άλλο.

Healthcare QB - αλλάζει τον κόσμο, ένας ασθενής σε ένα χρόνο.
story_txt:
Healthcare QB is the first web and mobile application that empowers users to manage their own medical records, schedule doctor appointments, and keep track of diet and exercise - all in a convenient and secure manner.
With your support, Healthcare QB will be the hub where doctors and patients gather to exchange data, products and services.  No other platform gives all of the stakeholders in the health care industry a single landing point where they can connect and benefit from each other. 
Healthcare QB - changing the world, one patient at a time.

 
 
Spanish
Healthcare QB es la primera aplicación web y móvil que permite a los usuarios gestionar sus propios registros médicos, programar citas con el médico, y realizar un seguimiento de la dieta y el ejercicio - todo de una manera cómoda y segura.
Con su apoyo, Healthcare QB será el centro donde los médicos y los pacientes se reúnen para intercambiar datos, productos y servicios. Ninguna otra plataforma da a todos los interesados en la industria del cuidado de la salud de un único punto de aterrizaje donde pueden conectarse y beneficiarse mutuamente.
Healthcare QB - cambiar el mundo, un paciente a la vez.
French
Healthcare QB est la première web et application mobile qui permet aux utilisateurs de gérer leurs propres dossiers médicaux, planifier des rendez-vous médicaux, et de garder trace de l'alimentation et de l'exercice - tous d'une manière pratique et sûr.
Avec votre soutien, Healthcare QB sera la plaque tournante où les médecins et les patients se réunissent pour échanger des données, des produits et des services. Aucune autre plate-forme donne tous les intervenants dans l'industrie des soins de santé un point d'atterrissage unique où ils peuvent se connecter et profiter les uns des autres.
Healthcare QB - changer le monde, un seul patient à la fois.
Simplified Chinese
醫療保健QB是第一的網絡和移動應用程序，它使用戶能夠管理自己的病歷，安排預約醫生，飲食和運動跟踪 - 所有在一個方便，安全的方式。
有了您的支持，醫療保健QB將是那裡的醫生和病人聚集的數據交換，產品和服務的樞紐。沒有其他平台給所有的利益相關者，在醫療保健行業的一個單一的登陸點，在那裡他們可以彼此連接，並從中受益。
醫療QB - 改變世界，同一個病人在同一時間。
 
 
Russian
Здоровье QB является первым веб-и мобильных приложений, которая позволяет пользователю управлять своей собственной медицинской документации, графика назначений доктора, и следить за диетой и физическими упражнениями - все это в удобной и безопасным способом.
С вашей поддержкой, здравоохранения QB будет центр, где врачи и пациенты собираются, чтобы обменяться данными, продукцией и услугами. Ни одна другая платформа не дает всем заинтересованным сторонам в отрасли здравоохранения одной точке посадки, где они могут подключаться и получать выгоду друг от друга.
Здоровье QB - изменение мира, у одного пациента одновременно.
 
 
German
Healthcare QB ist der erste Web-und Mobile-Anwendung, die Benutzern, ihre eigenen medizinischen Aufzeichnungen verwalten, planen Arzttermine, und behalten Ernährung und Bewegung ermöglicht - alles in einem bequemen und sicheren Art und Weise.
Mit Ihrer Unterstützung wird Healthcare QB die Nabe wo Ärzte und Patienten zu sammeln, um Daten, Produkte und Dienstleistungen auszutauschen. Keine andere Plattform bietet allen Akteuren im Gesundheitswesen eine einzige Landung Punkt, wo sie verbinden und können voneinander profitieren.
Healthcare QB - die Welt zu verändern, ein Patient zu einem Zeitpunkt.
Arabic
الرعاية الصحية QB هو الأول على شبكة الإنترنت وتطبيقات الهاتف المتحرك التي تمكن المستخدمين من إدارة السجلات الطبية الخاصة بهم، وجدولة المواعيد طبيب، وتتبع نظام غذائي وممارسة التمارين الرياضية - كل بطريقة مريحة وآمنة.
مع دعمكم، وسوف الصحية QB تكون مركزا حيث الأطباء والمرضى جمع لتبادل البيانات والنواتج والخدمات. لا منصة أخرى يعطي كل من أصحاب المصلحة في صناعة الرعاية الصحية نقطة هبوط واحد حيث يمكنهم التواصل والاستفادة من بعضهم البعض.
الرعاية الصحية QB - تغيير العالم، ومريض واحد في وقت واحد.
 
 
Japanese
すべてを便利で安全な方法で - ヘルスケアQBは最初のWebユーザーは、自分の医療記録を管理し、医師の予定をスケジュールし、食事や運動を追跡するために支援し、モバイルアプリケーションです。
あなたのサポートにより、ヘルスケアQBは、医師と患者は、データ、製品やサービスを交換するために集めるハブになります。他のプラットフォームは、ヘルスケア業界、彼らは互いに接続し、恩恵を受けることができ、単一の着地点で利害関係者のすべてを与えない。
ヘルスケアQB - 、一度に一人の患者が世界を変える。
 
 
Korean
모두를 편리하고 안전한 방법으로 - 의료 QB는 첫 번째 웹 및 사용자가 자신의 의료 기록을 관리하는 의사 약속을 예약하고,식이 요법과 운동을 추적하기 위해 힘을 실어 모바일 응용 프로그램입니다.
귀 하의 지원과 함께, 의료 QB는 의사와 환자 데이터, 제품과 서비스를 교환하기 위해 수집 허브 될 것입니다. 다른 플랫폼은 의료 산업들이 서로 연결하고 혜택을 누릴 수있는 하나의 착륙 지점에서의 모든 이해 관계자를 제공하지 않습니다.
건강 QB - 한 번에 한 환자의 세계를 변화.
 
 
Italian
Sanità QB è il primo web e un'applicazione mobile che consente agli utenti di gestire le proprie cartelle cliniche, pianificare visite mediche, e tenere traccia di dieta ed esercizio fisico - il tutto in un modo conveniente e sicuro.
Con il vostro supporto, Sanità QB sarà l'hub in cui medici e pazienti si riuniscono per scambiare dati, prodotti e servizi. Nessun'altra piattaforma offre tutti i soggetti interessati nel settore sanitario un unico punto di approdo in cui possono collegarsi e beneficiare gli uni dagli altri.
Sanità QB - cambiare il mondo, un paziente alla volta.
 
 
Hebrew
בריאות QB הוא באינטרנט ויישומים ניידים הראשון שמקנים למשתמשים לנהל תיקים הרפואיים שלהם, לוח הזמנים תור אצל רופא, ולעקוב אחר דיאטה ופעילות גופנית - כל זאת בצורה נוחה ומאובטחת.
עם התמיכה שלך, בריאות QB יהיה הרכזת שבו רופאים ומטופלים לאסוף להחליף נתונים, מוצרים ושירותים. פלטפורמה אחרת לא נותנת את כל בעלי העניין בתעשיית בריאות נקודת נחיתה יחידה בו הם יכולים להתחבר וליהנות אחד מהשני.
בריאות QB - לשנות את העולם, חולה אחד בכל פעם.
 
 
Portuguese
Saúde QB é o primeiro web e aplicativos móveis que permite que os usuários gerenciem seus próprios registros médicos, agendar consultas médicas, e manter o controle de dieta e exercício - tudo em uma forma conveniente e segura.
Com seu apoio, Saúde QB será o hub, onde os médicos e os pacientes se reúnem para troca de dados, produtos e serviços. Nenhuma outra plataforma dá a todos os interessados na indústria de cuidados de saúde a ponto de desembarque único onde eles podem se conectar e se beneficiar de outro.
Saúde QB - mudando o mundo, um paciente de cada vez.Greek
Healthcare QB είναι το πρώτο web και mobile εφαρμογή που επιτρέπει στους χρήστες να διαχειρίζονται τα δικά ιατρικά αρχεία τους, το χρονοδιάγραμμα τους διορισμούς του γιατρού, και να παρακολουθείτε της διατροφής και της άσκησης - όλα σε ένα βολικό και ασφαλή τρόπο.
Με την υποστήριξή σας, Healthcare QB θα είναι το κομβικό σημείο όπου οι γιατροί και οι ασθενείς συγκεντρώνονται για να ανταλλάσσουν δεδομένα, τα προϊόντα και τις υπηρεσίες. Καμιά άλλη πλατφόρμα δίνει όλα τα ενδιαφερόμενα μέρη στον τομέα της υγειονομικής περίθαλψης ένα ενιαίο σημείο προσγείωσης όπου μπορούν να συνδεθούν και να επωφεληθούν από κάθε άλλο.
Healthcare QB - αλλάζει τον κόσμο, ένας ασθενής σε ένα χρόνο.

story:
Ovarian Cancer Adult Stem Cell Vaccine Trial

Breast cancer has a 90% 5 year cure rate.  Ovarian cancer has only a 30% 5 year cure rate.  Breast cancers high cure rates are high due to the fact that most breast
cancers grow slowly and mammograms detect those cancers early when they are
small and have not spread widely.  On the other hand, ovarian cancer spreads quickly and there is no effective screening to detect ovarian cancer early.  As a result, ovarian patients are usually diagnosed with an abdomen full of cancer. 

Our group, Nancy Yeary Women’s Cancer Research Foundation (NYWCRF) is working with a California biotech company on a project to isolate stem cells from our ovarian cancer patient’s tumors.  We believe these few stem cells act as the “mother cells” or “drivers” for the millions of other cancer cells these patients develop.  Using twenty years of basic research, a vaccine has been developed that we believe may knock out ovarian cancer stem cells and in turn increase cure rates.  A similar vaccine has proven effective in treating melanoma cancer patients.

This will be a first in the world trial.  Our pilot site is in California and will treat about 190 patients.  Each patient will have an individual vaccine made from their own cancer stem cells.  We expect to start treating patients in 3-6 months.  Patients from
anywhere can enroll and be treated.  They will all receive standard treatment plus the vaccine.  We expect the vaccines to have minimal side effects.  If this vaccine improves the cure rates for ovarian cancer patients it is likely the technique will work for other types of cancer.

The Foundation’s physicians treat more ovarian cancer patients than any other group on the West Coast.  The physician researchers all work for free. We need to raise $500,000.00 to fund this trial. We are looking to Indiegogo donors to fund $50,000.00
of that startup cost.  The Chairman of the foundation has agreed to match your donation.  Your donations are tax deductible as NYWCRF is a 501(3)(c) non-profit foundation.  Our physicians and patients are our largest donors. 
We cannot do this on our own, so we need your help!

 

Sincerely,

John Paul Micha, M.D.
Chairman of WCRF


 

Nancy Yeary Women’s Cancer Research Foundation Contact Info:

*Website: http://www.nancycancer.com


*Address:

Women’s Cancer Research Foundation

351Hospital Road,  Suite 506

Newport Beach California, 92663


*Office Phone Number-949-642-5165

*Janet Rae, Executive Director-Extension 247 and Email:  Janet@gynoncology.com

*Bram Goldstein, Senior Research Fellow-Extension 265

*Katrina Lopez, CCRC-Extension 259

*Elliott Micha, Creative Director-Extension 257

story:
The Girl with the Curl & Curls for Kids

Who we are

Hi, I’m Rosemary, a Registered Nurse, music artist, and cancer survivor (you can learn more about me at rosemaryphelan.com). This campaign is my effort to bring comfort to some of the two million kids, teens, and adults who will undergo chemotherapy and/or radiation this year because of a cancer diagnosis. Jessica and Wendi work with me to help make this vision a reality (go team)!

 The Girl with the Curl and the Curls for Kids campaign were founded with the intention of solving a simple but profound problem in the cancer community: finding an ideal solution to the hair loss that accompanies chemotherapy. This might seem like a minor issue in the face of something as dire as a cancer diagnosis, but go on any cancer chat group and you’ll quickly see how much discomfort and distress people suffer over this unfortunate side effect of their treatment. Having been through it myself, I now understand why.

The problem we set out to solve

 “Cancer hats” and “chemo scarves” are like a flashing sign announcing “I have cancer!” They do nothing to help protect one’s health privacy. Wigs are too uncomfortable (or even downright painful) on a chemo-sensitive scalp, which often feels “sunburned”. Cancer patients spend tons of money on them (those that have it) and mostly can’t bear to wear them. And it’s important to mention that many families affected by cancer can’t afford any of those alternatives, and the options that are available for free are very limited. Kids and teens especially need a better solution, as their hair is so important to their sense of identity.

 Enter The Girl with the Curl Demi-Wig Kit. Here’s how it works: the kit provides everything a chemo patient (or their mom or dad) needs to make a comfortable, beautiful demi-wig from their own hair. The hair is cut at home or the salon (using a special method) after the first chemo treatment, just before it begins to fall out. The very simple kit (no sewing) can be made up the same day and worn the next, which means there’s no “bald time” at all. It can then be worn with almost any type of hat. Simple and inexpensive, but profoundly comforting and empowering. I came up with this idea when I was going through chemo myself, and can attest to it’s practicality, comfort, and effectiveness. That’s what made me determined to create a kit for everyone else who wants to do this for themselves or a loved one.

How you can be part of the solution

 Here’s why The Girl with the Curl needs you: because we cannot afford to offer these kits for free, we can’t advertise them to the very population who needs them in places where they would easily find the information: cancer groups and help sites, hospitals, etc. Take a look and  you’ll see that all the goods and services that are offered through these venues are free of cost. Which is awesome, but we’re not there yet. That’s where you come in. Hopefully someday we will have some corporate sponsors to cover our costs so we CAN offer the kits for free. Until that time, my team and are willing to work our buns off making up kits and getting them out to the folks who need them (and maybe can’t pay for them), but to do so we need to buy the materials, pay for shipping, sewing, etc., etc. You can see our dilemma.

 Every $35 donation pays all the costs of getting one of our fantastic kits made and shipped off to a child or adult in need. Every donated kit will link the recipient with the donor (unless the donor wishes to remain anonymous), so the recipient can send a thank you (and maybe even a photo!), and tell the donor about themselves and what the kit means to them. We’re not (yet) a non-profit org, but you’ll also get a donation receipt from us for your records.

 If your feeling us but just don’t have the funds to donate, maybe you can share this campaign info with someone who’s got a few dollars to spare. We’d be deeply grateful to you for that. Or just send them on over to thegirlwiththecurl.com, where they can donate through the “donate” page on the site in any amount they wish – even $10 is a help.

Thank you!

 Thanks so much for your time. We hope you never need one of our kits yourself, but if you do, we’re here for you.  J  Rosemary, Jessica, and Wendi. xo

story:
Here's How It Works

Research shows that over 97% of the digital content ("the buzz") we get is considered by us to be junk. BuzzChek eliminates this junk through it's Peer Group Evaluation system, providing you with only the content you want to get.  Peer Group Evaluation, the patent-pending key to BuzzChek, is simply having like-minded people evaluate the content coming at you and screening the good from the bad. This group is constantly changing and it's composed of different people from topic to topic but all of the members have one thing in common.. they are interested and knowledgeable in that particular topic.

BuzzChek is part programming, and part human interaction.  The human part involves digital communication and decision making that occurs billions of times a day.  The programming will allow BuzzChek to grade the accuracy of these human decisions and pass on to the user only the vital information they want to receive. Any member of BuzzChek can select as many topics of interest as they want from an existing list of categories or they can create their own topics. When digital content arrives at BuzzChek, it is placed under a particular Category already on the member's personal list.

Here's how it works: First, digital content is sent to BuzzChek from various sources across the web and indexed under a Category. Filters block any redundant or offensive materials and sends approved content to the topic's Peer Group, or Chekkers, for each Category. The Chekkers review the approved content and are asked to vote it up or down. BuzzChek tallies the Chekkers' votes and decides where to the pass the content. A negative rating sends content to the Archives section of the Category. A positive rating approves the content which is then sent to you.


                                           BuzzChekEXP                                            

The BuzzChekEXP module uses the same patent-pending, ground-breaking algorithm that powers the highly accurate BuzzChek program. BuzzChekEXP is an ad-free, paid subscription to all that BuzzChek has to offer PLUS allows users to select inquiries concerning events that are of interest to a large number of people. And while no one can perfectly predict the future, expert insight and computer programming science will actively generate a definitive prediction of an upcoming event that is as close to accurate as is now humanly possible. 

Is it foolproof? No, but it has the highest opportunity to be correct than any other method available!

Maybe you don't have the time or means to do your own hard research and make an educated prediction on some future event. BuzzChekEXP does! The inquiry is presented to a group of individuals knowledgable in that particular subject and these individuals have also been rated and ranked based on the accuracy of their previous answers and are given priority scores that are weighted in the final answer.

Nobody can perfectly predict the future, but BuzzChekEXP module comes the closest to accurately foretelling the results of sporting events (such as football games), publicly traded investments, geo-politics or any other public-wide event.  


What We Need

The programming part has been wire-framed (blueprinted) but the company we started right here in Georgia needs some financial help to complete each module and quickly release the product.  So please help us build and launch this proprietary new technology. The launch goal of $95,000 (this is where you come in!) will allow us to fund the programming and launch the live website.


Our Favorite Perk:

                 

A donation of $75 or more will earn you a one-of-a-kind BuzzChek coffee mug! Everyone knows "coffee makes everything better"!


                  Advertisement for Businesses: 

Advertising revenue on the Internet is growing rapidly and is quickly outpacing the growth rate of any other medium. BuzzChek is one of the best targeted marketing vehicles ever conceived. Each category that a member selects indicates an interest in the Category and that interest translates into sales for the advertiser. From global to local interests, BuzzChek can collect significant revenues by delivering to these companies the Holy Grail of advertising - guaranteed highly-interested customers.
story_txt:
Here's How It WorksResearch shows that over 97% of the digital content ("the buzz") we get is considered by us to be junk. BuzzChek eliminates this junk through it's Peer Group Evaluation system, providing you with only the content you want to get.  Peer Group Evaluation, the patent-pending key to BuzzChek, is simply having like-minded people evaluate the content coming at you and screening the good from the bad. This group is constantly changing and it's composed of different people from topic to topic but all of the members have one thing in common.. they are interested and knowledgeable in that particular topic.BuzzChek is part programming, and part human interaction.  The human part involves digital communication and decision making that occurs billions of times a day.  The programming will allow BuzzChek to grade the accuracy of these human decisions and pass on to the user only the vital information they want to receive. Any member of BuzzChek can select as many topics of interest as they want from an existing list of categories or they can create their own topics. When digital content arrives at BuzzChek, it is placed under a particular Category already on the member's personal list.Here's how it works: First, digital content is sent to BuzzChek from various sources across the web and indexed under a Category. Filters block any redundant or offensive materials and sends approved content to the topic's Peer Group, or Chekkers, for each Category. The Chekkers review the approved content and are asked to vote it up or down. BuzzChek tallies the Chekkers' votes and decides where to the pass the content. A negative rating sends content to the Archives section of the Category. A positive rating approves the content which is then sent to you.                                           BuzzChekEXP                                            The BuzzChekEXP module uses the same patent-pending, ground-breaking algorithm that powers the highly accurate BuzzChek program. BuzzChekEXP is an ad-free, paid subscription to all that BuzzChek has to offer PLUS allows users to select inquiries concerning events that are of interest to a large number of people. And while no one can perfectly predict the future, expert insight and computer programming science will actively generate a definitive prediction of an upcoming event that is as close to accurate as is now humanly possible. Is it foolproof? No, but it has the highest opportunity to be correct than any other method available!Maybe you don't have the time or means to do your own hard research and make an educated prediction on some future event. BuzzChekEXP does! The inquiry is presented to a group of individuals knowledgable in that particular subject and these individuals have also been rated and ranked based on the accuracy of their previous answers and are given priority scores that are weighted in the final answer.Nobody can perfectly predict the future, but BuzzChekEXP module comes the closest to accurately foretelling the results of sporting events (such as football games), publicly traded investments, geo-politics or any other public-wide event.  What We Need
The programming part has been wire-framed (blueprinted) but the company we started right here in Georgia needs some financial help to complete each module and quickly release the product.  So please help us build and launch this proprietary new technology. The launch goal of $95,000 (this is where you come in!) will allow us to fund the programming and launch the live website.Our Favorite Perk:                 A donation of $75 or more will earn you a one-of-a-kind BuzzChek coffee mug! Everyone knows "coffee makes everything better"!                  Advertisement for Businesses: Advertising revenue on the Internet is growing rapidly and is quickly outpacing the growth rate of any other medium. BuzzChek is one of the best targeted marketing vehicles ever conceived. Each category that a member selects indicates an interest in the Category and that interest translates into sales for the advertiser. From global to local interests, BuzzChek can collect significant revenues by delivering to these companies the Holy Grail of advertising - guaranteed highly-interested customers.

story:
Brave men and women of Ukraine stood up against Russian aggression to defend their land. They are strong and fearless but they are no match to armed to the teeth Russian army. Russia is shelling Ukraine with heavy artillery and rockets with no regard for human life. 

Hundreds Ukrainian soldiers and volunteers died of wounds received after such shellings. BUT some could and should have survived! If only they were able to stop bleeding from their wounds before medics arrived. Unfortunately, they could not. They facts is most soldiers don’t have First Aid Medical Kits on them. Ukrainian army simply does not have money to provide the kits to everyone.

Now. This is where you and me can help. You donation will buy IFAK Medical First Aid Kits for men and women that stood up to defend their land and their freedom from much powerful aggressor.

This is simple equation: 1 IFAC Kit  = 1 Saved Life

Studies show that 60% of preventable combat deaths are caused by severe hemorrhage of extremities, 33% - by tension pneumothorax and 6% - by airway obstruction.

The IFAK increases individual soldier capabilities to provide Self-Aid when injured. IFAK provides interventions for two leading causes of death on the battlefield: severe hemorrhage and inadequate airway. These capabilities increase soldier survivability during dispersed operations. These capabilities can SAVE LIVES 

We can't stop the war but we can save lives. Please donate!

Thank you!


We will buy either complete kits or their

story:
Let's Make Those Memories Count

Linda's just like any other Mum that we love in our lives. The "go to woman" when you've grazed your knee, been dumped by your first love, the only one who cooks the best roast dinner in the whole world or gives the warmest hug, the right time you need that shoulder to cry on. Mum's are brave, forthright, superhuman (especially when carrying 5 bags of shopping in with just one hand) and they don't generally ask anyone for help.  They're our backbones, our support service, the ones who bring us into this world, our taxis. There's nothing more important than Mum.

I'm a friend of Linda's daughter Kelly.  To see Kelly break down a few months ago was hard for me.  She tries to be strong but inside her heart is breaking. Why? Mum Linda has just been diagnosed with stage 4 metastatic secondary cancer. 

Linda who has just turned 60, was originally treated for bowel cancer.  Although this rocked the very foundation that the family were built on, they fought with her.  Side by side, metaphorical shields in hand to beat this bully of a disease.  She was given the all clear.  Until a few months ago.

Diagnosis Not Good

Linda started getting headaches.  At first everyone just thought it was stress and fatigue but shortly after her memory started to fail.  It was then the family urged her to seek assistance in the form of her GP.  Worried it might be something other than just stress the GP sent her for an investigation.  After being poked and prodded, the bad news was broken.  Linda had cancer again.  A small brain tumour was found.  Once again Linda and her family stood firm as a unit, the operation was scheduled and the small tumour removed, but that wasn't the end of it.  A few weeks later she suffered the same - this time it was deadly.  A larger tumour was discovered and it was spreading.

The family are obviously devastated. Linda doesn't have long.  The doctors have given her just a few months.  She's going to leave behind, not only her disabled partner of 41 years but her 5 children and 11 grandchildren whose ages range from 4-18. They need to spend special time with their Nan to make memories that will last their lifetimes.  I know I wish I'd had memories of my Nan before she passed away with cancer.

Linda's final wish is to spend time with her whole family.  One final meal with all her children and her grandchildren in a place where she can escape the every day stress and strains, reminding her of happier times of holidays in the USA.

  • Helping us today, you will be helping to make such a horrible time for one person, turn into happy memories for her to cling to and her children and grandchildren to cherish for the rest of their lifetime.

What We Need

  • Funding for a dinner at Planet Hollywood, London & a theatre show for 18 and transport there and back from where Linda lives.  We've already asked Planet Hollywood to help but they can only give us a discount.  We really need the funding to help make this, her last wish a memory to carry onwards. Should any money be left after we have bought the tickets and dinner, this will then be donated to Macmillan Cancer Support who are helping Linda to cope at such a distressing time.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    I'm not expecting each and every one of you to financially support this campaign, but even if you can put the word out about Linda and her fight, or even ask around for us for more help - everything is appreciated.

    Please help Linda make memories that her children and grandchildren will cherish with her - you won't be just changing one persons life, you'll be touching many, many more.

    Thank you.

story: I am trying to raise as much money as possible so that I can enjoy spending it on the things I like such as fancy pants, massages, cocktails, hats etc...I have no intention of using this money to pay for utility bills or such like...rest assured that 100% of the money that I raise will be spent on the things that I enjoy...

story:
On December 16, 2011, Oliver James Kennedy was born to proud parents Jen Kennedy and Mike Higginson.  Weighing in at over 10lbs, he was promptly nicknamed "Moose".  Mr. O and his mom have been inseparable ever since.  He has been a dear, sweet, quiet lad from the beginning.  Oliver is blessed with a large and loving family here in Alberta, as well as in Saskatchewan and BC.  

August 7, 2014, we received news no family should ever hear.  Our Oliver was diagnosed with a rare genetic neurodegenerative disorder called Metachromatic Leukodystrophy (Late Infantile onset) or MLD for short.  Without going into extensive "medical-speak", this disorder means that Oliver will progressively lose all mental and physical abilities and will be taken from us within a few brutally short years.  

There is no cure and no treatment for MLD.  Caring for a child with MLD is a matter of treating symptoms as they arise and otherwise ensuring comfort and stimulation for as long as possible.  There is no way of  determining the speed at which regression occurs, although our doctors have told us he will likely experience complete regression in all areas by next summer.  6 months ago, Oliver ran about like a typical 2 year old boy.  Today he is unable to even simply sit without complex support.   Most children with MLD pass away by the time they are 5. 

We desperately want Oliver to enjoy as many of the joys and wonders in our world while he is still able to.  We want him to giggle at Disneyland, and gasp as the cold ocean washes over his feet.  We want him to sit in a firetruck, and to see geysers erupt, and to watch the northern lights, and to see dolphins up close.  Oliver loves Cars, especially Lightning McQueen, and airplanes of every shape and size.  He loves Kinder eggs, his cousins, his iPad, and his special friend, Sarah the Dog. We want Oliver to be able to visit with his family in other places as often as possible.  We want him to take a train ride through the mountains and maybe a cruise to watch iceburgs crash into the sea.

Oliver will need medical support for the rest of his life.  We are so fortunate to live in a province and country that will provide for so many basic medical needs, including adaptive equipment.  However, even that pot is limited.  There are many items available that would assist in ensuring that Oliver is as comfortable and safe as possible.  These types of items carry their own version of sticker shock.

It is very difficult to make a decision to ask other people for money.  But after much thought and discussion, as well as strong encouragement from friends and family, we have decided to humbly ask friends and family for funds that will enable us to fulfill Oliver's bucket list, as well as to ensure that we can do everything possible to provide him with the equipment and supports he needs.  

We recognize that not everyone is able to contribute financially.  Like most people, we live paycheck to paycheck, and finding extra can be hard.  Prayers, love, friendship, support, and helping us to share Oliver's story are even more important to us than any dollar amount could ever be.  But for those of you who have expressed a desire to assist financially, we have created this fundraiser as a safe and convenient way to do so.  We promise to use any funds raised in a responsible manner to benefit Oliver for the rest of his life.  After some of the struggles we have already experienced, if there is money left over, we will donate it to an organization that assists in providing pediatric adaptive equipment on a short term basis while waiting for funded equipment.

From all of us, on behalf of Oliver, we offer our deepest and humblest thanks.

story:
My name is Lucy Holdsworth, and not long ago I lost my grandfather to skin cancer. In one of my family's hardest times, Macmillan nurses provided much needed care for him that we could not have provided on our own. Quite simply, without their help, both during his final weeks and after his passing, we would not have made it through. Now it's time for me to give something back.

The aim is to raise £1000, but we're all students here, so the base limit is set to £500. If we make it past that, I will shave my entire head. If we get past £600, I will upload a video of it happening for you to point and laugh at. The hair will be donated to the Little Princess Trust, a charity which makes wigs for children who have lost their own hair through cancer treatment.

All money raised will go directly to Macmillan Cancer Support, so there are no perks for donating a certain amount other than my eternal gratitude (and me being bald for a while).

Thank you for your donations and support. 

http://www.macmillan.org.uk/Home.aspx

story:
Having a congenital heart defect has provided many challenges throughout my life, but I have always tried to remain physically active in one way or another. Like any other challenge in life, there is always an opportunity to learn, grow, change, and adapt, and while the list of lessons I have learned from having a congenital heart defect is long, one lesson has remained a constant fixture throughout: persevere. Whether it’s dealing with a medical issue, or fighting through that last mile on a long run, perseverance is my greatest strength and a lesson I am continually relearning. 

The financial goal for the campaign is to raise $500 USD by November 30, 2014. Any and all donations go directly to ACHA. Donators can take advantage of the great perks that come along with the campaign such as Facebook shout-outs, personalized thank-you messages, ACHA care packages, and special race-day thanks, with your name printed on the back of my race jersey. All of these perks are of course optional and donators are not obligated to claim a perk after donating. Additionally, because ACHA is a 501(c)(3), any donations made to this campaign are tax deductible. This campaign will be a flex funded, which means that if we do not meet our fundraising goal, all donations will still go directly to ACHA, but with a higher percentage claimed by indiegogo. 

    Partnering with the Adult Congenital Heart Association to run five marathons over the next year provides a great opportunity to both push myself physically and benefit a great non-profit organization. The work of ACHA ranges from advocacy work on a congressional level to contributions to research in the cardiovascular health fields. They offer support and educational resources on congenital heart defects for patients and their family members, and provide medical services through their network of ACHA clinics. Having a congenital heart defect myself, I am keenly aware that at times having a congenital heart defect can be confusing, lonely, scary, and intimidating – but also empowering and liberating. The work of the ACHA directly helps those individuals with congenital heart defects, and through this campaign you and I can help support that work, with all proceeds donated going directly to ACHA.

    The most obvious risk that faces the campaign is the risk of injury or illness in the time leading up to the marathon. While this would have little to no impact on the donations to ACHA through the campaign, it would be a major disappointment to the overall stated goal of the campaign. Consequently, I treat the marathon distance with respect with a gradual, well-rounded training program that includes long runs, speed workouts, and cross-training on the bike as well as strength training. I also eat well and listen to my body. This means I take care to build rest days into my routine in order to prevent over-training and injury. While life is life and accidents do happen, I am confident in both my ability and my preparation, and look forward to race day! 

      There are so many ways to be a part of this campaign beyond a financial donation. Some of the ways anybody can help with the campaign include: spreading the word anywhere and everywhere about the campaign, visiting ACHA home page to get involved with and educated on their mission and goals, following the campaign’s and ACHA’s Facebook pages to stay up-to-date on all the latest happenings, and simply being a voice of awareness for those with congenital heart defects. 

      Thank you so much and I look forward to partnering with you.

story:
Visit us today at www.kingii.com.



The most universal, wearable water security device ever created! 

The Kingii is small, non-invasive, reliable and with it's unobtrusive design for the first time providing additional safety in the water in a convenient way.



YOUR HAND AND YOUR FACE ARE PULLED UP - FLOAT ON TOP! 

Purchase your Kingii at www.kingii.com.

The Kingii fits on your wrist, stays out of the way, is rechargeable and is there when you need it most. The smallest inflatable in the world is perfect for every activity and every environment around the water. Whereas it cannot replace a life vest, it can be a great addition to existing security equipment (see our security advise).


  

You like to enjoy your time on the boat? In addition to life vests that you have on your boat, Kingii can provide additional protection (see our security advise). With Kingii you, your friends and your family can be safer on your next trip.

Until now you had nothing protecting you in the water. Kingii is providing you more safety in a non-intrusive way.



Enjoy the time with your partner at the beach and around any water with peace of mind. In case of cramps, circulation problems or other kind of emergency Kingii is providing additional safety (see our security advise).

You love adventures? Kingii is the perfect companion for your adventures in and around the water. 

Kingii is giving you peace of mind during your leisure time. Fishing, kayaking, snorkling or any of your other favorite activities around the water.

Purchase your Kingii at www.kingii.com.

Purchase your Kingii at www.kingii.com. 


Purchase your Kingii at www.kingii.com.

FAQs

Is Kingii a Personal Flotation Device? Can it replace a life-vest?

Kingii is not a Personal Flotation Device (PFD) and cannot replace a life-vest, but it is a recreational water-device. We recommend wearing Kingii as an additional backup device together with an authorized PFD (see our security advise).

Is there an age limitation for using the Kingii?

Kingii’s sleek, unobtrusive, lightweight but durable design makes it perfect for anyone older then 16 years of age. 

What is the Kingii named after, and how do you pronounce the name?

The Kingii (ken-gee) is named after the frilled-neck lizard, or the Chlamydosaurus kingii.  The frilled-neck lizard has a large frill around it’s neck that expands when it’s in trouble - much like our Kingii can inflate when you find yourself in an emergency situation in the water.  Our mascot Kingii George helps remind you about water safety and drowning awareness.

Is the Kingii reusable?

The Kingii is reuseable as many times as needed. Just take out the used Kingii Cylinder, fold the bag back into it’s pouch, screw in the new Kingii CO2 Cylinder and you are ready to get back to the beach, lake, river, pool, or favorite fishing hole!

How many cylinders do I get with the Kingii unit?

Each Kingii unit purchased comes with two Kingii CO2 Cylinders. Additional Kingii CO2 Cylinders are available for purchase through the Indiegogo campaign.

Where can I buy Kingii CO2 Cylinders after the campaign is over?

Shortly after our Indiegogo campaign is over we will open our online store where you can purchase recharge cylinders and other great Kingii products! Supporters of our Indiegogo will be the first to know about new Kingii offerings, and will receive special offers and discounts.

Is there a weight limitation for using the Kingii?

The Kingii is tested and proven to provide buoyancy to an adult in excess of 275 lbs/ 124 kg.

How much does the Kingii weigh?

The Kingii is small but packs a big punch!  At just 4.9 ounces, the Kingii can be worn without interfering with your favorite water activity and is also suitable for children.

Does the Kingii come in different sizes?

The Kingii is available in a “one size fits most“ version currently. The adjustable wristband can easily fit from a small child to a large adult.

Does the Kingii come in different colors?

Currently the Kingii is available with a black adjustable wristband and silver Kingii CO2 Cylinder. Keep an eye out for new Kingii styles and features following our Indiegogo campaign.

Which activities is the Kingii most suited for?

The Kingii was designed to be suitable any kind of water sport. Whether it be swimming, surfing, snorkeling, fishing or stand up paddling, the Kingii is the perfect companion for you.  

Can I use any other type of CO2 cylinder with my Kingii?

For your own safety we do not recommend to use different CO2 Cylinder as the performance of the Kingii may suffer due to loss of pressure or similar. 

Who created your video?

Our video is created by Feedback, LLC.  They can be contacted here www.feedback-llc.com

Get you Kingii at www.kingii.com.
story_txt:
Visit us today at www.kingii.com.

The most universal, wearable water security device ever created! 
The Kingii is small, non-invasive, reliable and with it's unobtrusive design for the first time providing additional safety in the water in a convenient way.







YOUR HAND AND YOUR FACE ARE PULLED UP - FLOAT ON TOP! 


Purchase your Kingii at www.kingii.com.


The Kingii fits on your wrist, stays out of the way, is rechargeable and is there when you need it most. The smallest inflatable in the world is perfect for every activity and every environment around the water. Whereas it cannot replace a life vest, it can be a great addition to existing security equipment (see our security advise).








  

You like to enjoy your time on the boat? In addition to life vests that you have on your boat, Kingii can provide additional protection (see our security advise). With Kingii you, your friends and your family can be safer on your next trip.


Until now you had nothing protecting you in the water. Kingii is providing you more safety in a non-intrusive way.





Enjoy the time with your partner at the beach and around any water with peace of mind. In case of cramps, circulation problems or other kind of emergency Kingii is providing additional safety (see our security advise).

You love adventures? Kingii is the perfect
companion for your adventures in and around the water. 






Kingii is giving you peace of mind during your leisure time. Fishing,
kayaking, snorkling or any of your other favorite activities around the water.
Purchase your Kingii at www.kingii.com.





Purchase your Kingii at www.kingii.com.
